title: Area Manager - Ground Handling Operations
description:
Job Details

Description

  • Providing guidance and expertise to the station management within Canada Region with regards to operational improvement plans, operational efficiency and development.
  • Preparing and coordinating operational project plans related the current business or new projects within the Canada Region.
  • Identifying any operational improvements or gaps through analytical processes and provide clear operational guidance to the station management within the Canada Region.
  • Identifying tools, efficiency solutions or best practices which may significantly improve operational performance, efficiency or maximize revenue.
  • Overseeing the development and implementation of operational internal systems to ensure they are utilised correctly and fully aligned with operational activities (i.e. RSMS, Planning systems, MARS, IPOS, T&A, QlikSense or any other system in use).
  • Ensuring that accurate schedules are maintained and various airline customer SLAs are met through safe, effective and efficient planning of resources in line with company guidelines and local legislation.
  • Ensuring that resource requirements are determined in an efficient and economical manner.
  • Overseeing the operational inputs delivered by the station management to the commercial team while tendering for new business.
  • Ensuring the resource planning is performed and implemented within the Canada Region in a timely manner in order to ensure operational readiness.
  • Ensuring a high level of operational performance and enforcing the message “safety and security are our top priorities”.
  • To ensure consistent and solid communication channels with station management regarding any operational matters.
  • Adhere to / prepare / implement operational procedures within the Canada Region.
  • Oversee the operational performance within the Canada Region and identify any negative trends which might lead to key customer’s dissatisfaction.
  • Preparing and implement any operational improvement or development plans while working in close cooperation with station management within the Canada Region.
  • Providing operational development recommendations
  • Open communication with our key customers and employees.
  • Establish and maintain a safe working environment for employees and customers to comply with Company policy and health, safety and security regulations.
  • Promote a culture of safe working within the Company.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Experience in making accountable decisions on all operational levels.
  • Proven advanced operational experience.
  • Proven experience in working with resource planning / rostering.
  • Strong knowledge on financial tools and working within budgets.
  • Analytical thinker with attention to detail.
  • Must have the ability to multitask and work independently.
  • Strong commercial awareness and exceptional customer relations.
  • Ability to drive multiple work streams and delegate effectively to ensure successful delivery on all levels.
  • Sound knowledge on industry safety standards and regulations.
  • Good knowledge of airline and airport systems.
  • Abel to travel occasionally as requested by the Director of Operations
  • Fluent in all Microsoft packages.
  • Excellent communications skills with employees, management, customers and outside institutions.
  • Relationship building with Airline & Airport Authorities, senior managers and Directors.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Manager, Security Operations and Response
description:
The Greater Toronto Airports Authority (GTAA) is a unique and dynamic place to work. Approximately 1,400 GTAA employees work non-stop with our partners and agencies to deliver a safe and welcoming airport experience at Canada’s leading global hub airport, Toronto Pearson. The impacts of the pandemic have been significant to our industry, yet we remain Pearson Strong and are realizing the opportunity to accelerate our Healthy Airport commitment. Join us on our accelerated journey in creating the airport of the future in a smart, healthy and profitable way.

This role administers and delivers the Security Operations Control (SOC) and the Security Response Coordinator (SRC) services, processes, and procedures. The incumbent will provide direction in the delivery of the services to remotely monitor, assess, communicate, direct response, and facilitate resolution of day-of security activities/events and incidents within Terminals, Groundside, Airside and Greater Toronto Airports Authority (GTAA) controlled facilities. The candidate is accountable for conducting and directing operations as it is related to aviation security incidents, planned and unplanned security activities to resolve and mitigate impact.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Assigning and allocating resources efficiently and effectively to areas of work and that priorities are set and adequately addressed
  • Creating the SOC and SRC schedule while upholding the requirements of the procedures for resource deployment and maintaining preferred staffing levels
  • Providing “Day of” response, assessment, resolution, and mitigation of airport security and safety
  • In accordance with GTAA Policy/Procedures/Processes, create, lead, and review SOC and SRC operating processes and ensuring integration/coordination with other Departments/Units to ensure symmetry
  • Ensuring the development, maintenance and delivery of effective initial and recurrent training to ensure team members are prepared and capable of providing the necessary support to security programs
  • Setting KPI’s for and work with team to meet or exceed established metrics
  • Coordinate the availability of systems and tools for monitoring, assessment, communications, and reporting of airport security and safety issues to quickly respond and resolve potential or actual airport security and safety issues
  • Identify, resolve and address issues related to operational concerns with legislation and expectations of GTAA as per Airport Security Program as it relates to the processes, procedures carried out by SOC and SRC teams
  • Develop and champion strong relationships with key safety and security partners, Police, CATSA, Canadian and US Inspection services, contracted security providers, and GTAA operational teams for purposes of information sharing and operational coordination
  • Participate and provide subject matter information in emergency response planning and exercise activities
  • Responsible for being a customer centric Leader with respect to the Mission, Vision, Values and Beliefs

The salary for this management non-unionized position is competitive based on the successful candidate’s qualifications.

Qualifications:

  • Fully vaccinated against COVID-19 with all required doses of a vaccine approved by Health Canada. The GTAA will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the Canadian Human Rights Act.
  • Post-secondary education from an accredited college or university in one or more of the following areas: aviation management, aviation science, aviation administration, business administration, public administration, security management, transportation management, criminal justice, or a closely related field or equivalent experience in a related field.
  • 3 years of management experience directly leading employees
  • Experience leading employees in a unionized environment
  • Experience in investigative, negotiation and conflict resolution techniques
  • Preferred experience in a dispatch/communication center
  • Able to obtain and retain Transportation Security and Government of Canada Security Clearance - Secret Level
  • Demonstrated experience working in a customer centric environment

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Proven ability to communicate both verbally and in writing with a diverse population with regard to strategic planning
  • Possess independent decision-making ability and strong management skills
  • Possess the ability to lead a diverse group of security professionals
  • Familiarity with all aspects of airport operations including but not limited to emergency response, airline operations, and airport security measures.
  • Familiarity with operational response practices
  • Familiarity of integrated security systems that includes but is not limited to CCTVs, alarms, digital video recorders, etc.

What's in it for you!

We offer our GTAA members amazing benefits, including retirement planning, group health benefits, employee assistance programs (EAP), paid leave, education and training, as well as recognition and rewards programs.

title: Airport Operations Manager
description:
Job Description - Airport Operations Manager (YUL-2022-5210-010228)
The initial review of applications will begin on the "Apply by Date" indicated. Applications received after this date may not be considered. Exception: Applications submitted to Jobs labeled as “Ongoing” in the Requisition ID, will be evaluated on an as needed basis. Please note that job postings will in general remain posted until such time as the position is filled.

Airport Operations Manager

Apply by Date: Apr 29, 2022

Primary Location
: CA-QC-Montréal
Schedule
: Full-time
Job Type: Permanent
Shift: Shift Work
Number of Openings
: 1

Yearly

Purpose of Position:
To provide active leadership on a duty shift basis, in overseeing and monitoring all aspects of Jazz operations at respective airport to ensure compliance of procedures and corporate standards are maintained while providing the highest level of safety and customer service, in support of achieving or exceeding the corporation's operational targets.

Key Activities:
Provide leadership support and direction to both AC and Jazz operational staff on a day of basis.
Manage operational activities with AC, Airport Authorities, Jazz STOC Coordinators, CSMs, and Tow Crew.
Manage Jazz operational employees, schedules, timekeeping, vacations, and part-timers schedules.
Manage agreed upon accountabilities with direct reports and provide annual performance reviews.
Coach and provide direction to employees to ensure consistent quality completion of responsibilities. Address individual performance issues as they arise following standard Jazz performance management practices.
Participate in discipline, and union meetings, provide support and feedback.
Participate in information gathering into grievance process and attend grievance hearing as required.
Deliver evaluations to employees on the AMP.
Management liaison between Flight Operations, In-flight Service, Maintenance, Jazz Airport Operations, AC Airport Operations and CAA to facilitate a cohesive operation.
Maintain company emergency procedures/local airport emergency procedures and ensure employees remain current with said procedures.
Ensure all aspects of the operation comply with security and safety regulations and procedures.
Monitor and maintain all necessary reports and administer necessary follow up.
Monitor operational delays daily, investigate and follow-up with corrective actions.
Participate and provide reports at daily Jazz and AC operational review meetings.
Recruit, interview and select new team members as required.
Establish and maintain positive rapport/relationship with the CAA, AC, Transport Canada, CATSA and local union representatives.
Communicate to staff information from various sources, such as Corporate, Marketing and Sales to ensure impacts on operations are identified and actioned.
Create an open, honest and Team work environment.
Provide regular Team meetings to direct reports.
Develop a full understanding of the union contracts.
Liaise with YHZ operations to ensure optimum routing of aircrafts, taking into account the parameters at the assigned airport.
Liaise with Air Canada Manpower (advance / day of) to ensure 100% staffing complement for the handling of the Jazz product.
Liaise with Air Canada MGO in relation to handling of related operations requirements.
Participate at daily or periodic operational review meetings.
Other related duties as assigned.
Perform duties in accordance with established policies and procedures while giving primary consideration to personal safety, and the safety of co-workers and customers.

Qualifications:
Must be fully vaccinated with a Canadian government approved vaccine against COVID 19 prior to start date
10 years work experience including at least 5 years industry related and experience in a unionized environment.
Supervisory and/or management experience, in an airport environment.
Proven leadership skills.
Strong communication skills.
Computer knowledge required.
Previous airport customer service experience an asset.
Is flexible and able to work shifts, including evenings and weekends.
Bilingualism required in Montreal base (French and English).

We strive to hire candidates with diverse abilities. We want to ensure that you are prepared for success and therefore request that you please let us know at taleosupport@flyjazz.ca if you require an accommodation during the recruitment process.

Jazz recognizes that the best talent includes people of all backgrounds, abilities and points of view. To be a leader in our industry, Jazz celebrates diversity and values the uniqueness that each individual has to offer. We empower our people to foster an internal culture of inclusion, creating safe workspaces where everyone can be their authentic self. Meeting the needs of our diverse passengers is critical to our success and we recognize the importance of a workforce that is reflective of the communities we serve.

Requisition ID
: YUL-2022-5210-010228

title: newBusiness Development Manager
description:
• Workplace: Alt Toronto Airport
  • Status: Full time (permanent)
  • Schedule: Day shift on weekdays

YOUR FUTURE TEAM: Reporting to the General Manager, you will work closely with the Regional Director of Sales and operation departments of the hotel. You will be ultimately responsible for implementing and seeing through sales strategies ensuring the negotiated segments meet their financial goals.

WHAT WE OFFER :

- Group insurances paid 50% by the employer

- Access to the hotel gym according to occupancy

- Employee referral program

- Employee Assistance Program for team member and their family

- Promotional rate to discover Germain Hôtels properties through Canada

- Opportunities to develop your career within a growing company across Canada

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Demonstrates strong negotiation skills in working out contractual agreements with potential clients quote and negotiate prices within established parameters

- Takes a proactive approach to business development through account management, lost business accounts, prospecting within target market segments and referrals

- Display effective time management skills by promptly replying to incoming inquiries, sending proposals, contracts and other sales correspondence as needed by clients

- Research markets in order to identify potential opportunities of business and increase market share

- Analyzes available reports, trends, competitive knowledge to develop tactics to maximize occupancy

- Maintains personal contact with “top” producing customer accounts (group or corporate) through regular sales calls to promote excellent communication and client feedback

- Completes all Corporate RFP’s via Lanyon and or corporate rate letters

- Conducts site inspections and client visits, host and participate in familiarization trips, attend industry trade shows and assigned association memberships

- Attends hotels meeting when it is needed (revenue and operations meetings)

- Create and submits monthly sales reports and monthly updates to the Sales Action Plan

- Enters daily activities in Opera PMS in accordance with Germain Hotel standards

- Represents the hotel to the guests and the general public in such a way as to enhance the quality, image and the reputation of the property

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

- 3 to 5 years as Sales Manager

- University degree in a related field

- Ability to use Microsoft applications and hotels technologies (ex: Opera)

- Available to travel outside of Toronto occasionally

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • On-site gym
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

title: Hub Manager, Toronto
description:
The Hub Manager, YYZ is a member of the Airport Operations leadership team that is responsible for Porter’s aircraft turn performance, passenger service experience, and ground handling at the YYZ Hub.

The Hub Manager is accountable for the station’s consistent execution to defined safety, commercial, operational, passenger service and employment standards. Identifies and eliminates barriers to reduce station-controllable delays and works cross-functionally to reduce system controllable and uncontrollable delays. Works diligently to achieve a safe and accident-free operation. Regularly engages with leaders and team members to foster their commitment to Porter’s success. Meets defined financial performance targets. Constantly seeks ways to drive operational efficiency while supporting team members and passengers.

Works cross-functionally and with stakeholders outside the Porter organization to ensure team members have the necessary tools, training, processes and resources to achieve the team’s targets and metrics.

Is responsible for building and sustaining a high-performance culture of teamwork and commitment to service and operational reliability throughout YYZ, with significant focus on actively developing the leadership capabilities of the group’s Leads, Supervisors and Assistant Managers.

The Hub Manager ensures 7-day-per-week, in-station leadership coverage, with management actively engaged in the station operation during peak passenger hours of the day and during irregular operations.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Leads and manages YYZ passenger service functions. Works closely with station leaders to ensure team members consistently deliver passenger service to defined standards and achieve aircraft turn performance. Works across the organization to remove barriers so team members are able to achieve these core above the wing functions.


  • Manages the ground-handling contract for the provision of YYZ ramp functions. Works closely with the contract ground handler to ensure procedures are consistently followed to achieve aircraft turn performance and baggage service standards while also maintaining a safe and accident-free environment in a cost effective manner.

  • Establishes weekly leadership schedules to ensure 7-day-per-week, in-station management coverage (overseeing operations and passenger interactions at the check-in counter, at departure lounges and gates and on the ramp), with hours focused on peak passenger times; leadership schedules are to meet established expectations of manager/assistant manager operational engagement 65% of their day and supervisors 80% of their day.

  • Actively engages with operations, passenger interactions and team member coaching at the check-in counter, at departure gates and on the ramp 65% of their day; higher if core operational, service, and safety metrics are not being regularly met.

  • Manages local administrative support team to handle the station’s administrative support needs.

  • Collaborates with Manager, Catering Operations to enable consistent and reliable aircraft turn performance.

  • Works closely with Senior Analyst, Airport Operations; Manager, Learning and Development; and People & Culture to proactively manage all aspects of team member resources to maintain the trained headcount needed to support operational reliability and service targets while ensuring the most efficient scheduling of resources that achieves budgeted labour costs.

  • Actively works to maintain healthy Team Member Engagement levels.

  • Actively works to maintain healthy and effective labour union relationships. Is actively involved in the negotiation of bargaining agreements, manages grievance procedures and ensures company and workforce compliance with labour agreements.

  • Conducts regular (weekly) operational metric and business reviews with station leaders to maintain operational performance, identify trends for corrective action and proactively manage human resource issues. Establishes and monitors station audit practices to ensure compliance with safety, reliability, service and regulatory standards and guidelines.

  • Conducts regular (quarterly) reviews of station leadership performance, including objective setting, performance evaluation, and professional development plans. Recognizes successes, builds action plans for opportunities, manages leadership talent pipeline for succession planning.

  • Establishes business cases for the necessary investments to reach and sustain operational performance.

  • Collaborates with the Learning and Development department to support the training of YYZ team members.

  • Develops and maintains a climate that attracts, retains, and motivates top talent; ensures proper succession planning and talent development for the airline's mission critical roles.

  • Actively participates in Porter’s Safety Management System (SMS) including reporting hazards and incidents encountered in daily operations; understands and promotes the Company’s Safety Policy.

BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES:


  • Concern for Safety:     Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others.

  • Teamwork:     Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals.

  • Passenger/Customer Service:     Providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers).

  • Initiative:     Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise.

  • Results Focus:     Focusing efforts on achieving high quality results consistent with the organization’s standards.

  • Fostering Communication:     Listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus.

  • Exemplifying Integrity:     Treating others fairly, honestly, and respectfully, furthering the integrity of the organization and its relationships of trust with team members and the broader community.

  • Inspiring Others:     Energizing and inspiring others to strive for excellence and commit to common goals and purposes, creating a sense of self-efficacy, resilience, and persistence in followers.

  • People Leadership:     Assuming a leadership role in helping others achieve excellent results.

  • Leading Change:     Recognizing the need for change, being open to new ideas and methods, and championing transformational change within the organization and beyond.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • University degree

  • 5 - 10 years operations management experience

  • Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills

  • Able to lead under pressure

  • Able to effectively plan and manage resources

  • High standard of personal integrity

  • Superior oral and written communication skills

  • Proficient in Google office suite

  • Flexibility with work schedule and ability to work irregular hours

  • Able to hold all required security clearances

  • Able to communicate and correspond clearly and precisely in English

  • Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination

title: newTraining Supervisor
description:
Job Details

Description

Main Accountabilities:

  • Schedule, conduct initial and recurrent training
  • Schedule and conduct Lead & Supervisor Aircraft Loading (SAL) Training
  • Schedule and conduct GSE Training
  • Promote a professional image at all times applying the Company Uniform Standards
  • Ensures the safe and correct control of all resources on the Ramp
  • Complies with all Airlines Ground Handling Regulations
  • Support corporate compliance with applicable Management of Health and Safety at Work Regulations.
  • Support employees and supervisors in undertaking the proactive and preventative measures necessary to achieve compliance with health and safety legislation as it applies to them.
  • Full compliance and implementation at all times of the following:
  • Airline Handling Manuals
  • Airports Disruption Management Policy
  • Customer Service Promise
  • Communications Promise
  • POA (Person of Accountability) procedures
  • Report any breaches of statutory requirements or company best practice to management.
  • Maintain compliance with all government, customer and company policies/procedures.
  • Must be able to travel to other Stations when required.
  • Must be able to hold and maintain Airport security clearance
  • Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Must have and maintain valid G Driver’s license and DA/AVOP and Transport Canada Security Clearance.
  • Must have at least 2 years’ experience on the following Ramp GSE
  • Baggage Tractor
  • Belt Loader
  • Push Back Tractor – Conventional
  • Push Back Tractor – Towbarless (will be beneficial)
  • Lower Deck Loader
  • Main Deck Loader (will be beneficial)
  • Must have experience on Air Bridges (Passenger Boarding Bridges)
  • High school diploma with at least two (2) years of experience in ramp operations in a Lead / Supervisor or Training capacity.
  • Must have previous experience as a Ramp lead and have a satisfactory safety/performance record
  • Must be certified trainer for customer or be able to successfully complete and pass the training program.
  • Ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing.
  • Must be able to work extended hours on short notice during non-routine operations.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Excel and Word programs.
  • Thorough knowledge of ground handling operations, aviation security, safety practices, legislation and customer supplier relationships
  • Must be able to obtain and hold all required security clearances
  • Ability to drive safety van and truck from one work site to another as needed.
  • A working knowledge of GSE maintenance issues.
  • Understanding of the wider airport operational environment.
  • Must be able to lift up to 70lbs when required
  • Experience and understanding of the commercial issues in aviation.
  • Experience in Health and Safety Management

Qualifications

Behaviors

Preferred

Leader : Inspires teammates to follow them
Enthusiastic : Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
Dedicated : Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity

Experience

Preferred

1 year: Safety/performance Record
1 year: Ramp Operations in a lead / supervisor or training capacity
1 year: Air Bridges (Passenger Boarding Bridges)
2 years: Ramp GSE Baggage tractor, belt loader, push back tractor, lower deck loader

title: newGeneral Manager, SMS Safety
description:
We are more than just planes and tarmacs. Our purpose travels beyond our runway into the communities we serve. We are about connections, stories and life-defining adventures. We are committed to fostering an environment where our people are rewarded through meaningful work experiences. The Calgary Airport Authority manages and operates YYC Calgary International Airport and YBW Springbank Airport, and collaborates with the many partners who make up YYC - from airlines to government agencies and retail outlets. This is an exciting time to join our #YYCCrew and drive YYC forward as one of Canada"s best airports!

THE TEAM
If you are passionate about safety and understand the importance of customer service while running a high-performance operation, this is the role for you. Our Safety & Compliance team works hard to maintain high safety standards and operations that ensure our airport operates efficiently and effectively. This team of high performers connects our people to deliver seamless operations every day.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Reporting to the Director, Safety, Security and Compliance, The General Manager of SMS Safety, is in charge of developing, directing, and modeling the Safety Management System (SMS) of The Calgary Airport Authority. The successful candidate will act as the central hub for all safety management activities within the organization.
Key Responsibilities include:

  • Assist the Director of Safety, Security and Compliance (DOS) in the development and implementation of SMS in accordance with Transport Canada.
  • Provide oversight and management of the Safety Management System and Airport Operation Manuals
  • Assist the DOS in planning and administration of Safety Review Boards.
  • Manage relationships with representatives from all operational departments, regulatory authorities/governing bodies, regarding the development and management of SMS.
  • Responsible for the research, analysis, and development of hazard identification processes to enhance SMS.
  • Manage, develops and coordinates change management, risk assessments and safety analysis within SMS.
  • Manage and develop a team of safety specialists.
  • Act as the Joint Chair of the Airport Safety Committees involving internal and external YYC partners.
  • Ensure investigations are conducted for all accidents and/or incidents in accordance with documented polices and procedures.
  • Develop, compile, and distribute analysis, trends and statistics based upon SMS data and makes recommendations based upon a data driven approach to safety.
  • Track safety recommendations, hazards, risks, findings, corrective actions, contributing factors, and root causes to ensure accuracy, reporting and follow-up as necessary.
  • Assist in event-specific investigations into all safety related aspects of company operations, including, but not limited to aircraft accidents, incident, irregular events, OH&S, etc.
  • Responsible for the YYC AVOP program, Occupational Health and Safety program, as well as the Contractor Safety program.
  • Develop, maintain, and execute safety and SMS training to employees.
  • Develop and deliver internal safety communications.
  • Represent the safety team at industry and company meetings, industry conferences and events, as well as any industry working groups as assigned.

EDUCATION AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor’s degree in an Aviation or Safety discipline, Business Management, or related degree
  • Five (5) or more years’ experience in aviation safety management; an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
  • Previous experience with SMS management or oversight.
  • SMS Certification is an asset.
  • Strong working knowledge in aviation risk management.
  • Proven experience developing and facilitating training programs and presenting to both small and large audiences in various levels of leadership.
  • Prior experience in managing complex projects and initiatives.

WHAT ELSE

  • Must have knowledge of air carrier operations disciplines and administration. Strong knowledge of aviation safety principles, quality management fundamentals, and regulatory agencies and their function as related to air carrier operations.
  • Proven project management experience, management of complex projects and initiatives, and databases as it relates to safety operations.
  • Ability to act as a Safety Ambassador for the organization both internally and externally.
  • Successful candidate must be able to speak publicly and present on the individual level, senior management level, and to large audiences, including all employees within our organization, and industry professionals.
  • Possess a high degree of proficiency with MS Office products (including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written skills are necessary to perform the job at the expected level with the ability to provide exceptional customer service to all levels of the organization.
  • Ability to write effective reports, business correspondence, and manuals.
  • Possesses strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to respond calmly and handle customer demands in a fast-paced environment with constantly shifting priorities.
  • Must possess passionate attention to detail and the ability to work in a team atmosphere.
  • Experience working with various business groups in a complex and unionized environment.
  • Must be able to obtain and maintain a Restricted Area Identification Card (RAIC.)
  • Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

OUR VALUES:

We are ACCOUNTABLE. We take ownership and step up to get the job done.

We are CUSTOMER-FOCUSED. We consider the customer in all that we do.

We are COLLABORATIVE. We are stronger when we reach out and work as a team.

We are RESILIENT. We are able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.

We are CREATIVE. We strive to find new and better ways of doing things.

Are you looking for the journey of a lifetime? One that’s focused on creating effortless and memorable experiences for millions of guests and travelers each year.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Manager, Air Service Development
description:
We are more than just planes and tarmacs. Our purpose travels beyond our runway into the communities we serve. We are about connections, stories and life defining adventures made possible by the work we do. We are committed to fostering an environment where our people are rewarded through meaningful work experiences inspired by purpose.

The Calgary Airport Authority is made up of remarkable people committed to delivering great results. We manage and operate YYC Calgary International Airport, YBW Springbank Airport and collaborate with many partners - from airlines to customer services and government agencies to food and retail outlets. With the opening of our new international terminal and Canada"s longest runway, this is an exciting time to join our Crew and advance YYC as one of Canada"s best airports.

THE TEAM
The Air Service Development (ASD) team grows airline capacity by working with key stakeholders and our air carriers to add new flights, increase frequencies, and up-gauge aircraft. ASD works to provide a valuable service to the community by driving exceptional client relationships through clear communication, collaboration, streamlining processes, and providing access to information. Our ASD team is always on the go with a focus on growing YYC. They work very hard, and like the rest of our people, they know how to have fun!

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Reporting to the Director, Air Service and Land Development, the overall responsibility of this position is to provide business analysis to support the Authority’s air service development strategy. Acting as a liaison to YYC industry partners, you will be accountable to evaluate and develop new and existing airlines at YYC. This role is ideal for an individual who has a passion for aviation combined with a keen interest in global economic markets and business development.

Responsibilities include:

  • Retain, grow, and steward new route development with air carriers at YYC.
  • Understand key airline infrastructure, operational and commercial needs.
  • Develop growth plans with key airline accounts.
  • Develop relationships with carriers/other industry partners to assist in market growth.
  • Oversee strategic projects/initiatives that enable airline growth at YYC.
  • Monitor routes served by incumbent carriers, identify opportunities for growth and assist incumbent carriers in increasing traffic at YYC.
  • Monitor carrier fleet plans, strategic development and growth at competing airports.
  • Act as the primary liaison between carriers and internal and external stakeholders.
  • Act as subject matter expert to ensure carriers are well informed as to YYC processes and procedures.
  • Assist carriers with communication and understanding of operational regulations set out by agency services such as Canada Customs, US CBP, CATSA, Health Canada and other external stakeholders.
  • Research, identify, and provide recommendations to assist carriers in identifying market opportunities between strategic routes.
  • Research, analyze data, and assess information to promote the Calgary International Airport as a preferred location for airlines.
  • Provide promotional and marketing support to air carriers and act as coordinator for targeted air service marketing initiatives at YYC; this includes market analysis, initiative planning, coordination & implementation.
  • Research and develop business cases and route development activities for incumbent airlines and targeted prospects for new air services.
  • Attend industry events & conferences, gather information, and make presentations as a representative and ambassador of YYC to carriers.
  • Complete timely and accurate Quality Service Index (QSI) analysis to identify whether new opportunities have a positive and viable impact on YYC’s air services.
  • Present to all levels of industry officials, airline executives, and local/regional/national stakeholders.
  • Travel frequently to make presentations to airlines and attend targeted industry events; act as a representative and ambassador of YYC.
  • Provide market research, airport development information, and air service updates to industry stakeholders as required.
  • Monitor and understand economic, industry and government regulatory factors that impact carriers and air service development at YYC; this includes monitoring of aviation industry in Canada and International markets.
  • Remain current with global trends that will impact the competitiveness and success of the development program.
  • Respond to requests from key stakeholders in a professional and timely manner.

WHAT YOU BRING

  • Five or more years’ experience working with airlines/airport in route development.
  • Undergraduate degree in Business, Economics, or related discipline with a strong emphasis on analysis, research, business development and knowledge of global economic conditions.
  • Strong technical and operational knowledge of the airline and airport industry, including aviation terminology, aircraft performance, range and capacity, aircraft scheduling, bilateral agreements, airline alliances and security protocols.
  • Understanding of airline economics including operating cost structure, cost control and revenue management.
  • Experience with implementing new international air services (operational and commercial.)
  • Exceptional knowledge of International and Canadian business protocols & cultural sensitivities.
  • Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to develop and present engaging presentations.
  • Solid understanding of global economic conditions and factors affecting the aviation industry.
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze data and develop relevant business cases combined with a high degree of attention to detail.
  • Knowledge of industry tools such as Sabre, Diio and Liftplan is considered an asset.
  • Ability to adjust work schedule to incorporate duties, many of which fall outside of regular work hours.
  • Flexibility to travel frequently.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft products (Excel, Word, Power Point.)
  • Must be able to obtain and maintain a Restricted Area Identification Card (RAIC)
  • Proof that you are fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as approved by Health Canada

WHAT ELSE

  • Flexibility and personality to interact with all stakeholders and customers, ranging from operational staff to data analysts to business leaders in Calgary or the aviation industry.
  • Ability to maintain relationships with external and internal stakeholders.
  • Exceptional organizational skills to manage complex, diverse responsibilities and competing priorities in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment.
  • Exceptional judgment, discretion, and professionalism.
  • Keen attention to detail with the ability to effectively focus on multiple projects and priorities with a calm, focused and flexible attitude and embracing change.
  • Ability to embody YYC’s values and drive impact to support the organization’s strategic planks.

Are you looking for the journey of a lifetime? One that’s focused on creating effortless and memorable experiences for millions of guests and travelers each year.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Full Time GSE Manager
description:
ATS (Airport Terminal Services) is looking for a dynamic GSE Maintenance Manager .


Job Description:

Building maintenance and upkeep, budgeting, managing a team of mechanics, customer billing, weekly reporting on out of service equipment, assist with troubleshooting equipment problems, part sourcing, track PMI status, follow up on audit failures, assist with hiring and training new mechanics.


The requirements of the job:

Being able to pass a 5year Background check.

Valid drivers license,

Moderate knowledge of Microsoft Word/Excel/Outlook,

Planning maintenance and managerial skills,

Extensive knowledge of diesel/gas engines,

Knowledge of electrical systems,

5 years of experience in similar positions.

Pay:

This position comes with a competitive salary.


Please apply now for a chance to join this amazing company.

title: Manager, Marketing Partnerships and Events
description:
Want to be part of a team that's changing the way Canada travels?


As Canada’s largest independent ultra-low-cost airline, that’s exactly what we’re doing at Flair Airlines. By consistently offering airfares that are a fraction of the ticket prices of “those other airlines”, we are making air travel an affordable option for millions of couch-bound Canadians.


Yes, we’re an airline, but we truly believe that our product is our people. Low fares are important, but it takes great people delivering consistently outstanding customer-focused service to build brand loyalty.


Flair Airlines is currently seeking a permanent, full-time Manager, Marketing Partnerships and Events to join our growing and ever-changing organization. Reporting to Vice President, Marketing and Communications, the Manager, Marketing Partnerships and Events is an acting ambassador for Flair Airlines and supports the purpose and vision of the organization with passion, energy, achievement, and respect. The Manager, Marketing Partnerships and Events is responsible to encompass destination and partner development and collaboration, ensuring Flair delivers an exceptional experience and maximum value to all Flair stakeholders.


This role is responsible for supporting the Marketing and Network teams in fulfillment of cooperative marketing agreements with destinations, airports, tourism organizations, and other stakeholders. The Manager, Marketing Partnerships and Events will be maintaining the administration and communication needs of all departments, with an overall focus on building strong relationships with Flair’s partners.


This position will be based in Vancouver, BC and frequent travel will be required.


Primary Job Functions:

The duties of the Manager, Marketing Partnerships and Events include:

  • Develop and manage all external partner relationships
  • Ensure stakeholder value is met
  • Oversee budget, partner contribution, and allocation
  • Manage content broadcast on behalf of partners and flair
  • Lead all partner events from planning to execution
  • Support Marketing and Networks departments in the following areas:
    • Plan and provide operational support for events and experiences e.g. Inaugural flights, aircraft deliveries, PR events, airport initiatives, and events, tourism events, and tradeshows
    • Work collaboratively with creative and web teams to ensure the accuracy and visibility of initiatives (approve print collateral, update web info, etc.)
    • Work with cross-functional team to develop plans and budgets related to partners and events.
    • Research and document new partner opportunities and events.
    • Departmental admin (invoice processing and POs, Member Website updates)
  • Provide administrative support for events:
    • Maintaining event calendar listings
    • Ensuring event web/ social media updates
    • Monthly updates to the Executive Leadership Team (ELT)
  • The duties listed above will evolve on an ongoing basis and are not limited to this job description


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • At least five years of experience in a sales/partnerships management role
  • Bachelor’s Degree required, concentration in marketing or related field is preferred, or equivalent experience
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly motivated, enthusiastic, and willing to take on new challenges, with adaptability in an evolving role
  • Well-organized, detail-oriented, flexible, and responsive working style
  • Excellent team player and the ability to work with people at all levels with a strong sense of customer service
  • Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Office
  • Technical aptitude to support minor content and website updates
  • Knowledge and passion for the tourism and aviation industries
  • Eligible to work in Canada


Flair Airlines offers a competitive compensation package including medical and dental benefits, short and long-term disability, life insurance, dependent life insurance, employee & family assistance program, a defined contribution pension plan (matched contributions), and a staff travel program.


How to Apply:


Please apply online directly to the posting. Applications should clearly demonstrate how your skills meet or surpass, the requirements of the position of Manager, Marketing Partnerships and Events. Further information about the Company can be found at www.flyflair.com


At Flair Airlines, we work together to promote an inclusive environment that attracts talented individuals and signals our commitment to celebrate and promote diversity. We are devoted to creating equitable, inclusive, and diverse workspaces and we encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role.


We wish to thank everyone who applies, however, due to the number of applications received only those shortlisted will be contacted. We cannot accommodate phone inquiries.


We look forward to meeting you at Flair Airlines!

title: Manager, Learning and Development
description:
Français

Manager, Learning and Development

Vancouver, BC

We have an exciting permanent, full-time opportunity for a Manager, Learning and Development at YVR.

Our strategic plan is industry leading and driving change. In our ever-changing environment, establishing a learning mindset and growth opportunities to support that mindset have become essential to YVR. We are looking for a capable individual, with exceptional listening and transformation skills, to translate that strategic plan into an integrated and diverse offering of learning opportunities to meet the future demand. We see this role as the curator of ‘aha!’ moments through inspiring educational and developmental opportunities to stay on top of the latest skills, behaviours and leadership qualities to meet our strategic objectives today and in the future.

In return, we can provide an environment where your voice will be heard, and you will be able to make a difference. Of course, the role comes with a competitive salary and benefits program, but also so much more.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Work closely with people managers across YVR to ensure corporate training and employee development align with YVR values and meet the objective of the evolving organizational needs and corporate business strategy
  • Develop core, behavioural and functional competencies to support recruitment and selection, learning and career development, performance management and succession management
  • Analyze performance gaps and recommend solutions to close gaps related to knowledge skills or behaviour, and oversee the YVR Essential Behaviours framework
  • Provide project management and implementation of training programs and events
  • Work with subject matter experts to develop and deliver course contents using appropriate instruction design and digital learning
  • Maintain new and ongoing relationships with external vendors and networks to ensure currency and relevancy of training industry trends and best practices; leverage knowledge to implement solutions to enhance our solutions
  • Provide direction and subject matter expertise to our Learning Management System and identify and maximize opportunities to utilize the technology
  • Monitor, measure and report on the efficiency and effectiveness of learning programs, tools, systems and processes
  • Manage and motivate a team (1-2) and collaborate with training specialists within department

Key qualifications include:

  • At least 5 years’ progressive HR experience at a management level in building and leading the learning function, as well as, designing and delivering leadership development programs in a fast-paced organization, supplemented by a university degree or accredited program in adult learning, human resources or business; or an equivalent combination of training and experience
  • Formal training in learning and/or leadership
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to understand different audiences’ needs, coupled with honed active listening skills
  • A skilled presenter and an engaging facilitator with experience in course development and delivery
  • Well-developed project management skills with the proven ability to juggle and reprioritize based on business demands and priorities
  • Ability to work effectively in a highly complex and matrixed partnership
  • Strong understanding and current knowledge of effective adult learning theories, instructional design and development methods
  • Proficient in Learning Management Systems and MS Office

The successful candidate will interact with the executive office and the executive's departmental teams, as well as the HR leadership team and HR Business Partners.

This position is well suited to an individual that is passionate about continuous learning, has a curious mindset and thrives in an agile environment. Candidates of diverse backgrounds and/or having diverse lived experience are encouraged to apply.

This position is open to both Vancouver Airport Authority employees and external candidates. Previous job performance will be considered for all internal candidates who apply for this position.

As part of our recruitment process, short-listed candidates may be required to participate in an assessment process.

Health and safety are at the core of how we operate at YVR. We are committed to ensuring a safe workplace for our workforce and protecting the health and safety of our employees, passengers, partners and community by taking reasonable, preventative measures to reduce the risks associated with COVID-19. All employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a valid exemption is granted for those unable to be vaccinated.

Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), YVR is made up of a team of diverse people who are working collaboratively to Connect BC proudly to the World. Safety is at the core of everything we do; we’re innovative, fun, and we invest in our people. With high engagement scores, an abundance of learning and development opportunities, and a holistic approach to wellness, we’re looking for someone to join our team.

Vancouver Airport Authority strives for a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We support the Employment Equity Act and take measures to ensure fair employment practices and treatment of employees across our organization. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, including women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. We encourage applicants to self-identify with a designated group(s) to support our team in filling gaps in areas where we can be more diverse. We are also happy to provide reasonable accommodations throughout the selection process and while working at YVR. If you require support applying online because you are a person with a disability, please contact us at 604-303-3152 or careers@yvr.ca.

title: General Manager (YVR Air Canada Lounge)
description:
About Plaza Premium Group:

Headquartered in Hong Kong, Plaza Premium Group is the pioneer and industry leader in offering Global Airport Hospitality solutions in over 250 plus locations at 70 international airports in 30 countries and regions across the world, with a collective goal of making travel better. The group has won more than 60 accolades in the last five years, including “World's Best Independent Airport Lounge” for four consecutive years from 2016 to 2019 at the Skytrax World Airline Awards, the global benchmark of aviation excellence. The Group currently employs nearly 5,000 staff and serves over 20 million passengers around the world annually. We are dedicated to delivering superior airport hospitality services for air travelers. (Website: www.plazapremiumgroup.com)

As part of Plaza Premium Group family, you will be an ambassador for Teamwork, Excellent Service and Innovation. Your attention to detail, warm personality and positive attitude will be part of our collective goals in enhancing the airport experience for all travelers.

Plaza Premium Group is proud managing partners with the national flag bearer, Air Canada, and therefore is looking for professional and highly skilled individuals for various FOH & BOH positions for the Air Canada Signature Suite at Vancouver International Airport. In order to serve Air Canada’s super elite, high-profile customers travelling on Air Canada’s Signature Class on select international routes, Plaza Premium Lounge is seeking skilled professionals for both FOH & BOH from, fine-dining, high-end restaurant/hotel backgrounds.

JOB* RESPONSIBILITIES *

Pre-Openings

· Creating the pre-opening plans from a lounge operational point of view

· Recruitment of all new lounge operational team members, with close coordination with AC Lounge Management

· Training and deployment (PPG and AC)

· Sourcing of operating equipment, as per guidance and coordination of AC Lounge Management

· Sourcing service providers together with PPG procurement with close coordination with AC Lounge Management

· Setting up of all IT systems

· Reporting progress of the pre-opening operational requirements and follow up of all pending matters to Group Director Lounges - PPG

Post Opening Operations

· Monitoring all Daily Management Reports of AC-SS-YVR (DMR’s) – ensuring that the daily report is properly completed and sent to all the relevant parties within PPG and AC.

· Creation of all lounge rosters and manpower planning. Collaborate with the Executive Sous Chef of AC-SS-YVR to ensure that the kitchen roster is also completed accurately.

· Ensuring that the lounge opening and closing as well as the daily shift operations takes place as per the standards set by PPG which are as per the guidance of AC.

· Ensuring that the lounge is fully compliant with all Air Canada’s requirements, PPG’s requirements, standards and procedures, the airport’s requirements, standards and procedures and all other local and regional legislative requirements.

· Providing weekly and monthly reports to PPG and AC top management on the overall performance of the lounge.

· Any non-conformances are identified through internal and external audits, corrective and preventive measures are put in place on a timely and effective manner and are recorded and reported effectively.

· Ensuring all lounges run financially positive and in line with budgets set by both AC and PPG.

· Provide solutions to operational challenges

Customers Engagement

· During each shift, the GM is to ensure that he/she is fully engaged with the premium passengers and enquire the satisfaction levels. On shifts that he/she is not on duty, the same practice should continue with the other shift leaders.

· Swift reaction to customer complaints and queries and ensure the lounge team provide timely responses to written queries/complains.

· Based on the feedback received from customers/passengers, corrective and preventive measures are to be put in place effectively.

· The primary goal is to ensure that all customers leave the lounge satisfied with the level of service received.

Finance and Procurement

· Procurement – ensure all products are procured and supplied as per agreement.

· Finance – ensure that all operations are run in line with budgets and financial KPIs

· Ensure that all products received are in line with the procurement contract

Quality Assurance and Performance

· Ensure the service standards are maintained

· Conduct self-audits – minimum once a week

· Conduct maintenance inspections once a week and report all maintenance requirements timely and have them fixed promptly.

· Ensure that the lounge complies with all audits and have perfect scores

· Respond to customer complaints with corrective and preventive action

Innovation and Technology

· New products and services that could enhance the lounge experience are to be presented to the management of PPG and AC for review and consideration.

· Maintain all the IT and other technological aspects of the lounge.

People Management

· Ensure that we create and encourage a positive work environment for all our employees.

· Be professional, empathetic, fair, unbiased, friendly/approachable yet firm. Treat all team members respectfully and create strong team cohesiveness.

· Maintain performance management records, conduct performance reviews every 6 months with all team members, conduct weekly huddles to ensure that the concerns of the team are addressed.

· Team members who are falling behind in terms of performance are to be assisted, coached and PIP’s (performance improvement plans) created.

· Succession planning for future growth of team members also to be created and encouraged at all levels.

Effectiveness and Efficiency

· Utilize the support available from the local PPG management, regional support and most importantly PPG HQ support to ensure that our clients (Air Canada) is well looked after

· Make recommendation on the processes, policies and procedures.

· Make recommendation on the productivity, organization structure and setup, taking into account changing customers’ needs, equipment and new technology.

· Analyze the guest service results and feedback and identify issues/gaps to be improved or as best practices.

· Establish bespoke operations/training programs with business partners to enhance the overall business results and/or quality.

Others

· Carry out special projects as assigned.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

· Degree holder in the field of business management (desired) or industry operational experience

· Experience in 5 star fine dining.

· A focus on training and development of the staff to 5 star hospitality standards.

· Inventory management skills

· At least 5-8 years’ relevant working experience in customer service and/or hospitality and/or aviation and/or

· Excellent command of written and spoken English. Additional language skills are an advantage.

· Critical thinker, solution-based individual experienced in creating business/customer relation structures.

· Leadership with a training and operational planning background

· Knowledge and experience in F&B is a must and additional experience in airports, aviation, and lounge management is an advantage.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-05-20
Expected start date: 2022-05-20

title: Assistant Manager, Ramp - YTZ
description:
The Assistant Manager, YTZ is a member of the Airport Operations leadership team and is responsible for Porter’s aircraft turn performance, passenger service experience, ground handling, team member experience at the YTZ Station.

The Assistant Manager is accountable for the station’s consistent execution to defined safety, commercial, operational, passenger service and employment standards. Identifies and eliminates barriers to reduce station-controllable delays and works cross-functionally to reduce system controllable and uncontrollable delays. Works diligently to achieve a safe and accident-free operation. Regularly engages with leaders and team members to foster their commitment to Porter’s success. Meets defined financial performance targets. Constantly seeks ways to drive operational efficiency while supporting team members and passengers.

Works cross-functionally and with stakeholders outside the Porter organization to ensure team members have the necessary tools, training, processes and resources to achieve the team’s targets and metrics.

Is responsible for building and sustaining a high-performance culture of teamwork, commitment to service and operational reliability throughout YTZ, with significant focus on actively developing the leadership capabilities of the group’s Leads and Supervisors, and action-oriented teamwork among Team Members.

As a member of the Station’s leadership team, the Assistant Manager participates to provide 7-day-per-week, in-station leadership coverage, and is actively engaged in the station operation during peak passenger hours of the day and during irregular operations.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Leads and manages YTZ ramp functions. Works closely with all station team members to ensure consistent execution of defined safety and operational procedures to achieve aircraft turn performance and baggage service standards. Is diligent about maintaining a safe and accident-free environment. Works across the organization to remove barriers so team members are able to achieve these core below-the-wing functions.


  • As a member of the Station leadership team, participate in 7-day-per-week, in-station management coverage (overseeing operations and passenger interactions at the check-in counter, at departure gates and on the ramp), with hours focused on peak passenger times. The expectation is that the Assistant Manager is to spend 65% of their day engaged with the team and the operation.


  • Actively engages with operations, passenger interactions and team member coaching at the check-in counter, at departure gates and on the ramp 65% of their day; higher during peak travel periods or if core operational, service, and safety metrics are not being regularly met.


  • Oversee local administrative support team members to handle the station’s administrative support needs.


  • Works closely with Manager, Airport Operations Analysis; Manager, Learning and Development; and People & Culture to proactively manage all aspects of team member resources to maintain the trained headcount needed to support operational reliability and service targets while ensuring the most efficient scheduling of resources that achieves budgeted labour costs.


  • Actively works to maintain healthy Team Member Engagement levels.


  • Works with Porter GSE Maintenance and third party suppliers to ensure ground service equipment (GSE) are properly maintained, safe and reliable to support YTZ operations.


  • Establishes business cases for the necessary investments to reach and sustain operational performance.


  • Collaborates with the Learning and Development department to support the training of YTZ team members.


  • Develops and maintains a climate that attracts, retains, and motivates top talent; ensures proper succession planning and talent development for airline’s mission critical roles.


  • As part of the regular course of daily operations, engages with station leaders (leads/supervisors), in the operation, to develop talent skills, including operational decision-making, leadership effectiveness, critical thinking, adherence to standards, and problem solving.


  • Actively participates in Porter’s Safety Management System (SMS) including reporting hazards and incidents encountered in daily operations; understands and promotes the Company’s Safety Policy.


BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES:


  • Concern for Safety: Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others.

  • Teamwork:     Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals.

  • Passenger/Customer Service:     Providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers).

  • Initiative:     Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise.

  • Results Focus:     Focusing efforts on achieving high quality results consistent with the organization’s standards.

  • Fostering Communication:     Listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus.

  • Exemplifying Integrity:     Treating others fairly, honestly, and respectfully, furthering the integrity of the organization and its relationships of trust with team members and the broader community.

  • Inspiring Others:     Energizing and inspiring others to strive for excellence and commit to common goals and purposes, creating a sense of self-efficacy, resilience, and persistence in followers.

  • People Leadership:     Assuming a leadership role in helping others achieve excellent results.

  • Leading Change:     Recognizing the need for change, being open to new ideas and methods, and championing transformational change within the organization and beyond.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • University degree or college diploma or equivalent industry experience

  • Minimum 5 years of ramp experience

  • Minimum 2 years of leadership/management experience

  • Superior oral and written communication skills

  • Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills

  • Proficient in Google office suite

  • Flexibility with work schedule

  • Self-starter with proven personal integrity

  • Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination

title: Ramp Lead Agent | Saint John Airport YSJ
description:
Job Details

Description

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Move cargo and baggage on and off aircraft and transport it between aircraft, airport terminals, air cargo facilities, and other aircraft.
  • Operate motorized equipment.
  • Read and interpret aircraft weight and balance loading instructions, hazardous material identification labels, aircraft loading manifests, and baggage and cargo routing tags.
  • Oversees a crew of 3-5 agents.
  • Briefs crew before flights on bag loads, positions to take and how flight will work.
  • Responsible for safe push back and communications with the flight crew during push back.
  • Responsible for all flight crew/gate crew paperwork before and after departure.
  • Oversees all operations at their gate/flight.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Required Skills:

  • Must be at least 18 years of age and legally able to work in Canada;
  • Must have high school diploma, GED or equivalent work experience;
  • Must be able to speak, read, and write in English;
  • Valid driver’s license with good driving record; must be able to pass DA training.
  • Must be able to hold and maintain all required airport security clearance.
  • Reliability, our customer and your fellow employees rely on you.
  • Capable of lifting comfortably 70 lbs;
  • Prior ramp experience a plus;
  • Must be available and flexible to work variable shifts including weekends and holidays;
  • Must be comfortable working in all weather conditions, work is primarily outdoors.

title: Passenger Service Lead
description:
Job Details

Description

Main accountabilities include:

  • Leads a team of Passenger Service Agents
  • Ensure accuracy of all weight and balance requirements
  • Promptly handle all customer service complaints with a focus on positive resolution.
  • Complete all check-in procedures including the handling of reservations, ticketing, seat assignments, airport announcements and checking for proper international documentation.
  • Ensures tasks are performed in accordance with the Company and Airlines specific procedures and policies.
  • Assist customers with special needs and unaccompanied minors.
  • When operating jetways, Passenger Service Agents will be required to work at heights of over 15 feet and be responsible for open/closing aircraft doors.
  • Must be able to read and interpret aircraft weight and balance loading instructions, hazardous material identification labels, aircraft loading manifests, and baggage and cargo routing tags.
  • Ensure the safe and secure operations in accordance with the highest possible standards of health, safety, security and all government statutory requirements
  • You may be required to drive and operate small specialized commercial vehicles at times and as such you will require a valid driver’s license with a clear driving record.
  • Required to attend the mandatory training imposed by the Company and Airlines as per job role.
  • Must be able to comfortably and continuously move/lift customer luggage with an average weight of 50 pounds, in some cases exceeded 70 pounds.
  • Promote a professional image at all time and comply with company uniform standards
  • Leads by example.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Must be at least 18 years of age and legally able to work in Canada;
  • Must have high school diploma, GED or equivalent work experience;
  • Must be able to speak, read, and write in English;
  • Must complete and pass initial new hire classroom and on-the-job training
  • Valid provincial driver’s license with good driving record.
  • Must be able to hold and maintain all required airport security clearance
  • Reliability, our customer and your fellow employees rely on you
  • Must be available and flexible to work variable shifts including weekends and holidays;
  • Must be comfortable working in an airport environment
  • Position requires long periods of time at the ticket counter and gate check-in areas; must be able to stand for prolonged periods of time.

title: newSupervisor - Calgary Airport - PT weekends
description:
Indigo Park is an industry leader and the most respected brand in parking and individual mobility, providing cutting-edge technology and innovation every step of the way. Our success comes from providing tailor-made, innovative solutions, first class customer service experience, continual evolution and an advanced vision of parking facilities. Active in 11 countries and with more than 2,000 employees in Canada, we are present in airports, hospitals, hotels, clinics, school boards and more! Indigo believes that its strength lies primarily with its employees and is committed to sharing its success and promoting team spirit with them.

Job Description
Indigo Park is currently seeking a part time weekend Supervisor for its parking operations at Calgary International Airport. This position is responsible for ensuring company policies and procedures are followed and the day-to-day operations run smoothly.

While on duty, the Supervisor is responsible for the overall operation of the following 3 departments:

  • Shuttle
  • Enforcement
  • Parkade/RCSS

Why Join Indigo?

  • We believe in personal and professional development,
  • We believe in recognizing and rewarding excellent performance.
  • We believe that diversity is a means for success.

What Would You Be Doing?

Lot Responsibilities:

  • Point of contact for all customer inquiries and needs. Works closely with property management to ensure all key stakeholder needs are met in a professional and timely manner.
  • Initiation of work orders to deal with any necessary repairs, maintenance and/or improvements as needed.
  • Point of contact for contractors, building maintenance department, equipment suppliers.
  • Responsible for inspecting the parking facility on a regular basis to ensure it is safe, efficient and operating at or above company standards.
  • Equipment Maintenance and Security:
  • Responsible for ensuring all equipment is functioning properly and/or initiate proper requests for maintenance to ensure facility safety and revenue control.

Staff Supervision:

  • Provide effective leadership and communicate the vision and goals of the organization.
  • Sustain a physical presence at the facility to ensure customer needs are addressed in a timely, professional manner.
  • Scheduling and coordination of staffing for site based on regular manpower requirements and event activity.
  • Staff training, coaching, mentoring and general staff management.
  • Responsible for ensuring staff are following correct policy and procedures.
  • Ensure that we provide the best in customer service standards and monitor the resolution of customer issues up to including escalating matters to senior management.
  • Monitoring of personnel to ensure compliance with company policies and operational procedures, including but not limited to uniform and company policy standards.
  • Completion of payroll related to staff hours worked.
  • Staff disciplinary action, including issuing of verbal and written warnings. Subsequent monitoring and follow up action if required.

Incident Handling:

  • Tracking and managing of incident report/damage claims as well as corresponding with customers regarding safety and liability.

Financial:

  • Reconciliations for month end reporting. Cash handling and pay machine replenishments as required.

Administration:

  • Responsible for day to day administrative duties including entering financial reports daily, emails, faxes and internal correspondence.

What Are We Looking For?

  • Minimum of 3-5 years of customer service experience with some experience being in a supervisor role.
  • College degree preferred. High school diploma minimum.
  • Experience in hospitality or service industry; previous experience within the parking industry is considered an asset.
  • Technical or mechanical skills are a definite asset.
  • Clean drivers license
  • Ability to successfully manage and train other employees.
  • Ability to resolve conflict and problems within tight deadlines.
  • Exceptional multi-tasking abilities and prioritization skills.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Strong Microsoft office skills required, including Excel and Word.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal.
  • Ability to work independently, in a team, and meet deadlines under pressure.

During these unprecedented times, Indigo Park is doing everything required to ensure the safety of its candidates and employees. We will continue to take every necessary precaution to ensure the well-being of everyone during our recruitment process.

The composition of Indigo's workforce reflects a wide variety of ages, profiles and roles. We maintain and promote this openness through a policy of equal opportunities and fight against all forms of discrimination in hiring and in work relationships. Applications from various groups are welcomed and encouraged. Every person has a right to equal treatment with respect to employment or discrimination, but it does not include any other person under the Human Rights Code. Accommodations are available on request in the relationship to the materials or processes process.

Successful candidates will be required to submit a Criminal Background Check.

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position. However, due to the high volume of applicants, we will only be contacting candidates selected for an interview. No agency or applicant phone calls please.

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: From $22.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Every Weekend

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to work Sat/Sun & Stat holidays 6pm - 6am?

Licence/Certification:

  • class 5 drivers license? (required)
