title: newManager, Global OTP Solutions - Ground Optimization
description:
Description


Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Global On Time Performance Solutions - Ground Optimization which is an integral member of the Airports management team. This role is responsible to ideate, lead, and facilitate On-Time Performance (OTP) improvements and implementation of solutions for a sustainable OTP strategy at our Canada West & US stations. This role will collaborate with cross functional teams to ensure assigned improvement activities are delivered on-time-in-full as part of our promise to our customers. Leadership, teamwork, collaboration, creativity, and engagement at all levels will promote a culture of responsible performance in concert with a safe and secure operation.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads the practical application and execution of prioritized initiatives fed through the OTP strategy, ECX program and other streams impacting OTP.

  • Continuously aligns with, and collaborates with functional resources from Airports NA, ECX Program, and the corporate OTP strategy on delivering OTP priorities.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify improvement opportunities at Canada West & US stations and works with frontline Airports employees to ensure a bottom-up ideation model.

  • Determines and defines project scope and objectives, and predicts resources needed to reach objectives and manages resources in an effective and efficient manner.

  • Maintain responsibility for deliverables and timelines, shifting priorities as needed and managing stakeholder relationships and expectations.

  • Develop a deep understanding of specific areas of the business and key metrics that drive operational efficiency.

  • Develops and manages a detailed project schedule/work plan for Canada West & US initiatives.

  • Creates and maintains comprehensive project documentation.

  • Organizes appropriate business update meetings to ensure senior management understand cross-dependencies and are kept informed of progress and outcomes.

  • Develop executive-level communications and presentations for OTP initiatives to drive key stakeholder alignment to ensure initiatives are connected to broader Air Canada goals.

  • Tracks project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goals.

  • Collaborates with Change Mgmt team to implement methods of sustainable change & drive employee engagement.

  • Cultivates people and best practices that deliver continual improvement.

  • Manage changing priorities and aggressive deadlines in a dynamic landscape with poise and professionalism.

  • Identifies risk and issues, implementing mitigating actions to remove roadblocks.

  • Ensures Safety, Security and Service standards are adhered to, practiced consistently, and monitored.

  • Perform all other duties as assigned.

Qualifications


  • Undergraduate Degree or equivalent operational experience

  • Lean Six Sigma Green / Black Belt an asset

  • 3+ years demonstrated experience leading improvement initiatives, delivering benefits.

  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred

  • Experience working with large and varied groups of stakeholders with competing priorities; ability to bring others together to work towards a common goal

  • Experience seeing projects through the full life cycle

  • Demonstrated ability to apply lean six sigma methodology as needed in initiatives.

  • Proven ability to solve problems creatively.

  • Goal-oriented with a vision for sustainable results

  • Team player with a collaborative strategy in consideration of multiple and differing priorities

  • Ability to thrive in fast moving and highly complex environments

  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills with a strong sense of people, culture, and change management

  • PC proficiency (Word, Excel, PowerPoint; Graphical and statistical applications).

  • Strong and disciplined management skills

  • Bilingualism an asset



Conditions of Employment:

  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.

  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required


Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.



Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

title: Product Manager, Airport Technology Solutions
description:
Position title: Product Manager, Airport Technology Solutions

Reports to: Director, Airport Technology and Innovation

Location: Montreal

1. Summary

The Product Manager, Airport Technology Solutions leads the development, maintenance, go-to market and lifecycle of specific operational solutions that ACI World deploys for the benefit of the aviation community. The Manager is responsible for end-to-end product management, from engaging with external third parties and contracted vendors, relationship management with all of ACI World’s clients, business development as-well as overall project management for the solutions deployed.

2. Primary Responsibilities

Product Management

· Be the subject matter expert for ACI World’s technological solutions to the aviation community.

· Be accountable for the management of various work programmes with third party vendors.

· Project manage proof of concepts and large rollouts in collaboration with third party vendors.

· Compile a strategic roadmap for the rollout of new technology solutions to the aviation community.

· Ensure the on-boarding of new clients through business development initiatives.

· Develop practical ACI guidance documents to support onboarding new clients.

· Be accountable for relationship management to ACI’s clients, including client satisfaction and retainment.

· Ensure budgets are tightly controlled and ensure cost control measures across the product lifecycle.

· Ensure Service Level Agreements are closely monitored across ACI’s technology solutions.

· Provide industry analysis of airport technology solutions.

· Support the work of the Airport Technology and Innovation Team in the wider strategy of deploying best practices to ACI airport members.

· Engage with the ACI World Airport IT Standing Committee members and support the implementation of its work plan

· Draft articles for publications, the ACI Insights Blog and other communication means.

· Carry out other duties as assigned.

Cross organisation and department support

· Where possible, provide technical expertise and support across the Safety, Security and Operations Department in other areas such as Facilitation and Passenger Services.

· Provide technical expertise and support across the organisation as needed.

· Assist in ACI advisory opportunities by providing technical expertise as appropriate.

· Support ACI events, in particular in the domains of Airport Technology and Innovation.

Industry cooperation

· Liaise with other industry groups in coordination with relevant departments across the range of industry associations

· Represent ACI and provide subject matter expertise in industry groups as needed and in coordination with relevant departments

3. Minimum Qualifications

Knowledge/Education

· University degree in a technical or business domain, such as aviation, engineering, planning, business development, Information Technology or equivalent.

· IT or Technical knowledge of solutions such as Application Programme Interfaces.

· Desirable: supplementary airport or aviation-related professional qualification.

Experience/Years and Type

· Experience in product management of technology solutions including API interfaces.

· Experience in project management.

· Experience in business development.

· Experience in client and vendor relationship management.

· Highly desirable, cross sectoral airport operations experience (airside, airspace, terminal, security, facilitation, etc.)

· Highly desirable: Knowledge of Airport IT infrastructure

· Desirable: experience in data analysis and data science

Skills and Abilities

· Well-developed technical writing and spoken English skills.

· Pro-active, collegial, tactful, diplomatic, and discreet in all dealings.

· Ability to establish and maintain good relationships with ACI clients and service providers.

· Ability to establish and maintain good relationships with ACI staff members.

· Ability to develop close working relationships with ACI Regional Offices.

· Ability to work in a service-orientated culture, delivering excellent service levels to ACI members.

· Ability to conduct analysis of data and create data dashboards.

· Excellent computer skills (Microsoft Office)

· Ability to communicate in a welcoming, effective, and dynamic manner.

· Ability to work under pressure and deliver.

· Ability to understand interdependencies, sensitivity, and strategic relationships between different areas of expertise in aviation.
· Ability to develop negotiations skills and present highly technical solutions understandable to all levels

ACI ́s core values:

  • Integrity
  • Member Focus
  • Professionalism
  • Teamwork

What we offer:

4 weeks of vacation/year

5 sick days/ year

5 mental wellness days/year

Employee cellphone (iPhone XR) with TELUS Health virtual care included

Health insurance coverage from your first day of employment

Opus/EXO Transit discount on monthly pass

Hybrid Model: 10 days from home/10 days in office

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Commuter benefits
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Interviews are done on MS Teams

Application question(s):

  • Do you have an University degree in a technical or business domain, such as aviation, engineering, planning, business development, Information Technology or equivalent?
  • Do you have IT or Technical knowledge of solutions such as Application Programme Interfaces

Experience:

  • Product Management: 1 year (preferred)

title: Assistant Warehouse Manager
description:
Grow With Us!

Hudson is North America's leading travel retailer. For over 30 years, Hudson has met the needs and wants of travelers in more than 1,000 duty-free, duty-paid, and food & beverage stores. We couldn't serve our customers, landlords, and partners in airports, commuter terminals, hotels, and casinos without the continued support of our greatest assets: our team members. We're dedicated to hiring and training exceptional team members, who are committed to serving the customer as the Traveler's Best Friend. We strive to ensure we're fulfilling our team members' career potentials through training, skills-development, and career pathways - as our team members grow and succeed both personally and professionally, so does Hudson.

What We Will Offer You:
  • Competitive Salary
  • Health & Well Being: Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
  • Universal Life Insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Retirement Programs & Matching Employee Contributions: RRSP
  • A 20% of Hudson Employee Discount
  • A 50% off Hudson Food & Beverage Discount

This Assistant Warehouse Manager Job Is For You, If You Would Enjoy:
  • Managing and executing all activities of the warehouse in support of the overall operation;
  • Helping to promote an overall corporate image of excellence through a strong work ethic, leadership by example,
  • Providing consistent delivery of excellent customer service throughout the warehouse operation.
  • Working in the Warehouse at Halifax Stanfield International Airport

Your Team is counting on you as an Assistant Warehouse Manager to:
  • Provide full flexible and open availability to work any shift throughout the day (between the hours of 6:00 am and 9:00 pm), any day of the week, including weekends & holidays
  • Work a full-time schedule

Assistant Warehouse Manager Key Duties:
  • Protects all company assets in the warehouse including non-stock merchandise.
  • Provides a safe and clean environment for warehouse personnel.
  • Recruits and trains warehouse personnel.
  • Schedules warehouse operational hours to accommodate business requirements.
  • Supervises and delegates tasks to warehouse employees.
  • Places stock orders as required.
  • Counts and receives incoming merchandise; reports shortages/overages to vendors in a timely manner, before required deadlines.
  • Counts and completes all appropriate paperwork for merchandise returns to vendors.
  • Adjusts prices (mark ups/ mark-downs) as per the General Manager's instructions.
  • Provides ongoing stock replenishment to the sales floor.
  • Isolates, sorts, and organizes all damaged and outdated products for subsequent supplier credits and returns.
  • Organizes all preparatory work for quarterly press counts and annual inventory.
  • Consults and helps plan activities with Warehouse Manager; manages the activities of warehouse staff.
  • Provides supervision, guidance and support to warehouse staff.
  • Works with vendors, on-site jobbers and sales representatives.
  • Communicates with home office personnel.

Required Qualifications:
  • Minimum 6 months warehouse manager/supervisor experience
  • High organizational and administrative skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Must be well versed with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook)
  • SAP - inventory control
  • Leadership qualities and demonstrated organizational skills.
  • Good time-management skills and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to multi-task.
  • Requires the ability to speak, read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence, and policy documents, as well as converse comfortably with subordinates.
  • The ability to lift and/or move up to 20 kg / 40 lbs
  • Requires the ability to bend, twist, and stand to perform normal job functions

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Retail and/or office management beneficial

Some of our company-offered benefits for you and your family include:
  • Health & Well Being: Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Various Personal and Parental Leave Programs
  • Universal Life Insurance
  • Retirement Programs & Matching Employee Contributions: 401K & RRSP
  • Employee Recognition & Anniversary Programs
  • Training, Development, and Growth Opportunities
  • Tuition Assistance & Scholarship Programs
  • Referral Bonus Program

"Depending on the location of the position, applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States or Canada for any employer."

"Hudson is an Equal Opportunity Employer of all qualified individuals. All employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, military leave or veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace in which we value diversity and unique experiences, backgrounds and identities."

All offers are contingent upon successful completion and passing of background checks and/or employment verification results.

Note to staffing agencies: Please do not contact Hudson (including the recruitment team or any hiring managers) regarding this position with candidates. If assistance is needed in filling any position for Hudson, a member of our recruiting team will reach out directly.

title: Ramp Lead - Airport
description:
PRÉSENTATION DE L'ENTREPRISE

Présent dans l’industrie des services d’escale depuis plusieurs années, Trans-Sol Aviation Service est un acteur reconnu pour ses services au sol pour les compagnies aériennes au Québec. Grâce à ses filiales à Montréal et Québec et à huit points de service, TSAS met son savoir-faire et son expérience au service des compagnies aériennes pour le traitement de leurs passagers, cargo et de leurs appareils.

Relevant du Superviseur de la rampe, le chef d’équipe rampe est responsable de répartir les tâches entre les différents membres de son équipe. Ce dernier aura la responsabilité d’assurer le bon fonctionnement des opérations, de maintenir les procédures de travail déjà établies en plus de s’assurer du respect des règles de sécurité.

TÂCHES

  • Répartie le travail à être accompli au groupe d’employés et leur transmet les instructions nécessaires ;
  • Assure que les tâches nécessaires soient effectuées dans les délais prescrits par les différents clients ;
  • Prend en charge le traitement des vols qui lui sont assignés ;
  • Doit assurer que les rapports d’incidents ou d’accidents soient remplis lorsque requis ;
  • Est responsable de déterminer la procédure de travail appropriée selon les exigences des clients ;
  • Réquisitionne les outils, le matériel, l’équipement et les services nécessaires ;
  • Coordonne, inspecte et enregistre le travail effectué par son groupe ;
  • Remplit les documents nécessaires au travail de son groupe ;
  • Utilise différents outils de communication afin d’accomplir ces tâches ;
  • Rapporte toutes anomalies ou disfonctionnements au superviseur en fonction ;
  • Est responsable de suivre et demeurer à jour dans ses formations.

COMPÉTENCES

  • Bon Leadership
  • Prise d’initiatives
  • Esprit d’analyse
  • Rigueur et sens des responsabilités
  • Très grande autonomie
  • Gestion du stress

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Expérience à titre d’agent de rampe
  • Bilingue
  • Détenir un permis de conduire valide (Classe 5);
  • Posséder la citoyenneté canadienne ou un permis de travail valide (ou PVT);
  • Être disponible en tout temps (matin, soir et fin de semaine).

AVANTAGES :

  • Passes stand-by avec notre partenaire Air Transat illimitées pour toute la famille (conjoint(e), parents et enfants)
  • Programme REER contributif
  • Assurances collectives
  • Télémédecine
  • Programme d’aide aux employés
  • Opportunités d’avancement rapide - Salaire de chef d'équipe : 23$/h
  • Club social
  • Programme Passion Voyage : Tous nos employés ont droit à une allocation voyage annuelle de 500 $ à 1 500 $. L'allocation est applicable pour le remboursement des frais de billets d'avion, d'hébergement, de location de véhicule, etc. Le montant de l'allocation est aussi applicable pour les membres de la famille de l'employé, incluant ses parents, enfants et partenaires. Le montant est cumulable pour une période maximale de trois ans.

Aucune formation requise, nous offrons la formation complète !

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent

Salaire : 23,00$ par heure

Horaire :

  • Quart de jour
  • Quart de nuit

Ce dernier aura la responsabilité d’assurer le bon fonctionnement des opérations, de maintenir les procédures de travail déjà établies en plus de s’assurer du respect des règles de sécurité.', "Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent", 'Remplit les documents nécessaires au travail de son groupe ;', 'Télémédecine']

title: Training & Compliance Manager
description:
Job Details

Description

The Training & Compliance Manager role will be to drive, monitor and ensure Training compliance in YYZ Ground Handling & Cargo.

Safety, Security, and Environmental stewardship are core values of Menzies Aviation (MA). MA has a duty of care to provide a safe workplace to our Employees. Similarly, all Menzies’ employees have an obligation to assist in maintaining a safe work environment via the following principles:

  • Ensure that they work safely in accordance with company policy and procedures
  • Report safety incidents, risks or safety concerns using the Safety Management System (SMS) reporting system
  • Recognize opportunities to contribute to the continuous improvement of safety and its management
  • Stay current with information and knowledge relevant to performing their duties safely.

Primary Accountabilities and Duties:

  • Provides support to the Station Management team as well as Department Managers as it pertains to Training and Development of employees
  • Assist where necessary to conduct training.
  • Schedule and coordinate training programs and initiatives both internally and externally.
  • Report any breaches of statutory requirements or company best practice to management.
  • Complete weekly & monthly training compliance reports for the Station
  • Participate in Training audits daily/monthly/annually and provide corrective action assistance to management.
  • Compiling annual training plans for the station.
  • Ensure Stations LMS are up to date and that all internal and external training is tracked with the LMS
  • Maintain compliance with all governmental, regulatory, customer and company policies/procedures in terms of Training and Safety requirements.
  • Ensure Daily attendance is received and send to relevant Station and planning Managers
  • Ensure daily training attendance are being entered and encoded at station level for all Training interventions.
  • Ensure that the station comply with customer and company policies and procedures pertaining to training.
  • Conduct station training audits when required to ensure Training delivery and administration meets customer and company requirements
  • Attend PIR, SQRB and SSAG meetings when needed and assist in obtaining relevant training records when and where needed from stations for Investigation purposes.
  • Assist Station Management/Regional Management during incidents investigations in obtaining relevant Training records and Training requirements.
  • Prepare and distribute reports as requested
  • Assist in station start-up processes by ensuring training is planned, coordinated, delivered, and recorded as per company and customer requirements.
  • Ensure effective communication with all airline customers within the region
  • Implement a monthly reporting program for the station
  • Monitor, improve and maintain training compliance levels for the station
  • Ensure all required personnel have access to airline training programs
  • Ensure that there are sufficient trainers to deliver Menzies Aviation and customer training in the Business unit
  • Support the business unit in closing any audit findings as it pertains to training
  • Model the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion, and safety of others.
  • Use proven training metrics to build training programs, completes training needs/ gap analysis
  • Proactively promote People, Passion, Pride
  • Proactively promote the Menzies Stop Work Authority
  • Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications:

  • At least 3 years aviation experience in Below the Wing and/or Above the Wing Operations
  • Must have extensive experience in below the wing operation including but not limited to push back operations, Lower Deck Loader, Main Deck Loader, Belt Loader, Passenger Boarding Bridges, Baggage Tractor
  • Must obtain and retain Transport Canada Security Clearance.
  • Previous experience within the Training department will be beneficial.
  • Thorough Knowledge and understanding of Airline & Company GOM’s.
  • During Probation you will be required to fully familiarize yourself with all Training methods-In Class Training, On the Job Training, Menzies Learner Management System (LMS) and employee recertification as well as Compliance on all levels.
  • High school diploma with at least three (3) years of experience in Airline/Airport operations.
  • Must be able to work extended hours on short notice during non-routine operations.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office programes including but not limited to Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Understanding of the wider airport operational environment.
  • Experience and understanding of the commercial issues in aviation.
  • Experience of Health and Safety management.
  • Thorough understanding of Airline and Menzies Aviation Training requirements.
  • Previous Menzies Aviation Experience will be advantageous.
  • Must be able to lift up to 70lbs when required.
  • Must be able to set priorities, meet deadlines, and manage multiple tasks.
  • Correct use of English grammar, spelling, punctuation, and vocabulary
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills required
  • Strong team management, collaboration, and facilitation skills
  • Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
  • Ability to write technical reports and correspondence
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the public

title: newGuest Service Manager (Front Office)
description:
Under the direction of the Operations Manager & General Manager, the incumbent will be responsible for effectively offering support to the Operations Manager & General Manager and in their absence managing and overseeing all aspects of the hotel Operations including: guest relations, front desk, sales, housekeeping, maintenance, product quality, accounting, team building and staff development for the interest and benefit of key stakeholders. Directs and coordinates activities of the hotel to obtain efficiency and maximize profits by performing duties personally or through direct reports.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Leadership, training and management of all departments with particular responsibility for the Front Office Operations;
  • Implement and maintain all company policies and procedures;
  • Ensure 100% guest satisfaction;
  • To ensure Revenue Management goals are met or exceeded
  • Develop, prepare, execute and achieve financial goals;
  • Train, support and coach staff to create a productive, efficient team;
  • Oversee day-to-day operations;
  • Representative of the management team to hotel guests, employees and members of the community
  • To ensure that proper maintenance of the hotel’s physical facilities resulting in employee and guest safety, orderly operations, good appearance, compliance with brand and legislative standards resulting in budget control.
  • Increase Market Share by knowing the hotel’s position to the local competition and ensuring that plans are developed to improve that position by maximize hotel sales
  • Reports and follows procedures with regard to any injuries and accidents in the workplace, instructs staff to follow safe working practices and enforces Health and Safety regulations.
  • Ensure that all appropriate systems and controls are in place to produce accurate reports for Westmont
  • Implement and maintain all company policies and procedures;
  • Create reports as assigned;
  • Train new Front Desk Representatives utilizing training materials;
  • Periodically monitor interactions of Front Desk representatives with guests to ensure adequate quality control;
  • Participate in all required meetings providing input and recommendations.
    MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS:
  • Minimum 5 years Managerial experience within the hospitality industry
  • Ability to deal with all levels of management, staff and owners in a professional manner;
  • Experience in the supervision of personnel: recruitment, training and motivation;
  • Background in the development and execution of business, marketing and sales plans and operating budgets;
  • Proficient / familiarity with computerized systems;
  • Ability to work within deadlines;
  • Proven ability to manage multi-tasked assignments;
  • Familiarity with accounting principles;
  • Familiarity with operations is an asset
    WORKING CONDITIONS
  • Governed by concurrent and dynamic deadlines, despite conflicting priorities and frequent interruptions.
  • Constantly handling of queries and calls from guests, potential guests, and other departments.
  • Must be able to work flexible hours; day, evening, weekend and holiday shifts.

title: Bilingual Passenger Service Agent Lead | LOT Polish Airlines...
description:
Job Details

Description

Main Accountabilities Include:

  • Leads a team of Passenger Service Agents
  • Ensure accuracy of all weight and balance requirements
  • Promptly handle all customer service complaints with a focus on positive resolution.
  • Complete all check-in procedures including the handling of reservations, ticketing, seat assignments, airport announcements and checking for proper international documentation.
  • Ensures tasks are performed in accordance with the Company and Airlines specific procedures and policies.
  • Assist customers with special needs and unaccompanied minors.
  • When operating jetways, Passenger Service Agents will be required to work at heights of over 15 feet and be responsible for open/closing aircraft doors.
  • Must be able to read and interpret aircraft weight and balance loading instructions, hazardous material identification labels, aircraft loading manifests, and baggage and cargo routing tags.
  • Ensure the safe and secure operations in accordance with the highest possible standards of health, safety, security and all government statutory requirements
  • You may be required to drive and operate small specialized commercial vehicles at times and as such you will require a valid driver’s license with a clear driving record.
  • Required to attend the mandatory training imposed by the Company and Airlines as per job role.
  • Must be able to comfortably and continuously move/lift customer luggage with an average weight of 50 pounds, in some cases exceeded 70 pounds.
  • Promote a professional image at all time and comply with company uniform standards
  • Leads by example.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Must be Fluent in one of the following languages:
    1. Polish
    2. Ukrainian
    3. Russian
  • Must be at least 18 years of age and legally able to work in Canada;
  • Must have high school diploma, GED or equivalent work experience;
  • Must be able to speak, read, and write in English;
  • Must complete and pass initial new hire classroom and on-the-job training
  • Must be able to hold and maintain all required airport security clearance
  • Reliability, our customer and your fellow employees rely on you
  • Must be available and flexible to work variable shifts including weekends and holidays;
  • Must be comfortable working in an airport environment
  • Position requires long periods of time at the ticket counter and gate check-in areas; must be able to stand for prolonged periods of time.

title: General Manager | YYZ Ground Handling Operations
description:
Job Details

Description

Main accountabilities include:

  • Ensuring service delivery to customer airlines in accordance with airline contracts and within the agreed budget level.
  • Fully responsible for all aspects of the station operations. Services offered at the station include Passenger, Ramp Handling, Cabin Cleaning and GSE Maintenance.
  • Fully accountable for the financial performance and compliance with Corporate Governance, legal and quality aspects of the Menzies businesses in the station.
  • Regularly interacts with customers to promote the station and to measure the level of customer satisfaction. Uses customer feedback to constantly develop and improve capabilities and processes.
  • Ensuring safety and security procedures are according to standards set within the Menzies Health & Safety Regulations and according to international aviation standards.
  • Implementation of the company policies and procedures, promoting sound safety, security and people management practice.
  • Ownership for Customer Services operations and situational awareness and integrity of Terminal and Groundside operations, including being the single point of contact.
  • Full accountability for Health & Safety issues, operational and financial performance regarding Ground Handling operations within the business unit.
  • Monitor airline volumes and forecasts; and based on information, pre-plan to mitigate potential impact to ground handling operations and flow.
  • Lead and motivate hard working teams to deliver excellent quality and productivity. Directing and motivating Managers to achieve agreed targets.
  • Routine liaison with Senior Management, Airport Operations Directors, handling agents, customs, immigration and security officials as well as other airport stakeholders.
  • Provide reports as required and analytics around service delivery measurements.
  • Analyse issues and establish operational priorities; identify gaps and/or changes required to policies, SOP’s or other protocols and provide this information to the applicable Functional Managers.
  • Leadership, management, planning and coaching of teams to ensure safe and secure operations, including identification and resolution of complex situations, implementing IRROPS procedures as required.
  • Planning resource allocation for the station.
  • Responsible for Menzies relevant audit requirements related to the business unit.
  • Supporting the development of the business unit with accurate and timely project work.
  • Managing the station equipment planning cycle.
  • Responsible for ensuring compliance with Airport policies including but not limited to Public Safety, Security, SeMS, IMS practices, Environmental policies, Workplace Health & Safety and all other governances through Transport Canada.
  • Ensuring compliance with all internal and external operational and administrative requirements.
  • Responsible for Revenue, Payroll and Accounts Payable functions related to the business unit.
  • Prepare financial reports and analyse trends, costs, revenue and obligations incurred to predict future revenue and expenses.
  • Generate financial statements for the business unit and explain differences/variances in revenue, labour and operating costs against budget.
  • Interface with internal and external auditors as required, with responsibility for year-end auditing process related to the station.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • 5 to 7 years management experience in Ground Handling business.
  • A proven track record in managing a business unit with more than 10,000 turns per year.
  • Financial management skills of a medium to large size business.
  • Fully conversant with airline ground handling procedures, aviation safety and security procedures.
  • Solid knowledge of ramp GSE.
  • Good working knowledge of IATA Standard Ground Handling Agreement.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence, collaborate and negotiate cross functionally in unionized and non-unionized environments. As well with external stakeholders to achieve results.
  • Solid knowledge of narrow and wide body aircraft operations.
  • Knowledge of airline, inspection agency, passenger process and baggage handling procedures as they relate to Service Delivery.
  • Experience in operational planning and resource allocation.
  • Understanding of the wider airport operational environment.
  • Experience and understanding of the commercial issues in aviation.
  • Ability to successfully manage under pressure and respond to critical and or changing priorities throughout the day.
  • Computer literate with knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel.
  • Experience in Health and Safety management.
  • Must be able to obtain and retain a Transportation Security Clearance.
  • Must be available and flexible to work variable shifts including weekends and holidays.

title: Shift Manager
description:
About Earls Kitchen + Bar

Some 40 years ago, Leroy “Bus” Earl Fuller and his son Stanley Earl Fuller had a simple idea: to create a laid-back burger and beer joint filled with warm, friendly people. The first Earls restaurant opened in Edmonton, Alberta in 1984, and it quickly took off — Earls has never looked back, opening locations across Canada and the US. Today, Earls has expanded to 69 locations (and counting!) and we're looking forward to our continued growth across North America.


While much has changed since Bus and Stan opened the first Earls restaurant all those years ago, many things are the same — Earls is still a family-owned business, run by great people who are passionate about serving our guests delicious, globally-inspired food and drinks through exceptional service and an inviting environment. Our people are at the heart of everything we do, and we’re driven to make their lives awesome through the Earls Experience. We’re talking about a culture that’s built on growth and development, and the declaration of living large, purposeful lives full of fun.

#PeopleGrowHere!


We are looking for a passionate Shift Manager to grow our leadership team. As a Shift Manager, you’re committed to being your best self and working with integrity as you learn how to operate multimillion-dollar restaurants. Our ideal candidate has a commitment to teamwork and a desire to learn and grow.


As a Shift Manager, you will:

  • Exemplify exceptional leadership skills. Using our core values, you take a stand for yourself, your career, and the way you lead.
  • Consistently coach others. Support employees with potential issues and resolutions in order to ensure the highest profitability and smoothest operation. Train employees on delivery of irresistible food and drink, while engaging in authentic conversation.
  • Be a problem solver and a supportive team player. Tackle problems by using your multi-tasking and communication skills, and be empowered to make decisions for you and your team members.
  • Demonstrate your passion for the guest experience. Display your love for food and drink through exceptional menu and product knowledge.


What we need from you:

  • 3 years of restaurant experience, with 1 year in a leadership-focused role.
  • A passion and commitment to hospitality, teamwork, and fun.
  • A commitment to fostering a supportive and engaging experience for your team members and guests.
  • A willingness to learn and an openness to feedback, coaching, and mentorship.
  • The ability to legally work in Canada.


What’s in it for you:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Flexible scheduling to support work/life balance
  • Leadership meal budget
  • Employee discount
  • Mentorship programs
  • In-house hospitality and culinary training programs
  • Leadership programs
  • Career development and opportunity for advancement


Apply Now!

title: Account Manager - LOT Airlines
description:
Job Details

Description

Main accountabilities include:

  • Responsible for the CRM of customers for local station
  • Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors
  • Forecast and track key account metrics
  • Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives
  • Act as liaison with the assigned customers and all Menzies Aviation activities
  • Ensure that the SGHA with the customer is being followed
  • Attend all customer required meetings and represent Menzies Aviation professionally
  • Monitors performance and take actions to communicate any shortfalls with all stakeholders
  • Provides reports as required, and service delivery measurements
  • Act as a key stakeholder to any customer requests or needs of Menzies Aviation
  • Responsible for working with the Sales team to onboard and integrate new clients and develop existing client relationships
  • Work shifts as required by the business
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Drive continuous improvements in all manners of the operation to ensure the on-going success and relationship with the customer

Key Skills, Qualifications and Experience:

  • Business Degree or BA in International Relations/Studies
  • 3 to 5 years account management experience in the Airport Ground Handling industry
  • Business acumen, project management and CRM experience an asset
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills- capable in presenting and communicating with senior levels of management
  • Extensive experience in airport operations, ground handling, passenger services, and cargo
  • Excellent leadership and people management skills
  • Must be able to hold and maintain all required security clearances
  • Must be able to work with a multi-cultural team and to adjust to the station environment
  • Good knowledge of the IATA Standard Ground Handling Agreement
  • Drive for continuous improvement and process development of the business

Other requirements:

  • Must be a minimum of 18 years of age and legally able to work in Canada
  • Computer literate, solid knowledge of MS Office as well as other related programs
  • Previous airline/aviation operational knowledge is required
  • Must be able to obtain and hold all required security clearances
  • Familiar with GOMs, Airline procedures, Airport procedures, Airport legislation
  • Fully versed on SGHA concepts
  • KPI/SLA driven to meet customer expectations by delivering excellence

title: Aircraft Cleaning Manager
description:
This position will oversee the aircraft grooming and work execution for PrimeFlight at Vancouver International Airport. In addition to managing individuals at the site, will also be in-charge of the complete operation not limited to coordinating the paperwork, communication with the internal and external customers, job scheduling, inspection. Champions process improvement strategies and training. Identify and provide constructive feedback on challenges on a regular basis to cut costs and improve efficiency.

Ensures a safe work environment by following all PrimeFlight and Customer rules and regulations regarding the workplace:

  • Understand contract requirements and customer expectations.
  • Supervise the use of people and equipment to efficiently complete the tasks as directed and within established Company and customer standards.
  • Understand, be able to perform and assist subordinates in completing their assigned tasks.
  • Maintains compliance with company policies and procedures by assuring that established procedures are followed to ensure a safe and efficient work environment for our customers and their property, as well as Company employees and property.
  • Work with your team to coach, mentor, and counsel employees to work together by encouraging them to build trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.
  • Ensure all daily maintenance and housekeeping procedures are accomplished.
  • Interprets and communicates items in question in the manuals and/or policies to employees.
  • Monitors and/or conducts required training of personnel.
  • Provides employee counseling and discipline as needed.
  • Ensures the security of all company funds, supplies and equipment.
  • Maintains working relationship with customers and provides prompt response to service requests.
  • Serve as point person for customers and management to alert them to any irregular operations which may cause delays or otherwise impact service to our customers.
  • Ensure functions are performed according to Company, customer, airport and regulatory policies and procedures.

Requirements:

· Foster a safe working environment

· Hold employees accountable for the safety audit performance and all operational metrics

· Monitor and record operational and financial performance and report as required

· Resolve promptly all service issues to ensure contract retention

· Must be able to pass a background check, and able to obtain and maintain a Restricted Area Identification Card (RAIC)

· Must be able to work various shifts and days of the week. Airlines are 24/7, so we require our team to be flexible to work various shifts including nights, weekends and holidays

Education/Experience:

· High school diploma

· Minimum of 2 years’ successful industry-related or airline experience in leadership required

Competency:

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Problem Solving, Customer Service, Interpersonal, and Oral Communication.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed in this Job Description are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

General Qualifications:

· Eligible to work in the Canada

Language Ability:

Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to communicate effectively in English.

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Computer Skills:

Computer, tablet or smart phone ability.

Certificates and Licenses:

No certifications needed.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

Ability to lead and manage a team.

Work Environment:

· The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

· The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate but may become high at various times. Employee must be willing to wear/utilize company-supplied personal protective equipment (hearing protection) to mitigate their noise exposure.

· Some work is in an outside environment, with exposure to hot and cold temperatures and inclement weather.

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

· Continuously stand and walk for 6-8 hours

· Be able to lift a minimum of 75 pounds.

· Be able to bend, stretch, twist, squat, and reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs

· Use hands to finger, handle, or feel

· Be able to hear and respond to the spoken voice and to audible alarms generated by terminal environment

· Specific vision abilities required for this job include: Close vision (clear vision at 20 inches or less); distance vision (clear vision at 20 feet or more); color vision (ability to identify and distinguish colors); peripheral vision (ability to observe an area that can be seen up and down or to the left and right while eyes are fixed on a given point); depth perception (three-dimensional vision, ability to judge distances and spatial relationships)

#PF_NOW

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Night shift
  • On call
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

title: newRamp Manager
description:
Job responsibilities:

  • Supervise crews while directing the work of ramp leads and crew members as they unload/unload and service aircraft
  • Create and manage schedules to ensure adequate staffing for all ramp operations
  • Assist with hiring, and provide on-the-job training to new crew members
  • Serve as point person for customers and management to minimize or eliminate potential delays
  • Observe and enforce all company and airline safety regulations and policies
  • Assure that all GSE maintenance procedures are assigned and completed on each shift
  • Read and interpret aircraft weight and balance loading instructions, hazardous materials identification labels, aircraft loading manifest and log flight information for billing purposes
  • Actively search for and report to station management any future business opportunities
  • Assist with all ramp team duties (safety walks, baggage/cargo handling, aircraft servicing, safely operating GSE around aircraft, etc.) as needed.

Qualifications:

  • Demonstrate strong communication skills to interact professionally with team members and customers
  • Be at least 18 years old and possess a high school diploma, GED or work experience equivalent
  • Have a valid driver’s license
  • Obtain airport security clearance which includes an extensive employment, criminal record and residence background check
  • Proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 with a vaccine recognized by the Public Health Agency of Canada

Physical Requirements:

  • Lift up to 70 pounds (32 kg) on a regular basis
  • Carry heavy items up and down jetway stairs
  • Climb, bend, kneel, crawl, and stoop on a frequent basis and for extended periods
  • Work outside in all types of weather, in a loud environment

Airlines are 24/7, so we need our team members to be flexible to work various shifts including nights, weekends and holidays. Some travel may be required.

Job Type: Full-time

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Winnipeg, MB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • Ramp: 4 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 Driver's Lincense (required)

Expected start date: 2022-05-09

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Operations Supervisor

Full TimeStation Support
YYC - Calgary International Airport, Calgary, AB, CA
Requisition ID: 1235
APPLY

Do you enjoy working outdoors in a fast-paced, safety obsessed aviation environment?

ATS is an aviation services company operating in more than 50 cities across North America. We employ over 3,000 people servicing nearly 200 airline customers every day! Our aviation roots span 45 years and our strong reputation in ground services and hospitality are the foundation of our success. We are committed to providing the highest level of quality service and continuing our track record of outstanding safety. As we continue to grow, we are looking for only the best in the industry.

Then let your career take off with ATS as an Operations Supervisor!

Job responsibilities:

  • Provide the principle operations communications between ATS Ramp Operations and the customer
  • Monitor all flight activity, record and update daily flight records with key information
  • Coordinate all towing activity, obtain and track gate activity including all changes
  • Be accountable for monitoring operational performance, maintaining Service Level Agreements (SLA) statistics as well as daily performance statistics
  • Works closely with Duty Manager and Ramp Supervisor to ensure resources are allocated accordingly to meet operational demands and ensures that unserviceable GSE is reported to maintenance

Qualifications:
  • Demonstrate strong math and computer skills and excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • Be at least 18 years of age and possess a High school diploma, GED or work experience equivalent
  • Possess a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record
  • Be able to pass a 5-year extensive employment, criminal record and residence background check
Physical Requirements:

  • Lift up to 70 pounds (32 kg) on a regular basis
  • Carry heavy items up and down jetway stairs
  • Climb, bend, kneel, crawl and stoop on a frequent basis and for extended periods
  • Work outside in all types of weather, around jet and machinery noises

Airlines are 24/7, so we need our team members to be flexible to work various shifts including nights, weekends and holidays. The successful ATS team member brings their “A” game every day with energy and enthusiasm, respect for their team, and the highest regard for safety!

title: Assistant General Manager - Multi Unit - Airport Retail
description:
Le candidat idéal aura une expérience de la vente au détail et de la vente et un désir de rejoindre un concessionnaire aéroportuaire passionnant, énergique et tendance. Rôle clé de l’entreprise en offrant une expérience de magasin client exceptionnelle par l’intermédiaire des associés qu’ils gèrent.

Résumé du poste :

  • Motiver l’équipe grâce à la vision et à la direction de notre entreprise pour englober nos valeurs fondamentales
    Communiquer des attentes claires et tenir l’équipe de magasins responsable de la réalisation de toutes les normes de marque, de performance et de comportement
  • Diriger et inspirer une excellente culture de service à la clientèle en reconnaissant et en récompensant
    Établir des relations avec les pairs et la haute direction.
  • Recruter, embaucher, développer et retenir les meilleurs talents de vente pour les magasins afin d’inclure d’excellents niveaux de dotation
  • Former et développer continuellement des équipes
  • Fournir une rétroaction uniforme sur le rendement
  • Reconnaître les problèmes de rendement en temps opportun et établir un partenariat avec le directeur général et le gestionnaire régional des RH pour élaborer des plans d’action en vue de les résoudre
  • S'assurez que toutes les directives visuelles sont exécutées selon les normes.
  • Diriger et exécuter le merchandising stratégique pour maximiser les normes de vente et de présentation
  • Partenaire dans l’exécution de l’emplacement de tout le traitement des marchandises et le flux avec des normes exceptionnelles stockroom / entrepôt
  • S’associer au directeur général et au directeur de district/directeur régional pour exécuter le plan d’affaires de l’emplacement qui génèrent des résultats et maximisent les occasions d’affaires
  • Atteindre des budgets financiers prédéterminés pour inclure la limitation de la masse salariale
  • Fidélisez la marque de l’entreprise en faisant preuve de leadership commercial, de coaching et de connexion avec l’expérience client
  • Atteindre les objectifs de réduction des pertes des magasins tout en maintenant toutes les normes opérationnelles pour sécuriser les actifs.

Pour de plus amples renseignements, veuillez consulter www.paradies-na.com

Qualificatiosn;

  • Solides compétences en analyse, en établissement de priorités, en relations interpersonnelles, en résolution de problèmes et en planification
  • Solides compétences en communication verbale et écrite
  • Compétences en collaboration et capacité à bien travailler au sein d’une équipe
  • Capacité de travailler dans un environnement au rythme rapide et axé sur les délais
  • Capacité de travailler selon un horaire flexible, y compris les jours fériés, les nuits et les fins de semaine
  • Esprit d’entreprise et capacité de prendre des décisions éclairées dans un environnement trépidant
  • Diplôme d’études collégiales ou expérience équivalente.
  • Trois (3) ans d’expérience en marchandisage, en exploitation et en personnel en tant que directeur de vente au détail dans un grand magasin ou un magasin spécialisé / cadeaux.
  • Expérience dans la gestion d’associés aux ventes syndiqués.

The ideal candidate will have retail and sales experience and a desire to join an exciting, energetic and trend setting airport concessionaire. This role drives the company’s key performance metrics by delivering an exceptional customer store experience through the associates they manage.

Job Summary:

  • Motivate team through our company’s vision and direction to encompass our core values
  • Communicate clear expectations and hold location team accountable to achieve all brand, performance and behavior standards
  • Lead and inspire a great customer service culture by recognizing and rewarding
  • Build relationships with peer and upper management
  • Recruit, hire, develop and retain top sales talent for the stores to include excellent staffing levels
  • Train and continuously develop teams
  • Provide consistent performance feedback
  • Recognize performance issues in a timely manner and partner with General Manager and Regional HR Manager to develop action plans for resolution
  • Ensure that all visual directives are executed seamlessly
  • Direct and execute strategic merchandising to maximize sales and presentation standards
  • Partner in the location’s execution of all merchandise processing and flow to the floor in conjunction with exceptional stockroom/warehouse standards
  • Partner with General Manager and District Manager/Regional Director to execute the location business plan that drive results and maximize business opportunities
  • Achieve predetermined financial budgets to include payroll containment
  • Drive the company’s brand loyalty through demonstrating sales leadership, coaching and connecting with the customer experience
  • Achieve location shrink goals while maintaining all operational standards to secure the assets of the location

Qualifications:

  • Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving & planning skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Collaborative skills and ability to work well within a team
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule, including holidays, nights, and weekends
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to make sound decisions in a fast-paced environment
  • College Degree or equivalent experience.
  • Three (3) years of merchandising, operations, and personnel experience as a retail manager in either a department store or specialty/gift store.
  • Experience in managing unionized sales associates.

title: Ramp Lead Agent
description:
Job Details

Description

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Move cargo and baggage on and off aircraft and transport it between aircraft, airport terminals, air cargo facilities, and other aircraft.
  • Operate motorized equipment.
  • Read and interpret aircraft weight and balance loading instructions, hazardous material identification labels, aircraft loading manifests, and baggage and cargo routing tags.
  • Oversees a crew of 3-5 agents.
  • Briefs crew before flights on bag loads, positions to take and how flight will work.
  • Responsible for safe push back and communications with the flight crew during push back.
  • Responsible for all flight crew/gate crew paperwork before and after departure.
  • Oversees all operations at their gate/flight.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Required Skills:

  • Must be at least 18 years of age and legally able to work in Canada;
  • Must have high school diploma, GED or equivalent work experience;
  • Must be able to speak, read, and write in English;
  • Valid driver’s license with good driving record; must be able to pass DA training.
  • Must be able to hold and maintain all required airport security clearance.
  • Reliability, our customer and your fellow employees rely on you.
  • Capable of lifting comfortably 70 lbs;
  • Prior ramp experience a plus;
  • Must be available and flexible to work variable shifts including weekends and holidays;
  • Must be comfortable working in all weather conditions, work is primarily outdoors.

title: Lead, Customer Service Representative, - Ottawa
description:
Reporting to the Supervisor group you are responsible for leading and coaching the Customer Service Representatives (CSRs) in the execution of the operation. You plan where resources are deployed and help build a highly trained team which consistently achieves Porter’s Safety, Reliability and Service objectives. The Lead is the first level of leadership among the Airport Operations Team and is immersed in the operation. They work diligently and in conjunction with other departments to achieve a safe and reliable operation while delivering excellent service to our passengers. The Lead always sets the example and coaches Team Members to improve their performance.

The Lead conducts on the job training of the CSRs to build a high performing team.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Correctly identify operational issues, view situations in their entirety and provide sound judgment in managing challenging situations


  • Effectively plans and manages resources and team members while on shift to achieve safety, reliability and service goals

  • Models Porter’s core service behaviours and coaches CSRs to do the same

  • Promotes an operationally safe environment, ensuring that team members are following proper Porter safety procedures.

  • Makes decisions in accordance with Porter’s priorities of safety, reliability, and service

  • Responsible for ensuring safe and efficient handling of aircraft departure and arrivals

  • Adheres to and models company policies and procedures, acting quickly to coach and correct procedural drift with fellow team members

  • Supports Leadership in implementing change management initiatives at the Station

  • Assists Station Leadership in building a highly trained and high performance team

  • “First level” Station Leadership, actively supports team members

  • Identifies and reports team member punctuality/attendance and training issues daily

  • Takes an active role in training and retraining. Conducts on the job training and completes on the job checklists.

  • Assesses the work performance and grooming standards of CSRs.

  • Provides accurate, timely and constructive coaching and feedback. Alerts Station Leadership of feedback or ongoing concerns

  • Guides and mentors team members

  • Assists CSRs and delegates tasks to improve their efficiencies

  • Act as a point of escalation for passenger handling issues

  • Responsible for opening and closing the Station check- in, lounge and gate areas on a daily basis

  • Creates and encourages team spirit and synergy

  • Recognizes and reinforces the contribution of all team members

  • Provides customer feedback to Station Leadership team

  • Actively participates in Porter’s Safety Management System (SMS) including reporting hazards and incidents encountered in daily operations; understand, comply and promote the Company Safety Policy.

  • Models behaviours consistent with Our:Values and Porter’s Respect and Dignity Policy. Ensure all Team Members follow this example.


  • Other duties as assigned by Station Leadership.


BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES:


  • Concern for Safety     - Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others.


  • Leadership     - Sets an example for others to follow. Makes tough decisions, keeps a variety of perspectives in mind. Communicates openly and transparently with their team.

  • Teamwork     - Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals.

  • Customer Service     - Providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers).

  • Initiative     - Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise.

  • Results Focused     - Focusing efforts on achieving high-quality results consistent with the organization’s standards.


  • Fostering Communication     - Listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus.


QUALIFICATIONS:


  • Knowledge and proficiency in Navitaire/Go Now, Google office suite


  • Track record of establishing/maintaining positive and cooperative working relationships with others

  • Demonstrated Leadership potential

  • Dependability (must have a good attendance record and reliable on-time reporting for work)

  • Ability to problem solve and make decisions to enhance organizational effectiveness

  • Excellent time management and multi-tasking skills

  • Attention to detail; the capacity to prioritize by assessing situations to determine urgency

  • Must be flexible to work a variety of shift schedules


  • Mandatory COVID-19 vaccination

title: newRamp Supervisor
description:
Job Details

Description

Description
Move cargo and baggage on and off aircraft and transport it between aircraft, airport terminals, air cargo facilities, and other aircraft.
Operate motorized equipment.
Read and interpret aircraft weight and balance loading instructions, hazardous material identification labels, aircraft loading manifests, and baggage and cargo routing tags.
Supervise lead agents; allocating ramp agent resources as needed.
Complete shift reports and sign time cards.
Ensure that ramp personnel adhere to established company safety regulations.
Prepare disciplinary incident and or termination reports as needed for violations of company policy.
Assist in the preparation of performance evaluation forms.
Assist in the baggage handling area.
May occasionally operate various pieces of ground support equipment.
Report any significant deficiency in our products, materials, and documents.
Has the duty to suggest any improvements to working practices especially those relating to Safety and security.
Must have read and signed the Station Quality Manual, Emergency Response Procedures Manual, and the Station Security Manual.

Requirements
Prior ramp experience a plus
Must pass an FBI fingerprint check and obtain a custom seal.
Must be at least 18 years of age
Must have a high school diploma or equivalent work experience
Must pass a drug test
Must be able to speak, read, and write in English
Valid driver’s license with a good driving record
Capable of lifting comfortably 70 lbs.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Qualifications

Education

Preferred

Bachelors or better.

Experience

Preferred

1 year: Airport
1 year: Ramp

Licenses & Certifications

Preferred

DRIVERS LICENSE

title: Program Manager, Pearson Works (1 Year Term)
description:
Reporting to the Manager, Community Investment, the Program Manager, Pearson Works will lead and coordinate the implementation of the Pearson Works Program to support the recovery, reskilling and upskilling of one of the country’s most dynamic, multi-employer workforces at Toronto Pearson airport. Working with internal and external stakeholders, consultants and partners from across the airport, the incumbent will build workforce development strategies in alignment with organizational strategy.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Execute and measure program deliverables against benchmarks for activities and impacts, identifying best practices, and manage the evaluation of goals, metrics and impact
  • Work with a wide variety of employers, community partner organizations/employment service agencies, employee groups, educational institutions, and other groups to identify comprehensively needs and build workforce development strategies
  • Manage project from kick-off to launch the Pearson Works Platform and lead the development of RFP, vendor selection, project development and testing, and launch
  • Ensure all commitments made to the funder are met as per the funding agreement signed
  • Work to establish an Airport Workforce Council that includes: airport employers and employees, labour representatives, GTAA, employment service agencies/ community partner organizations to advise on the project's implementation and ensure it hits the identified outcomes
  • Organize airport wide programs around training, perks, job fairs, and other supports to further promote airport jobs
  • Review, assess, and advise on applications received from vendors and/or community partners to deliver trainings and supports to Toronto Pearson workers
  • Oversight of third-party vendors and contractors supporting Pearson Works! Workforce development goals. Ensure that contracts are meeting goals, terms and conditions and budget
  • Compile and analyze statistics and prepare reports required by both the funding partner and by GTAA leadership
  • Maintain and grow relationships once partnership agreements are agreed upon, including implementation of all GTAA commitments of funding agreements including engagement, activation or volunteer activities
  • Develop and implement an effective outreach strategy; identify partnerships with community organizations and support employer engagement activities
  • Collaborate with communications teams and lead development of messaging to market programs; promote community education and awareness related to training and employment issues both internally and externally
  • Establish cross-departmental GTAA steering committee to oversee project scoping and delivery
  • Lead all matters related to scheduling, budget, and external vendor management

The salary for this management non-unionized position is competitive based on the successful candidate’s qualifications.

Qualifications:

  • Fully vaccinated against COVID-19 with all required doses of a vaccine approved by Health Canada. The GTAA will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability, or any other ground protected by the Canadian Human Rights Act.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources Development, Information Science, Social Sciences or related field
  • 5+ years of work experience in related coaching and/or workforce and career development field
  • Solid understanding of career development and pathing, and issues relating to workforce development and retention
  • Project management experience in a highly matrixed multi-stakeholder environment
  • Experience developing and implementing strategic communications plans, and project-based communications plans
  • Experience dealing with diverse communities, community groups, and community engagement programming
  • Ability to work in busy, outcomes-based model; accountable for reaching program targets
  • Valid G driver’s license
  • Obtain and retain a Transportation Security Clearance

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Well-developed relationship-building skills with the ability to build and maintain long-term positive relationships with employers from various sectors as well as providing excellent service with a professional demeanor
  • Broad-based knowledge of current labour market trends
  • Experience with drafting, interpreting and implementing partnership/funding agreements
  • Strong project management skills and experience managing complex large-scale projects and campaigns.
  • Exceptional ability to influence industry and internal partners to participate in programs
  • Superior problem-solving skills and proven ability to balance competing demands and priorities in a rapidly changing environment and build consensus for path forward
  • Proven track record to clearly define objectives and priorities, establish milestones, anticipate and mitigate risks and exceed goals in a dynamic environment, while maintaining strong attention to detail and quick recall
  • Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving capabilities
  • Strong presentation skills and ability to develop highly visual presentations
  • Proficiency in MS Office

title: Manager, Commercial Services
description:
Français

Manager, Commercial Services

Vancouver, BC

Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), YVR is made up of a team of diverse people who are working collaboratively to Connect BC proudly to the World. Safety is at the core of everything we do; we’re innovative, fun, and we invest in our people. With high engagement scores, an abundance of learning and development opportunities, and a holistic approach to wellness, we’re looking for someone to join our team.

Vancouver Airport Authority strives for a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We support the Employment Equity Act and take measures to ensure fair employment practices and treatment of employees across our organization. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, including women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. We encourage applicants to self-identify with a designated group(s) to support our team in filling gaps in areas where we can be more diverse. We are also happy to provide reasonable accommodations throughout the selection process and while working at YVR. If you require support applying online because you are a person with a disability, please contact us at 604-303-3152 or careers@yvr.ca.

We have a permanent, full-time opportunity for a Manager, Commercial Services. Reporting to the Director, Passenger Commercial, the successful candidate will lead the on-going business development, program and performance management in relation with the implementation of commercial programs at the Airport. Prior to COVID-19, YVR’s commercial program generated around $400M in terms of sales and covered more than 140 concessions in the terminal. Despite this challenging landscape, YVR is looking to strengthen its commercial foundation and plans to reinvigorate and enhance its commercial program by providing an increased range of products, services and introducing new brands and concepts.

The Manager, Commercial Services is a key part of the Passenger Commercial team and will be accountable for the overall stewardship of the retail program, from vision to execution. The incumbent will play a critical role in the time of full renewal of the commercial portfolio designed to maximize revenue and to address changing passenger sentiment. The ideal candidate is a personable, proactive relationship builder with excellent financial and market analysis skills, complemented by high interest in retail, hospitality, commercial experience and other revenue driven initiatives.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Contributing to the development of the strategic plan, both in the long and short-term, allowing the department to meet its goals related to revenue generation, operational excellence and innovation
  • With a view to maximizing yields and delivering outstanding customer experience, constantly reviewing the business and airport’s retail, commercial mix and other commercial programs with a focus on continual improvement and opportunities for future revenue growth and new revenue streams
  • Driving business growth by creating a favorable business climate and environment that will attract local and international businesses, leveraging collaboration with trade and tourism partners and supporting sustainable long-term growth
  • Liaising with prospective tenants on commercial opportunities, product and category mix, passenger demographic, rent structure and financial models
  • Negotiating future commercial agreements and working closely with third parties on development opportunities including retail, duty free, food & beverage or other revenues streams
  • Ensuring a full oversight of the portfolio, including driving improved performance (revenue target, KPIs, spend per passenger, product offering, merchandising, pricing, level of service, newness, physical appearance, etc.)
  • Developing specific business plans and working with current operators to improve breadth, assortment and format of product mix, , to ensure alignment with passenger composition and to expand online and digital capabilities platforms
  • Developing, outreaching and maintaining close relationships with local retail, hospitality, trade associations, and local or international brands for new markets and business; determining optimal outcome (financial and experience) based on trends, expectations and long-term vision
  • Remaining current on all relevant innovations and trends related to commercial services both within the airport sector and beyond to proactively identify opportunities and respond accordingly
  • Expanding the understanding of our passenger mindset (demographic, shopping, trends, expectations) via additional surveys, research and inquiries, while mutually aligning with our business partners’ assessments
  • Providing support and direction to the team – this includes monitoring work efforts and performance, hiring, coaching, motivating and supporting developmental activities, conducting formal evaluations and applying appropriate discipline
  • Fostering regular events to promote YVR’s commercial platforms

Key qualifications include:

  • Deeply passionate about retail and hospitality with a strong appreciation for the product and understanding of the customer’s emotional experience
  • Experience in a large, multi-category retail environment with a strong commercial knowledge to drive revenue and improve customer experience
  • Existing relationships with brands and strong network in business community
  • Ten years’ recent, related experience in business development and negotiation and five years’ supervisory experience, supplemented by a bachelor’s degree in business; or an equivalent combination of education and work experience
  • Experience with commercial leasing, lease agreements and contracts is an asset
  • Demonstrated program management and implementation experience
  • Team player with well-developed interpersonal skills and proven experience managing and coaching teams for high performance
  • Exceptional leader and action-oriented self-starter who can set strategy and drive execution with a “roll up the sleeves” approach; entrepreneurial and ambitious with a “can-do” mentality
  • Creative problem-solver and conceptual thinker with an ability to understand and leverage detail-oriented and analytical issues as needed
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation, and influencing skills to work effectively with stakeholders
  • Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced work environment

This position is open to both Vancouver Airport Authority employees and external candidates. Previous job performance will be considered for all internal candidates who apply for this position.

As part of our recruitment process, short-listed candidates may be required to participate in an assessment process.

Health and safety are at the core of how we operate at YVR. We are committed to ensuring a safe workplace for our workforce and protecting the health and safety of our employees, passengers, partners and community by taking reasonable, preventative measures to reduce the risks associated with COVID-19. All employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a valid exemption is granted for those unable to be vaccinated.
