title: Ramp Supervisor
description:
Come join the exciting world of aviation!! Established in 2006, our company provides multi-functional aviation services offering passenger, cargo and ground support with a focus on safety and quality. For us, success lies in delivering peace of mind to our customers, and we are passionate about ensuring their needs are met – on time, every time.

Do you have an interest in the Aviation industry? We are searching for individuals who are team players and eager!

Summary
  • Supervisors assist in communicating policies and procedures within their operation. They assist with directing and coordinating activities to provide a safe environment for employees while maintaining fast and efficient services. This position requires working in a fast paced environment with time constraints to meet arrival and departure goals. A professional and positive image must be consistently displayed by the employee. “Lead by Example” concept is strongly promoted.
  • Supervisors must report to work on a regular and timely basis; report directly to the manager.
  • Performs all functions of ramp agent, as needed.
  • Actively participates in the Safety Management System (SMS)
  • Ensure employees are in compliance with uniform, appearance, and personnel protective equipment policies (safety toe shoes, uniform cleanliness, and jewelry).
  • Works in conjunction with ramp team and remains within the footprint of each assigned flight to oversee the safe and timely operation.
Responsibilities
  • Verify training and education is provided
  • Identify and correct hazards
  • Directly observe workers
  • Correct unsafe or unwanted behaviour
  • Direct and instruct workers
  • Respond to worker questions and concerns
  • Ensure the health and safety of all workers
  • Be knowledgeable about the Act, the regulation and the Guidelines
  • Know the work process, the hazards involved and effective control measures for the hazards
  • Ensure workers are made aware of all hazards
  • Ensure workers are made aware of all hazards known or reasonably foreseeable
  • Ensure workers comply with the Act, the Regulations, etc.
  • Provide/verify workers’ training before undertaking new tasks
  • Verify that workers’ performance meets expectations for safety
  • Actively seek out emerging hazards
  • Record one daily entry in a Supervisor’s journal or log
  • Correct improper work activities and conditions
  • Positively reinforce safe/proper work performance
  • Coordination and oversight of aircraft turnaround activities
  • Ensure that processes are delivered within SLA standards and compliance limits while adhering to safety requirements
  • Responsible for the safety and security of all employees
  • Ensure documentation is clear, appropriate, and frequent enough to show a systematic approach
Job Duties
  • Schedule and coordinate SA GSA employees as required, ensuring all shifts are covered.
  • Work with the Operations Manager and HR team to ensure staffing levels are complete; and be involved in the hiring process including interviewing GSA candidates
  • Deliver all necessary training to GSA employees
  • Work with the Operations Manager to ensure employee assessments are completed in a timely fashion.
  • Delegate daily flight responsibilities among ramp team members and assign all team members.
  • Conduct briefings on pre- arrival/departure for each flight; ensure ramp set up and preparation is performed and obstacle clearance zones are clear; perform walk around inspection for each flight after arrival and before departure.
  • Follow and enforce all airline standard operating procedures. All information is found in the service manuals for Jazz and West Jet.
  • Ensure aircraft is loaded in accordance with operations instruction.
  • Ensure working headsets are on hand for each flight as well as day/night wands and all employees are wearing safety vests while assisting with aircraft movement.
  • Ensure foreign object debris walks are performed accordingly
  • All issues on the aircraft to be reported to the flight crew.
  • Ensure proper first aid procedures are administered to injured staff and correct reporting procedures are carried out.
  • Intelex (Safety Management System – SMS) must be generated and sent out within 3 hours of occurrence.
  • Complete DFR’s, including fuel burn reports and deicing logs.
  • Complete flight paperwork including (but not limited to) lavatory log, de-ice log, and daily shift paperwork such as shift report, GSE checklist, and cabin service cleaning report,
  • Report load plan in accordance to SOP bin load discrepancies or any deviation from the planned load to operations.
  • Ensure proper handling and loading of bags, live animals, and special cargo; ensure freight, mail, cargo, and baggage is received and delivered in a timely manner; obtain last bag clearance from bag room for each assigned flight.
  • Coordinate the release of cargo shipments and any special requests from the flight crew, gate agents, or any other customer service entity; follow all airline SOP in accordance with training.
  • Delegate job duties as required and ensure completion.
  • Able to work as a team or work independently without direct supervision.
  • Ensure the ops manager is notified of any changes to the situation.
  • Adhere to all policies and follow established procedures.
  • Participate in required meetings providing input and recommendations.
  • Maintain Quality Assurance oversight for operational issues relating to output and safety, providing suitable corrective and/or preventative actions where necessary
  • Ensure staff have access to the Quality Management System information in enabling them to comply with company policies, processes and procedures
  • Ensure employees are adequately trained in Quality Assurance to understand, implement, and maintain all quality objectives as outlined within our Quality Management System.
  • Cooperate fully with Inspectors to achieve quality inspection commitments
  • Perform other ground service duties as assigned.
Requirements
  • Worked as a GSA for at least three (3) months
  • Be at least 18 years of age
  • Possess a valid driver’s license
  • Ability to work on a permanent basis in Canada
  • Obtain a clear criminal record
  • Ability to obtain necessary airport and/or Transport Canada security clearances
  • Must be capable of lifting/pushing/pulling up to 50lbs (23kg) on a regular basis
  • Ability to work nights, weekends, holidays and varying schedules, and on call – as required
  • Must successfully complete airline specific training programs and recertification
  • Willing to participate in formal leadership and job specific (i.e., Train the Trainer) training
  • Perform required airline and Company audits
  • Willing to travel to other bases
  • Proficient with computers and Microsoft applications
Core Competencies
  • Able to work efficiently as a part of a team as well as independently
  • Able to work well under pressure and meet set deadlines
  • Above average organizational, time management and prioritizing skills
  • Attention to detail in all areas of work
  • Confident, consistent, decisive personality
  • Effective communication skills with individuals at all levels of the organization
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all times
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude
SAYZF

Thank you for your application with Strategic Aviation Ltd. Only those considered for the position will be contacted.

We are an equal opportunity employer who agrees not to discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, physical or mental disability, or age.

title: food service supervisor
description:
Additional Skills

  • Address customers' complaints or concerns
  • Train staff in job duties, sanitation and safety procedures
  • Establish methods to meet work schedules

Specific Skills

  • Supervise and co-ordinate activities of staff who prepare and portion food
  • Prepare food order summaries for chef
  • Prepare and submit reports
  • Maintain records of stock, repairs, sales and wastage
  • Estimate and order ingredients and supplies
  • Ensure food service and quality control

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Fast-paced environment

title: Shift Supervisor
description:
Summary

The Shift Supervisor is responsible for assisting management in monitoring the day-to-day activities of subordinates, aiding in monitoring associate productivity, assigning responsibility for specified work and/or functional activities within the framework set by management, giving work directions, and monitoring scheduling for adequate shift coverage. This position also maintains knowledge of and monitors compliance with all corporate standards and, through leadership and example, encourages the highest level of sales and customer service performance by other associates. This position also performs all other responsibilities as directed by the business or as assigned by Management. This is a non-exempt position and typically reports to the Store Manager or General Manager, depending on local requirements.

Essential Functions

  • Monitors and observes the day-to-day activities of subordinates, coordinates breaks for hourly associates, and keeps management informed of area activities and any significant problems
  • Completes opening, daily and closing procedures/checklists in accordance with company policies/procedures
  • Coordinates with management for on-the-job training of new associates
  • Operates cash register and voids transactions as needed while following all HMSHost cash handling policies and procedures, and maintains proper security of cash at all times
  • Transfers supplies and equipment between storage and work areas by hand or use of a hand truck
  • Implements product rotation based on product code dates in warehouse and concepts, orders product and participates in physical inventory counts as required
  • Resolves customer complaints in a manner consistent with company policy, and with customer satisfaction in mind
  • Practices excellent food safety and sanitation practices and complies with HACCP standards
  • Monitors compliance with safety guidelines, builds awareness about safety, and reports any safety concerns to management

Minimum Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills, and Work Environment

  • Requires a High School diploma or equivalent (GED)
  • Requires a minimum of 6 months supervisory/lead experience
  • Requires the ability to speak, read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence, and policy documents, as well as converse comfortably with customers
  • Food and beverage, cash handling, and customer service experience preferred
  • Requires the ability to bend, twist, and stand to perform normal job functions
  • Requires the ability to lift and/or move up to 40 lbs
  • Frequently immerses hands in water and water diluted with chemical solutions

Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran (M/F/D/V) Drug Free Workplace (DFW)

HMSHost is committed to providing accessible hiring and employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (the "AODA") and the Human Rights Code of Ontario. If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter or on the electronic application form.

title: Duty Supervisor, Cargo & Ramp
description:
Other Details: Reporting to Manager, Cargo & Ramp - 3 weeks on, 3 weeks off

Level: Non-Bargaining

Skills and Qualifications

Include, but not limited to, the following minimum skills and qualifications:

High School diploma or equivalent related work experience;
Two (2) years of previous experience;
Fully proficient Computer Skills (MS Office);
Extensive operating knowledge of Skyline;
Extensive knowledge of SLA, inventory Control, bin checks, AWB and shipment priorities;
Operational experience in Cargo and/or Ramp operations is required;
Must be able to complete the requirements for certification in Dangerous Goods handling and Dangerous Goods Acceptance;
Commitment to excellent internal and external customer service;
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines;
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and spoken);
Excellent leadership skills with the ability to coach and motivate others;
Experience supervising in a unionized environment (preferred);
Valid Driver's license is required;
Ability to obtain and retain an Airport Restricted Identity Card in accordance with the Airport Restricted Area Access Clearance Program regulated by Transport Canada;
Rotational accommodation provided.
Duties and Responsibilities

Interested candidates should be able to perform the following duties and responsibilities:

Provide oversight to ramp and warehouse operations to ensure operations are performed in accordance with regulatory, Company and Customer requirements;
Provide oversight for all Cargo attendants, agents and Coordinators
Responsible to ensure the Cargo team is compliant with training, policies, and procedures (e.g. safety, regulatory trainings, departmental, equipment, security, Dangerous Goods handling, Dangerous Goods Acceptance, Skyline);
Responsible to oversee and assist the day to day freight inventory, Daily SLA, Priority shipment, inventory Control and bin checks and the NND paperwork completion;
Responsible to ensure the Cargo team completes all equipment inspections, daily maintenance (fueling, oil levels, etc.) and report all unserviceable equipment to the GSE team;
Responsible to maintain organization and cleanliness in the warehouses and all surrounding areas where cargo and equipment is stored;
Provide leadership and direction during regular and irregular operations to the employees;
Coordinate with other departments to ensure customer satisfaction and on time performance;
Coordinate with customers to ensure customer satisfaction and on time performance;
Provides support functions, including, but not limited to, training, assignments, uniform adherence and supervise the team with the flow of cargo concerns and queries;
Responsible to review all daily sales reports and high value shipments;
Provide support and assistance for flight manifesting and load planning;
Assist with initial and recurrent training programs and scheduling;
Support the implementation of SOP's, processes, safety initiatives, employee communications;
Support attendance management and participate as required in employee performance management;
Support the Manager to complete internal and third party audits;
Other duties as assigned.

Is this the job for you?

Apply in writing with a cover letter and résumé to:
Canadian North Human Resources Department
Email: recruit@canadiannorth.com
Fax: 613-254-6280

Internal and External candidates will be interviewed simultaneously. Only successful candidates will be contacted for interviews. Canadian North is committed to employment equity.

This advisory was posted on April 26, 2022.

title: Terminal Manager
description:
Watch your career take flight at GardaWorld!

 

We are currently hiring two Terminal Managers to oversee daily operations at Winnipeg International Airport, providing guidance and support to managers with a focus on effectiveness and performance.

 

GardaWorld is the largest provider of aviation services for the Canadian Air Transport Security Authority (CATSA), offering screening services in 28 airports across Canada.

 

Reporting to the General Manager, (GM), the Terminal Manager, manages and oversees the Checkpoint, Performance and Operations Managers and all aspects of site planning, organization, training and monitoring to achieve the overall performance expectations of CATSA, Transport Canada and GardaWorld.

 

 

Position Duties

 

 

Assist General Manager in managing daily company operations of the base to ensure a positive, safe, and profitable working environment.

• Responsible for guiding the Operations Managers through financial plans, systems, and controls of the branch. Continuously conduct financial reviews to remain current on the state of the business.

• Works with the operations workforce planning models, including operational schedules. Will assist in the auditing and management of base overhead.

• Conduct regular operational meetings with direct reports to review performance results, customer surveys, compliance scores, and keep direct reports updated with corporate and industry changes.

• Contribute to the overall monitoring of screening operations to ensure adherence to the aviation industry protocols, client requirements, legislation, or division-specific.

• Assist in implementing remedial or training actions to ensure ongoing compliance, including interactions with the client (senior levels).

• Coordinate with General Manager in planning short and long-term projects, budgets, expense controls, schedules, and staffing. May be expected to be part of unique projects from time to time.

• Cooperate with General Manager and Operation Managers in recruiting, training, payroll processing, performance evaluation, promotions, and employees' release.

• Complex Investigations: To lead the investigative process for complex matters relating to Harassment, Code of Ethics, Code of Conduct, or corrective action. The Terminal Manager is the decision-maker in the outcome and further actions, including the possible termination of screening personnel, as it relates to complex matters.

• Supports the Operation Managers in monitoring the workforce absenteeism, in conjunction with support from administrative services. In addition, the Terminal Manager will lead more complex discussions relating to the accommodation process, including managing confidential and sensitive information.

• Take a leading role in a labour relations strategy. This includes leading the team through the final stages of the grievance process, which includes providing written responses to the unions. Will assist with the bargaining process as required.

• Participates in and demonstrates an understanding of safety principles and practices; follows all safety policies and procedures to support a safe working environment. Liaison with Health and Safety internal community to ensure

  • ​​​​​​​Other Duties as required 

​​​​​​​

 

 

 

Job Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation & benefits package
  • Parking is provided as a taxable benefit
  • Training and career development

 

Skills / Experience:

  • Extensive proven Leadership and Management Skills at a senior level
  • Analytical, detail oriented and technically astute
  • Excellent communication skills and a professional demeanor with the ability to develop cooperative working relationships internally and externally
  • Experience in a large, unionized environment    
  • Self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment
  • Strong influencing and negotiating skills that promote commitment to action
  • Strong team player with a positive and flexible approach to develop teams
  • Excellent proven problem-solving skills
  • Easily adaptable to change and willing to embrace new challenges
  • Relevant labour relations skills are considered an asset

 

Application Requirements:

  • Post-secondary education in a relevant field OR equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Minimum of 3 years experience in a Senior Management capacity overseeing a management team
  • Minimum 3 years experience in aviation or relevant field overseeing large operations
  • Advanced proficiency with MS Office Suite specifically in Excel and Access
  • Must be a Canadian Citizen or a Permanent Resident as defined in the Immigration Act with an employment authorization document
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance and Secret Clearance
  • No previous criminal background for which a pardon has not been granted
  • 18 years or older

 

Additional Notes:

  • Internal candidates must be in good standing with no performance events on file

title: Parking Manager - Airport
description:
Parking  Manager Airport $28

Who You’ll Work For?

REEF transforms urban spaces into community hubs that create jobs and bring new goods, services and experiences to the neighborhood. With an ecosystem of 5,000 locations and a team that’s over 18,000 strong, REEF is the largest operator of parking real estate and delivery restaurants in North America. By connecting the world to your block, we’re making the place you live, the place you love to be.

What You’ll Do

The Operations Manager ensures the safe and efficient parking operations, while delivering service that exceeds our customer/client’s expectations. The Operations Manager is responsible for all aspects of operating the parking facility including staff management, revenue control, safety, and client relations.

 

PRINCIPAL DUTIES (ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS):

  1. Responsible for the supervision of location staff including: delegating, coaching/developing, monitoring performance, and ensuring compliance with all company standards.
  2. Recruit, select, and train new employees; develop onboarding plan for new employees to ensure success.
  3. Act as the main point of contact to client or Property Manager; attend location meetings as appropriate and respond to client requests in order to develop and maintain a good working relationship.
  4. Monitor maintenance of the facility and associated premises to ensure that the garage/lot is clean, safe, and maintained to standards; supervise on-going maintenance projects to ensure quality and timely completion.
  5. Manage ticket inventory, cash flow, reports, and audits to prevent loss through theft, error, or carelessness.
  6. Review profit and loss statements, adjustments, and variance reports on a monthly basis; make adjustments as necessary to achieve budget goals.
  7. Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly operating reports as required.
  8. Use respectful communication to assist guests with their questions, problems, and concerns; address escalated concerns from guests.
  9. Immediately respond to reports of accidents, incidents or safety concerns.
  10. Communicate professionally at all times with guests, client, and teammates.

 

What We Want From You:

  • At least 18 years of age
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Experience in account management and revenue collection
  • Previous supervisory experience
  • Previous in the parking industry, preferred

What We’ll Provide

(Full-Time Employee Only)
Medical
Dental
Vision

Life and Disability
401K
Paid Time Off (PTO)

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

Occasionally move around the property by walking for extended periods of time.

Frequently operate small office equipment such as cash register, calculator, copier/printer

Will remain in seated position for extended periods of time.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Work is performed in indoor as well as outdoor environments.

Employees are subject to environmental conditions including extreme heat and cold weather.

Protection from weather conditions may be provided, but not necessarily from temperature changes. 

REEF Technology is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. REEF does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. REEF complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

title: Marine Modal Manager
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

The Marine Modal Manager for the Western Region is an execution-oriented position with the primary goals of ensuring that Lafarge ships the right cementitious product to the right location in accordance with demand-driven shipment schedules, as well as ensuring that the marine fleet and assets are maintained to the proper condition in line with legal and operational requirements. As such, the Modal Manager will work closely with freight carriers and the Supply Chain team. This position will also be the regional Supply Chain Teamâ€™s single point of contact for plant shipping personnel for marine-related topics.   Additionally, the Marine Modal Manager will support the RFP process by defining service requirements and reviewing bids.

Responsibilities:

Safety Culture:

  • Promote safety culture through engagement with employees, JHSC and subcontractors, implementation and management of local and regional initiatives with an objective of â€œzeroâ€ safety incidents
  • Administer, promote and review safety policies, processes and procedures to maintain relevance while ensuring the site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
  • Has ownership of the implementation and management of all local and regional safety initiatives, providing feedback as necessary

Operational:

  • Manage all outbound and a portion of inbound shipment activity for assigned transportation mode
  • Operate in accordance with the Jones Act and the Coasting Trade Act
  • Operate as single point of contact for plant shipping personnel for marine-related topics
  • Manage demurrage for assigned transportation mode
  • Report performance and elevate service issues
  • Manage assets â€“ regular maintenance as well as major program work for barges as well as dock facilities
  • Ensure that marine movements are maximized in order to drive down cost of delivery.
  • Maintain relationships with vendors.
  • Liaise with Aggregate Marine division.
  • Work with vendors, plants and terminals to optimize loading and unloading through process and equipment improvement.
  • Maintain data for respective mode within the region (freight rates, fuel surcharges, asset costs, cycle times, etc)
  • Maintain awareness of modal business, including competitorsâ€™ distribution situation  

Relationships with Others Functions:

  • Works closely with sales, manufacturing and logistics team
  • Works closely with plant staff, quality and area safety staff  

Specific Accountabilities:

  • Accurate and timely transportation scheduling
  • Modal compliance to plan
  • Cost performance of assigned mode
  • Optimal asset utilization
  • Support of business and financial analysis
  • On time performance
  • Cycle time
  • Promotes safety culture
  • Develops and implements effective maintenance systems
  • Provide key operational data and analysis
  • Ensure best practices are implemented, utilized and supported
  • Assist with capital planning and status reporting
Qualifications:

Education/Work Experience:

  • Three to five years of relevant work experience
  • Post-secondary Degree

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Excellent organizational and planning skills, process-oriented
  • Understanding of pneumatic conveyance systems an asset
  • Strong analytical skills, research, problem solving and decision making
  • Deep knowledge of a specific mode and working knowledge of other modes of transport
  • Proficiency with various computer applications is a definite asset
  • Good written and verbal communications
  • Knowledge of fleet maintenance management

Knowledge of applicable regulationsAs part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Director, Fleet Services & Assets
description:
We Are The Employer Brand of Choice.It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for a Director, Fleet Services & Assets in London - Kitchener/Waterloo.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Position Overview

Reporting directly to the President, the Director, Fleet Service and Assets is responsible for a wide spectrum of responsibilities dealing with company vehicles & maintenance facilities and must be able to multitask with ease and proficiency. This position will be based in SW Ontario (London – Kitchener/Waterloo) but have accountability for our garage and third party operations throughout Ontario.

Who Is Your Boss?

You report to a leader who appreciates your ability to lead with emotional intelligence and intuition. They expect you to ask questions, try, take risks and make mistakes. Knowing that numbers do not get past you inspire their confidence; and, the assurance that you will never put in a process that is detrimental to the team secures their trust!

Primary Responsibilities

1. Procurement & Asset Management

  • Establish and oversee the strategic management of physical assets (mainly fleet and facilities) of the
  • company, including procurement, replacement and disposal.
  • Assesses divisional vehicles for replacement
  • Optimizes the use of the fleet throughout the lifecycle
  • Establish service standards, policies and procedures
  • Negotiates parts/fluids/tools/services with vendors & manufacturers
  • Performs vendor visits/reviews

2. Maintenance

  • Ensures maintenance of Company vehicles in accordance with established standards and policies
  • Ensure the safety, availability and reliability of the fleet
  • Controls the maintenance costs
  • Reviews of all maintenance schedules on an annual basis
  • Obtains estimates, issue work order, purchase order or insurance work order
  • Coordinates all shop maintenance outsourcing and outside garage work
  • Coordinates vehicle repairs; liaise with insurance
  • Obtains vehicle/component warranties
  • Responsible for overseeing Fleet Services’ garage locations and physical facilities

3. Financial

  • Collect, analyze, and present key performance indicators related to fleet services to management and operations
  • Inventory management
  • Responsible for Fleet Services’ budgets and actual results
  • Provides a long-term view of vehicle replacement capital expenditures and vehicle operational expenditures according to fleet projections.

4. Leadership

  • Accountable for a team of licensed mechanics and administrative support staff in multiple locations
  • Completion of a University or College education or equivalent in a relevant field of study
  • 5-7 years experience in a similar role
  • 310S or 310T license is an asset but not required
  • Experience working in a management capacity
  • Leadership skills
  • Computer literate in MS Office
  • Analytical skills for evaluating shop operation processes
  • Familiar with Health & Safety Act and National Safety Code
  • Knowledge of procurement policies

Why work for us?

  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Competitive Benefit Offering
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Award Winning
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)

Sounds interesting? Please send your resume and salary expectations directly to Sandra Grant, VP Human Resources at sandra.grant@voyago.ca

Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Terminal Manager
description:
Celebrating 62 years of Business

We Bring Food to Your Family’s Table!

We are now hiring a Terminal Manager for our Winnipeg, Manitoba terminal!

Shift Details: Monday to Friday; 8:00am-5:00pm (Hours may vary depending on coverage needed)

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible to develop, manage, monitor and oversee all aspects of the terminal's operation, including all expenses, hiring, dismissals (in conjunction with V.P. Human Resources), annual performance appraisals, employee orientation, training, employee grievances and concerns, security, movement of freight, routes and delivery schedules, customer complaints and concerns, payroll, equipment, building and yards.
  • Maintain terminal within the company Mission Statement, with a high regard for customer service and contributing to the profitability of Erb Transport Limited.  Move freight according to delivery schedules and appointment times. Responsible for major decisions regarding all areas of terminal.
  • Ensure terminal, wash bay, and maintenance shop environments are maintained to acceptable standards.
  • Communicate closely with Regional dispatch, Linehaul, US dispatch and other terminal managers to insure any major problems are resolved.
  • Recommend changes and highlight any problem areas to supervisor. Analyse lanes, profitability, delivery schedules, costing of terminal, etc.
  • Monitor all equipment including power, trailer and dock handling equipment.
  • Responsible for the training and orientation of employees.
  • Plan, monitor and maintain employee schedules, time off, vacations, overtime, etc.
  • Investigate accidents and claims as required.
  • Ensure all supervisory/managerial staff foster and encourage a positive and respectful work environment.
  • All other duties as required.

Qualifications:

  • Positive attitude with proven management, leadership and people skills.
  • Excellent communication skills both verbally and written.
  • Ability to teach and give direction to employees.
  • Excellent decision-making skills with the ability to follow company policy and procedures.
  • Honest and trustworthy.
  • Computer experience specifically programs relating to Erb as well as excellent abilities in windows based and spreadsheet programs.   
  • Understanding of costing, expenses, budgeting, and profitability reporting.
  • Proven organizational, time management skills.

We Offer:

  • Top industry wages
  • Early vacation bonus
  • Workplace safety award program
  • Group benefit package, including company matched TFSA, RESP, RRSP
  • Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Referral bonuses
  • Employee engagement activities

Make “Another Cool Move”- Join our family of essential workers at Erb Transport!

Contact us 1-800-461-5299 or

Recruiting@erbgroup.com

Company website:www.erbgroup.com

 Named by Trucking HR Canada as Top Fleet Employers for eight consecutive years, and Best Fleets to Drive For (2022) through Truckload Carriers Association, we have grown significantly since our induction in 1959 and have become one of Canada’s largest family-owned refrigerated trucking companies. Although we have over 1,500 employees, we have not forgotten where we started or that our greatest asset is our people. Strong values and support for our fellow colleagues is a unique and important part of the workplace experience that is encouraged here.

Erb Limited is committed to the principle of equality in employment.

title: Fleet Manager
description:
Job Description

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

  • Assists with procurement activities required to support daily operations, maintenance, and asset management.
  • Prepares and manages fleet/equipment inventory and procurement plans.
  • Establishes and develops a base of vehicle suppliers and commercial fleet service providers.
  • Manages the fleet contracts, vendors, and contract deliverables.
  • Develops and maintains systems and procedures for the management of fleet documentation.
  • Developing, implementing, updating, and enforcing fleet management best practices and procedures in consultation with all users and stakeholders
  • Works with others to ensure fleet and equipment is procured to support service expansion and asset management activities.
  • Research fleet and equipment cost and provides recommendations for new units; assists with lifecycle replacement plans.
  • Coordinates the fleet renewal process and maintenance practices.
  • Administration of vehicle health monitoring systems to ensure vehicles are being monitored and maintained.
  • Coordinate, administer and monitor the maintenance, repair, replacement, and logistics of company equipment.
  • Administration of asset and fuel management systems ensuring that systems are functioning to support operations and contractual obligations.
  • Control transfer and movement of vehicles between locations as required by operations
  • Maintains up-to-date knowledge and data on regulations pertaining to commercial vehicles and their operation.
  • Provides technical support in the field for problems relating to the operation or maintenance of vehicles.
  • Continually evaluates new trends and technologies with respect to transport equipment and related operating strategies.
  • Organizes trials of new transport technologies to assess their potential and impact on H&S and quality.
  • Provide recommendations for lowering vehicle-operating expenses and reducing idle time of vehicles
  • Administers the disposal of surplus transit vehicles and equipment.
  • Provide reports on the status of the equipment.
  • Other duties as required.

What will you contribute?

  • 3-5 years’ experience in Fleet Management.
  • Experience working with OEM.
  • Knowledge and experience in principals and practices of procurement, asset inventory, fuel management, asset management, and vehicle monitoring systems, data management and reporting.
  • Experience in contract negotiations with a solid knowledge of contract language and legislative requirements.
  • Knowledge and understanding of green technologies such as battery electric vehicles, battery storage devices, charging equipment.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to deal effectively with individuals, and external agencies.
  • Knowledge of fleet practices, processes, and administration.
  • Capacity to successfully manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Capacity to use analytical and troubleshooting skills to resolve complex problems; creative problem-solving skills; initiative.
  • Hold a valid G license.
  • Ability to travel within Canada and the USA.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Transportation Manager (In home Delivery)
description:
Description


Hey, we’re Article. We’re a digital-first furniture brand that’s working to make everyday living better by providing an easy way for people to furnish their space. We don’t have brick-and-mortar stores, so we’re able to deliver better value on beautiful, modern furniture. We’ve been rapidly growing for the past several years and we’re now on the hunt for a talented, enthusiastic leader to help us continue our growth in Burnaby, BC.
 
We are looking for a Delivery Team Ops Manager who is excited about building an amazing team of people who will have a huge impact on our customer experience. You will lead a team of supervisors that are in charge of the day-to-day operations of our residential delivery program for one of our larger facility centers, that service deliveries to the Burnaby/Vancouver area, as well as (cross shipments to other smaller locations).

With an entrepreneurial attitude with the ability to pivot and juggle multiple priorities, you will be consistently leading the day-to-day operations of the delivery station to ensure we create “Remarkable Delivery Experiences” for our customers. Additionally, you will create a strong safety culture while promoting our Article Core Values. 

Key Responsibilities


  • Manage 3-8 Supervisors (exempt) as direct reports with an overall team of approximately 50+ Delivery Driver Associates
  • Manage the delivery team operations, with an ownership mindset
  • Embody the Article culture and inspire the team to lead through our guiding principles of customer obsession, do it differently, ownership mindset, and do it differently
  • Mentor, coach and develop your team of Supervisors, creating development plans, writing reviews, and developing succession planning to be reviewed with the Final Mile Ops Manager
  • Active participation on projects and initiatives affecting your warehouse.  This may include being part of Delivery project teams throughout the year 
  • Champion the 5s initiatives, holding Supervisor(s) accountable for department results, and work with other Operation  and Fulfillment Center Managers on building-wide opportunities and accountability
  • Plan for Peak season readiness, including workload projections, staffing needs, etc
  • Partner with the Regional People & Culture Ops Manager to ensure team members are engaged and that the employee experience is remarkable
  • Ensure labor is being used effectively and processes are being followed
  • Meet budget parameters and identify opportunities for savings
  • Follow DOT Federal safety regulations and build a culture of safety
  • Investigate, report, and act on safety or customer service issues occurring in your region
  • Oversee local procurement and interact with vendors including those providing trucks, repair, fuel, insurance, uniforms, telecommunications, and more.

Skills Knowledge and Expertise


  • 5+ years of experience in any area related to final mile, middle delivery services (moving, or residential delivery preferred) 
  • Managing 10+ trucks - following DOT regulations
  • 7+ years of Ops Manager experience with a final mile delivery team of 15-20 drivers
  • Ability to lead and maintain a safe work environment
  • Route dispatch experience within the respective region
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively in English (written or verbal)
  • Proficient with Google Suite (or Microsoft Office Suite)
  • Labor Management System experience preferred
  • Ability to be highly organized and process-oriented, allowing you to complete multiple tasks consistently and on time
  • Demonstrated experience promoting an environment of continuous improvement and rapid change
  • Excellent interpersonal and relationship skills - you know how to partner with other departments as well as manage your own team effectively
  • Flexibility with working hours
  • Valid state Driver's License
  • Legally able to work in Canada

Nice to have:
  • Direct-to-consumer shipping managing 10+ trucks and final mile delivery teams
  • Front-line experience delivering furniture to residences or in the moving business

Benefits


We want Article to be an amazing place to work, and we do our part to take care of our team. In addition to a competitive salary, we provide:
  • Commitment to safety, we provide uniforms and safety boots
  • After a 3-month probationary period:
    • Medical, Dental, & Vision
    • 48 hours of wellness days (6 days)
    • 1 annual paid ID day (Inclusion & Diversity day)
    • 3 weeks of paid vacation
    • Life Insurance
  • Stock options after one year of employment
  • 45% Employee discount + 15 % family & friends discount
Throughout COVID, our primary focus has been the safety of our Particles (employees), their families, community, customers, and candidates. We have COVID safety protocols to which we strictly adhere.


Ready to become a Particle?

title: Program Manager - Transportation
description:
Dynacare is currently looking for a Program Manager, Transportation to join our Customer Relations team in Brampton, ON. This is a 12-month maternity leave coverage.

Internal posting expires on May 4, 2022 at 5 pm EST.

JOB SUMMARY

The Program Manager is accountable for the performance of the Customer Relations team by developing, managing and continuously improving the program management functions within the various business segments, with the goal of providing exceptional customer service both internally and externally. This goal is achieved by providing operational expertise and outstanding service to prospective and current clients.

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 

  • Assist in the development and execution of the department’s strategic and operational goals to ensure effective implementation of the programs cross-functionally throughout the organization
  • Establish, monitor, measure and report assigned program performance metrics; analyze and identify issues impacting operational performance and establish initiatives for continuous improvement to ensure meeting of customer expectations; operational effectiveness, quality, reliability, on-time delivery while providing professional customer service to all internal and external clients
  • Ensure the delivery of optimal program results against appropriate performance metrics (systems, processes, procedures, and activities)
  • Ensure proactive professional customer service to all internal and external clients, investigating inquiries, reviewing customer complaints, and implementing corrective actions as appropriate
  • Develop, implement, and review control mechanisms and processes to ensure compliance to Dynacare policies, standards, regulatory requirements, and contractual obligations to ensure risk mitigation
  • Define, monitor, and deliver on program scope, schedule, milestones, budget, and deliverables that support the business goals in collaboration with all stakeholders
  • Maintain effective and regular communication with all stakeholders on all program related matters
  • Collaborate with BD Partners to identify customer needs and leverage creativity to establish, improve and refine service model. Be focused on achieving customer/stakeholder satisfaction and a reliable, valuable partner with customers and stakeholders
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders to support new business opportunities while also developing solutions that generate value-add services

 

KNOWLEDGE, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Understanding of business finance as it relates to costing of insurance/lab/transportation services
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with experience in related workstream
  • 5 or more years of industry related experience
  • Operationalization of contracts /contract management
  • End to end client management.

 

SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Technical Skills

  • Ability to apply knowledge to contract management to ensure a comprehensive and effective client onboarding.
  • Understand and promote principles of quality management and continuous improvement including a good working knowledge of Lean Six Sigma.
  • Ability to manage team and project deliverables using project management methodology and techniques in a fast-paced environment.
  • Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office Suite of programs
  • Excellent organizational skills

 

Social Process Skills

  • Ability to effectively facilitate meetings, manage conflict and champion change
  • Ability to adapt to and thrive within a team environment with competing and changing demands
  • Demonstrated high level of interpersonal skills required to succeed in a collaborative environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills as demonstrated in ability to make persuasive presentations and explain complex concepts to differing audiences

  DNA of an Ideal Dynacare Employee

I make a difference in people’s lives. I am a caring, collaborative team-player who is passionate about quality and continuous improvement.

  • Caring - I demonstrate strong empathy and genuine concern for my colleagues, patients and customers.
  • Collaborative Team Player - I know I play a key role in helping the Dynacare team achieve success. I am comfortable in a changing environment, and I can easily manage multiple priorities.
  • Passion for Quality and Continuous Improvement - I am always looking to learn and solve problems.  I am detailed oriented, adaptable and find ways to make things better.

Dynacare has been a “Top Employer” for many years and there is a reason why. We are a great place to work. 

At Dynacare, we’re proud to hire the best people. If you are looking for a meaningful career where you can support healthy lives with commitment and care – we would like to meet you. To apply for this position, you will be asked to submit your resume and complete the application process.

If your qualifications and experience fit with this position, we will contact you to learn more. We offer competitive pay and great benefits, along with the opportunity to grow and thrive with a dynamic, successful company. We hope you will join us in our journey to become Canada’s health and wellness solutions leader.
 
Dynacare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to the attraction, selection, advancement and fair treatment of all individuals. We believe that our diversity is our strength so we employ a diverse workforce and respect the needs of all our employees.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Dynacare Accommodation Policy a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of the Dynacare hiring process.

title: Terminal Manager - Sudbury
description:
Company Description

Manitoulin Transport has the most extensive transportation network in North America, making it easy to provide dependable on-time delivery and faster transit times. Sustained by its 60 years experience, Manitoulin developed the transportation knowledge that is relied on and trusted by clients in various industries.

Job Description

Manitoulin Tranport is looking to hire a Terminal Manager in Sudbury, ON. As a Terminal Manager, you would be expected to be involved in the day to day operation of the terminal to meet and exceed customer's demands. The Terminal Manager is directly involved with P&D, dispatch, dock, admin, recruiting, hiring, planning, policy, management and communication with direct and indirect customers. The Manager is held accountable for meeting both cost and service targets. 

Qualifications

Peforming a variety of managment duties in support of the terminal freight operation, you are a leader driven to achieve outstanding results, while enforcing a culture of safety and quality service at all times. 

You are a self starter who promotes teamwork amongst staff and maintains positive interactions while providing coaching, mentoringand motivation in support of performance objectives. 

Our ideal candidate will have a post secondary dipolma preferably in business and/or experience managing in a transportation terminal preferably in the LTL or courier industry. 

 



Additional Information

As an Operations Professional with The Manitoulin Group of Companies, your career will have many benefits, including:

  • Profit Sharing
  • Incentive Bonus
  • Company Vehicle
  • Comprehensive Benefits
  • Excellent Salary

title: Global COE Manager, Transportation Management
description:
Company:

Finning International Inc.

Number of Openings:

1

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

The COE Manager, Transportation Management owns and manage Global Logistics process, which includes Logistics network design and optimization, warehouse operation and transportation management. This position performs as technical and functional experts who develop and deploys industry best practices globally, which including building regional capability and deploy policies, processes and systems that required to meet Finning strategy, superior customer experience, and financial business results.

Job Description:

  • Ensure strategic design of global supply chain network and drive its efficiency to enable support business growth and cost efficiency
  • Build and implement global standard policy, process and practice across all warehouse and transportation area across the business. Which ensure delivers and continue sly improve around safety, accuracy, cost, productivity measures
  • Drives performance visibility of the end to end supply chain, driving complexity reduction, reduced risks in the warehouse and transportation area to ensure positive impact in both top and bottom line.
  • Develop best in class processes with end to end visibility on operational performance, define optimized future proofed network planning to maximize Finning warehouse and Transportation productive and deliver customer demand with efficiency and manage cost effectively
  • Integrate internal and external practice, technology, incubate and innovate new capabilities, advanced technologies
  • Govern existing logistics process, practices and tools that ensure successfully delivers results in line with targets.
  • To engage and constructively challenges to continuously improve warehouse and transportation practice and continuously identifies opportunities to drive better business performance year over year.
  • Build business capabilities to increasingly manage through system and process. this includes responsibility to develop, introduce and cultivate a culture of business discipline in managing through business process and systems. This including partner with Digital & IT functions to identify and implement systems according to future vision and roadmap required in the Logistics area to maximize business result with high efficiency.

Specific Skills:

  • Strong analytics capabilities coupled with the ability to identify issues, obtain mutual agreement as to the resolution and implement changes
  • Build long term vision and roadmap with logistics, warehouse and transportation related capabilities. Develop and implement optimization strategies,
  • Advanced organization skills to manage multiple projects and priorities
  • Strong service/support mentality and willingness to help others to achieve result.
  • Proven project management and change management skills: proactive, high energy, detail oriented when appropriate, result oriented and willing to initiate and nurture changes
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and monitor adherence to global policies and processes
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated ability to challenge the status quo
  • Persistence, perseverance and tenacity to drive change
  • Proven ability to structure effective teams, quickly establish credibility within the team and the business as a whole and then lead the team to achieve high levels of performance
  • Excellent communication skills, with well-developed internal and industry networking capabilities
  • Confident and collaborative, with the ability to work proficiently within a global matrix organization, influence others and build commitment to a recommended direction
  • Displays creativity and innovation in achieving results

Education & Experience:

  • Minimal a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, or Engineering
  • Master’s degree in Business, Supply Chain or Engineering is a plus
  • 8+ years of Logistics Operations, Or Supply Chain Management Experience
  • Minimum 5 years of experience leading direct and cross functional teams
  • Experience leading large scale cross-functional initiatives within larger organizations with a proven track record of influencing authority at all levels
  • Prior industry knowledge or working experience from consumer product sector, automotive sector, or others that experienced with high SKU complexity, high seasonality, in supply chain planning or related functional roles.
  • Fluency in English is required; Spanish would be considered an asset

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Manager, Outbound Transportation (Toronto, ON, CA, L4W 5M3)
description:
Job ID: 208910 
Location Name:ON-FSC Toronto Off (0581)
Address:5560 Explorer Drive, 2nd Floor, Toronto, ONL4W 5M3, Canada (CA)
Job Type:Full Time
Position Type (Regular/Temporary):Regular
Job Function:Logistics/Operations
Is This Position Eligible for Remote? :  

 

At Sephora Canada, we’re passionate about finding and sharing beauty in the world. Our constant innovation, our ability to see and lead trends, and our focus on providing an outstanding customer experience make us the most-loved beauty community and top of mind for every Canadian. We find beauty in our communities, in our differences, our experiences, and in the spirit of our employees.

 

ABOUT THE ROLE:

Responsible for leading the day-to-day transportation operations and the team responsible for outbound, and reverse logistics. Owner of relationships with carriers and driving carrier network strategy.  Primary contact for FSC and Canada Distribution Centre for transportation, projects, and strategies. P&L responsibility transportation line.  Key owner to address transportation partner service failures.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

  • Lead the day to day domestic outbound & reverse logistics transportation department, which includes working a non-traditional work schedule to support the DCs during open shifts (on two time zones) and supporting peak volume periods; evening shifts and weekends
  • Develop and implement overall operations of the transportation network, monitoring the network and industry trends to flag any potential risks and opportunities
  • Partner and liase with internal and external business partners to forecast and meet capacity needs, identify risks and opportunties and track plans for improvements 
  • Responsible for transportation costs, service level agreements and performance metrics to identify and resolve problems to achieve efficiencies
  • Responsible for transportation lines on the Logistics P&L as it pertains to outbound and reverse logistics, and driving cost saving initiatives through effective measurement and monitoring of results and costs
  • Responsible to ensure the transportation team is monitoring the right metrics and being used to report on drivers behind the numbers in finance close meetings
  • Oversee the acquisition and oversight of transportation providers, competitive RFQs and New Store carrier sourcing
  • Conduct regular check ins and business reviews with carriers to ensure carriers are meeting their contractual SLAs and action plans are in place as needed. 
  • Accountable for driving excellent client service for our stores, and addressing any failures in a timely and methodical manner
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement initiatives to drive results and increase capacity and profitability
  • Drive the development, implementation, and documentation of essential processes within your team

 

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Strong leadership skills 
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficiency with MS Office, advanced Excel skills preferred
  • Knowledge of WMS and TMS preferred
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills, strong numbers aptitude
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Ability to travel to DCs in Ontario and BC monthly, or as needed.
  • Ability to work in fast-paced, often-changing environment, flexible, team player
  • Proficiency with various domestic and international carrier rates and booking processes

 

WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE:

  • You’ll be part of a unique culture and family of passionate and inspiring individuals.
  • You’ll work alongside the best talent in the industry – people you’ll be proud to work with.
  • You’ll have access to the global community of luxury group LVMH (Louis Vuitton Moët Hennessy) for endless career opportunities.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to be part of a community that drives meaningful social and environmental change and receive matching donations to support your charitable giving.
  • Benefits you can mix and match, depending on your needs.
  • Employee Assistance Program services for those times you need extra support.
  • Holidays, time off, summer hours and flexibility to support work-life balance.
  • And of course, there’s our incredible swag – free product gifts throughout the year and tons of discounts with our brand partners.

 

This position requires that the employee be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to commencing employment and that they agree to obtain any future required boosters or vaccinations as recommended by the government of Canada or the health authorities of the province in which you would be working and in accordance with Sephora Vaccination Policy. If you are not able to obtain a COVID-19 vaccine for a reason related to a protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation, you can request accommodation from Sephora.


COMPANY OVERVIEW:
SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

title: Transportation Manager
description:
Transportation Manager

 

With approximately 3300 employees, JBS Food Canada ULC (“JBS Canada”) is one of Canada's largest beef processors. Consisting of four locations—the main processing facility located in Brooks, Alberta, where approximately 4,200 head of cattle are harvested and processed daily; the Head Office and a case ready plant, both based in Calgary, Alberta; and JBS Ontario, a case ready plant located in Belleville, Ontario. The JBS Canada facility in Brooks has the capacity to produce products ranging from boxed beef primals, ground beef, beef trimmings, beef by-products and hides which are shipped across Canada and worldwide. At the multi-protein Mountain Creek Farms case-ready facility in Calgary, JBS Canada produces value-added products including marinated, portion sized, multi-pack options, kebabs and much more. JBS Ontario in Belleville produces fresh meat and seafood products for leading retailers in Canada.

We are currently seeking a Transportation Manager to lead the logistics and transportation requirements for all JBS Canada products. You will coordinate with vendors to manage logistics activities to meet service level expectations.

 

This role will work closely with JBS’s freight providers and internal teams to maintain a reliable and scalable logistics operation that functions on an international scale. With an understanding of North American transportation and trade compliance, you will make sure that JBS can provide a predictable delivery experience for all shipments. This role will also serve as the trade compliance subject matter expert, providing support related to all logistics activities ensuring JBS’s compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and best practices.

 

The ideal candidate has expertise working in a global environment with a proven track record of working in Logistics or other supply chain groups. The person in this role will be required to work in a demanding and fast-changing environment, demonstrate speedy decision-making to meet aggressive deadlines, and drive effective communication with senior stakeholders. Proficiency in logistics and supply chain processes and the skill to work independently to drive results are key requirements to be successful in this role.


You will:

  • Lead the organization’s Performance Improvement plan and Operational Efficiency initiatives; ensuring a data-driven and results oriented approach that supports successful execution of company strategic objectives.
  • Provide leadership for direct reports that both maximize and optimize resources in support of the company’s goals and objectives in serving customers.
  • Ensure that performance goals are set and achieved, through the proper execution of performance metrics as it relates to Productivity, Safety, Quality and Customer Service.
  • Oversee the development and management of carrier contracts, negotiations and relationships to provide industry leading competitive rates, programs and exceptional customer service.
  • Resolve internal problems or complaints and problems or complaints with carriers/customers
  • Plan, examine, analyze and evaluate day-to-day operations in respect to supporting procedures, quality standards, and customer expectations.
  • Ensure quality shipment data from origin to end-delivery.
  • Develop and oversee, JBS policies, systems and procedures necessary to support cost reduction and system utilization goals (KPI’s).
  • Develop and maintain KPI’s for quality, quantity, shipments, inventory, delivery times, transportation costs and efficiency
  • Manage expenses to budget and forecast.
  • Participate in and support business reviews with service providers; drive corrective actions, if necessary, based on performance.
  • Review and research with new and existing transportation vendors; programs to reduce, replace and improve upon transportation costs.

 

You Have:

  • A Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, or another related field preferred
  • 3 plus years of experience in Logistics; at least 3 years of supervisory experience
  • Experience with perishable goods
  • Knowledge of SAP or similar ERP system preferred
  • A proven track record in developing new processes and bringing about change and improvement without major disruption to the business
  • Strong people management and supervisory skills
  • Strong analytical skills with high proficiency in Excel; ability to tell a compelling story through data
  • Process driven mentality, with the ability to plan, be strategic, and execute operationally on a regular basis
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to distill large amounts of information into concise summaries

 

Exceptional Benefits including:

 

Competitive Wage | Relocation Assistance | Extended Health/Medical Benefit | Group Life & Accidental Death Insurance | Short/Long Term Disability | Vision/Dental Care | Employee Beef Purchasing Program | Voluntary Employee RRSP Contributions | Employer RRSP Contributions | Medical Clinic on-site | Career Growth and Continued Training

 

JBS Food Canada ULC

PO Box 1868, Brooks, AB

www.jbsfoodcanada.ca

title: Project Manager â€“ Transportation Planning
description:
Overview:

TYLin Canada Inc. is a full-service, professional engineering firm focused on the planning, design, and construction of infrastructure solutions for public and private clients worldwide. The firm is an internationally recognized pioneer in solving the most difficult engineering challenges. Headquartered in San Francisco, California for over 65 years, TYLin has more than 3,200 professionals throughout the Americas, Asia, and Europe. TYLin is a member of Dar Group, a global, privately-owned professional services group, and its industry-leading family of Global Infrastructure companies.  

 

Our Vaughan office is seeking a Project Manager for Transportation Planning projects. This position will report to the Director, Traffic and will require 6 years of experience in transportation Engineering. The Project Manager will promote and provide professional consulting services in transportation planning and design engineering, class environmental assessment, road safety audits, traffic impact assessments and parking assessments to company clients, in accordance with professional and corporate guidelines.

Responsibilities:
  • Coordinate the preparation of proposals, budgets and schedules for traffic and transportation planning consulting and design projects under the guidance of senior Transportation Planning professionals.
  • Complete traffic impact studies, feasibility studies, functional plans, and preliminary / detailed designs for highways, roads and intersections, area transportation studies, traffic operations and parking demand investigations, analyses and recommendations, and site impact analyses.
  • Conduct field surveys and observations
  • Communicate with clients and approval agencies.
  • Participate in client progress meetings and public presentations.
  • Maintain current knowledge of relevant legislation and issues.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with assigned clients and regulatory approval officials.
  • Participates with senior management in promotional activities for the company.
  • Provide project status reports on a regular basis and as required.
  • Mentor and coordinate project work in all faucets of Transportation Planning.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • Minimum six (6) years of experience in transportation engineering.
  • Licensed as a professional engineer (P.Eng.) from Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).   Extensive knowledge of transportation planning and engineering including:
    • Data collection, processing and management.          
    • Transportation modelling and simulation.
    • Ontario municipal and provincial (MTO) standards and requirements
    • Functional planning for transportation infrastructure, transportation safety analysis and mitigation, traffic impact studies, construction traffic staging analysis and design, and transit studies
    • Managing traffic analysis work, clear reporting of findings, and presenting to clients.
    • Eligibility for RAQS certification an asset.
  • Client focused, always striving to give clients the best solutions.
  • Strong commitment to innovation by creating new and better ways to solve clientsâ€™ toughest challenges.
  • High levels of integrity, always doing the right thing in an ethical, fair, and sustainable way.
  • Demonstrated experience of collaboration in a diverse and inclusive team, working together toward technical excellence.

 

TYLin is committed to employment equity and providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (â€˜AODAâ€™). If you require accommodation for a disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources at

hr-careers@us.tylin.com

. TYLin remains committed to complying with all local health authority, legal or lawful client requirements, as such this role may be situated in a jurisdiction with masking or vaccinate or test requirements to attend office or client locations (controlled location). You should ask your manager about this prior to starting. Should you be subject to the requirements, you are required to disclose your vaccination status within the first week of starting or before entering a controlled location, whichever comes first.
