title: Trainmaster
description:
The Trainmaster is responsible for managing and supervising the work of several teams in the transportation department and has a supporting role in various responsibilities related to customer service and the operation process for the railway.

Responsibilities:

The Trainmaster performs the following tasks:

  • Maintains a safe working environment for the entire department.
  • Manages the transportation teams, plans the work to be done for the next shift, participates in the daily operation conference calls.
  • Elaborates, supports, and coordinates the operations, as well as the train movements in the assigned subdivision.
  • Perform various administrative tasks, reports and is rigorous with management of workforce planning.
  • Coordinate the activities of the transportation department while following the collective agreement in force while being responsible for managing disciplinary issues.
  • Manage the requirements of different customers in order to meet their expectations and improve the processes in place as needed, in order to exceed their expectations.
  • Provides professional customer service, respects the delivery times and advises the client of any delays.
  • Manages the work schedules and keeps them up to date (replacement and availability lists, controls the over time).
  • Sees to the employees’ safety and makes sure that accidents are reported that safety policies are respected and that there is no negligence towards the operation rules.
  • Creates different reports for company management.
  • All other related tasks.

General Requirements:

  • College degree in Administration and/or in Management and/or have relevant experience in the railway industry (operations).
  • Have at minimum of five (5) years of experience in the railway industry.
  • Qualification in railway operating regulations (REF) - (asset)
  • Flexible with regard to working hours to be able to see all of your teams and clients.
  • Supervisory experience is an asset.
  • Possess great flexibility to adapt in a changing environment.
  • Prepared to occasionally work outdoors in all weather conditions.
  • Proficient in MS OFFICE, databases and emails.
  • All other related tasks.

Other working conditions: Vacation, benefits and paid holidays are based on the company’s policies. 

If considered for the position, a full background check will be required (physical, drug, criminal and references)

title: Terminal Manager/Transportation Manager
description:
Summary:

Precision Home and Office Deliveries Inc is a leader in Final Mile deliveries and is experiencing rapid growth by offering exceptional service levels to our customers.

We are in search of an Experienced hands-on Terminal Manager capable of managing up to 50 drivers with multiple supervisors directly reporting to her/him.

Job Responsibilities:

â€¢ Manage Inbound/Outbound movement of Freight to and from hub location

â€¢ Manage Hub Operation and Sortation Processes

â€¢ Review volumes in established routes daily to balance workload, audit drivers and hub processes

â€¢ Occasionally ride with drivers for audits and/or perform deliveries directly

â€¢ Maintain relationships with key customer contacts involved in daily operations of their business

â€¢ Maintain regular reporting to head office

â€¢ Provide metrics to Customers daily to maintain highest level of performance

â€¢ Contribute and maintain a successful, safe, team environment

â€¢ Motivate and develop team, identifying the best people for the job

â€¢ Assisting in assessing problem areas or areas for improvement and identifying solutions, and clearing roadblocks with other departments and management

â€¢ Run continuous improvement initiatives to offer "Best-in-Class" services

â€¢ Resolve complaints and answer questions of customers regarding services and procedures

â€¢ Recruit and train top performers for all material handlers and independent contractors;

â€¢ Provide timely, accurate, and thorough Performance reviews.

Job Skills & Qualifications

Â· Minimum of five yearsâ€™ experience in courier Final Mile Deliveries.

Â· Strong leadership and team-building skills

Â· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Â· Effective organizational and multitasking skills

Â· Proven ability to deal with Independent Owner Operators

Â· Knowledge of Health, Safety, Compliance and regulations.

Â· Basic knowledge of Human Resource requirements

Â· Knowledge of MOT / MOL requirements

Required:

Â· At least 2 years of experience as a Terminal Manager

Â· Must be fluent in English

title: Gestionnaire de projets - Transport
description:
L’équipe d’Humanify est fière de contribuer au succès de son client, acteur majeur du secteur du commerce de détail, en l’accompagnant dans ses recherches d’un nouveau :

 

 

Gestionnaire de projets - transport

 

 

Description

 

Chez nous, plus de 26 000 employé(e)s cultivent leur passion chaque jour. Nos équipes sont animées par la volonté d’aider nos clients à faire de leurs projets une réalité, et engagées à faire une différence dans les communautés où nous sommes établis.

Nous exploitons ou desservons quelque 470 magasins corporatifs et marchands affiliés indépendants. Grâce à une offre de produits et services unique et à des formats complémentaires allant des quincailleries de quartier aux magasins de grande surface, nos enseignes sont outillées pour répondre à tous les besoins des rénovateurs amateurs et des professionnels de la construction.

Chez nous, votre travail et vos idées contribuent à bâtir une organisation florissante. Votre voix sera toujours entendue et valorisée. Vous trouverez des possibilités de carrière à la mesure de vos ambitions et pourrez développer encore davantage l’ensemble de compétences qui vous rend unique.

Si vous cherchez à faire ce que vous aimez, à grandir au sein d’une grande famille accueillante et à vous perfectionner chez l’un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada, selon un récent sondage mené par Forbes, nous pourrions être parfaits l’un pour l’autre.

 

 

Nos attentes

 

Relevant de la ‘Directrice, Optimisation des transports’, le ou la ‘Gestionnaire de projets – Transport’ est responsable de la conduite de tous les projets impliquant les groupes de transport et doit mettre en place leur gouvernance dans l’ensemble des segments et des régions. La personne choisie devra mettre à l’essai les activités de gestion de projets pour le portefeuille de transport, ainsi que représenter l’équipe Transport dans les projets ayant des répercussions sur les processus de transport. Elle devra diriger la mise en œuvre du cadre de gestion de projets au sein de l’équipe. En facilitant les échanges entre les parties prenantes et en fournissant au groupe Gestion une visibilité nationale sur les activités en cours et la gouvernance des projets, ce rôle est essentiel pour le succès des initiatives qui apportent de la valeur à l’entreprise.

 

De solides compétences en matière de communication, de gestion du changement et un grand sens de l’initiative sont essentiels pour réussir à ce poste. Il faut également faire preuve d’un esprit d’analyse et posséder d’excellentes compétences en matière d’amélioration continue ainsi qu’une capacité à établir des priorités. Le ou la candidat(e) doit maîtriser la méthodologie et les techniques de gestion de projets et les appliquer au domaine des transports, être capable de développer et de mettre en œuvre les indicateurs et outils nécessaires pour maintenir une gouvernance forte des projets dont il a la responsabilité, le tout dans un environnement en pleine transformation.

 

 

Le rôle

 

•                    Diriger la gestion du portefeuille de projets ayant des répercussions sur les transports, ainsi que la production et la communication de l’état d’avancement des projets à la haute direction;

•                    Prendre les décisions nécessaires à la bonne gestion des projets liés au transport (livrables, ressources, cédule, budget, gestion des parties prenantes);

•                    Organiser et gérer le processus d’initiation de projet en élaborant les documents préalables, à savoir la portée, l’analyse de cas, les besoins d’affaires, les jalons, le calendrier, le plan de gestion du risque, le plan de gestion du changement, etc.;

•                    Créer un tableau de bord pour la gouvernance du portefeuille de projets;

•                    Faire preuve d’initiative pour l’identification des risques potentiels et l’élaboration de plan de mitigation avec l’équipe de projet, déterminer les dépendances et rechercher des solutions;

•                    Communiquer le statut, les risques et les mesures d’atténuation à l’équipe de gestion des transports;

•                    Diriger le processus de priorisation des projets avec l’équipe de gestion des transports;

•                    Représenter la fonction Transports dans le cadre d’autres projets d’entreprise ayant des répercussions sur le processus, les outils et l’organisation des transports.



Profil

Les compétences que nous recherchons

 

•                    Baccalauréat en administration des affaires (opérations, logistique, chaîne d’approvisionnement), en génie ou dans un domaine connexe (exigé);

•                    Au moins 5 années d’implication progressive dans les secteurs des transports, de la logistique, de la chaîne d’approvisionnement ou de la distribution (atout);

•                    Au moins 5 années d’expérience à titre de gestionnaire de projet dédié ou intégré dans le cadre d’un rôle opérationnel ou d’optimisation (exigé);

•                    Expérience dans le secteur du commerce de détail, au sein d’un distributeur national de grande envergure ou d’un fournisseur de services de transport/logistique;

•                    Pensée analytique et critique, aptitude à résoudre des problèmes et à prendre des décisions; attitude proactive et volonté de remettre en question des processus existants et de proposer de nouvelles solutions;

•                    Sens de l’organisation et rigueur; antécédents éprouvés d’exécution de tâches de manière efficace, à temps et sous pression, ainsi que de gestion efficace des priorités dans un environnement qui évolue rapidement;

•                    Compétences en communication; capacité de communiquer de manière claire et concise à tous les niveaux de l’organisation et à toutes les unités d’affaires pour l’atteinte des objectifs visés;

•                    Capacité démontrée de travailler avec des équipes de tous les niveaux de l’organisation et de diverses fonctions dans un environnement complexe;

•                    Capacité de prendre en charge les tâches à accomplir; compétences en leadership; capacité à établir rapidement sa crédibilité au sein de l’organisation;

•                    Acuité financière et capacité démontrée de développer des dossiers de décision;

•                    Bilinguisme parlé et écrit (français et anglais) (exigé);

•                    Capacité de se déplacer (au Canada et, occasionnellement, aux États Unis) jusqu’à 15 % du temps, selon les besoins (requis).



Informations contractuelles

Les avantages que nous offrons

 

•                    Un centre de conditionnement physique, des activités sportives et des douches;

•                    Un centre de la petite enfance pouvant accueillir 78 enfants;

•                    Une cafétéria avec un menu de qualité cuisiné par un chef dédié, des options santé et des stations de café Starbucks et Tim Hortons;

•                    Des rabais exclusifs aux employé(e)s, en plus d’un rabais de 10 % en magasin (dans toutes les enseignes de l’entreprise);

•                    Des avantages sociaux : régime de retraite, primes annuelles, régime d’achat d’actions, programme d’encouragement aux études, etc.;

•                    Des horaires flexibles et du télétravail;

•                    Des bornes de recharge pour voitures électriques;

•                    La possibilité d’évoluer au sein de l’organisation;

•                    Un environnement de travail inclusif et sécuritaire;

•                    Une sensibilité à l’équilibre travail-vie personnelle;

•                    Un employeur engagé dans sa communauté;

•                    Et plus encore!

 

 

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d’alléger le texte. Nous sommes déterminés à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

 




Les compétences que nous recherchons • Baccalauréat en administration des affaires (opérations, logistique, chaîne d’approvisionnement), en génie ou dans un domaine connexe (exigé); • Au moins 5 années d’implication progressive dans les secteurs des transports, de la logistique, de la chaîne d’approvisionnement ou de la distribution (atout); • Au moins 5 années d’expérience à titre de gestionnaire de projet dédié ou intégré dans le cadre d’un rôle opérationnel ou d’optimisation (exigé); • Expérience dans le secteur du commerce de détail, au sein d’un distributeur national de grande envergure ou d’un fournisseur de services de transport/logistique; • Pensée analytique et critique, aptitude à résoudre des problèmes et à prendre des décisions; attitude proactive et volonté de remettre en question des processus existants et de proposer de nouvelles solutions; • Sens de l’organisation et rigueur; antécédents éprouvés d’exécution de tâches de manière efficace, à temps et sous pression, ainsi que de gestion efficace des priorités dans un environnement qui évolue rapidement; • Compétences en communication; capacité de communiquer de manière claire et concise à tous les niveaux de l’organisation et à toutes les unités d’affaires pour l’atteinte des objectifs visés; • Capacité démontrée de travailler avec des équipes de tous les niveaux de l’organisation et de diverses fonctions dans un environnement complexe; • Capacité de prendre en charge les tâches à accomplir; compétences en leadership; capacité à établir rapidement sa crédibilité au sein de l’organisation; • Acuité financière et capacité démontrée de développer des dossiers de décision; • Bilinguisme parlé et écrit (français et anglais) (exigé); • Capacité de se déplacer (au Canada et, occasionnellement, aux États Unis) jusqu’à 15 % du temps, selon les besoins (requis).

title: Business Development Director, Transit Request-For-Proposals
description:
About Bus.com: 

We're disrupting a $17B private bus industry (in North America alone) that is where the taxi industry was before ride-share. We are doing this by shifting business online and allowing event organizers to move large groups to their destinations with ease. We are the reference in people transportation, including professional sports teams, major tech companies, international music festivals, and everyone in between. In the last 2 years, we have successfully expanded our offering to offer our virtual fleet of vehicles, technology and marketing know-how to governmental entities (transit authorities, airports, etc.). 

Enter you, an industry all-star to lead this fast-growing segment. 

Your Role: 

We are looking for a Business Development Director, Transit Request-For-Proposal (“RFP”) Director to oversee and build on our already existing bidding activities across North America with a specific focus on Transit-as-a-Service. The director will be responsible to oversee all sourcing of deals, bidding activities including writing the company response, creating the proposed solution, and delivering strong financial performance, negotiating the agreements and handover activities to operations. To be successful in this role, you must be committed to developing top of market solutions and contributing to our long-term business high growth targets. This role will be key in the success of the company. If you have experience in this space, believe in dreaming big, getting sh*t done, and know how to have fun while doing it, we'd like to meet you. 

What you will achieve: 

Build and recruit bid team 

Achieve/exceed quarterly metrics (ex: lead conversion / opportunities won) 

Nurture future potential client relationships 

Attend industry conferences, represent, and build bus.com's brand in the space 

Improve qualification process and qualify inbound leads (bid platforms, etc.) 

Create bid strategy and solution, oversee bid writing, collaborate to create financial projections, get buy-in from internal stakeholders. Source and secure required subcontractors. 

Nurture submitted bids including preparing presentations and answer follow on questions 

Negotiate agreements with client and subcontractors 

Properly handover delivery of contracts to the operations team 

Who you are: 

Comfortable taking on a high degree of accountability 

Skilled presenter with the ability to break down and communicate complex ideas effectively (written or oral) 

Curious and passionate about public transportation and urban mobility 

Meticulous and vigilant, with a high level of attention to detail 

A problem solver that is relentlessly focused about the customer journey (and their client's journey!) 

Extremely well organized, with the capacity to multitask. 

Ideally You Will Have: 

Bachelor's degree in commerce or similar relevant experience 

10+ years of complex bid experience with at least 2 years of experience in transit industry 

Comfort working with CRM platforms (SFDC) 

Proficiency in French or Spanish is an asset 

Knowledge of Google Suite and Pardot platform is an asset 

You Exemplify These Values: 

We act like owners, the puck stops with us, we make sh*t happen, we play to win 

We have a growth mindset, we are always listening to our clients and partners, experimenting & learning, we grow together 

We lead with transparency, if in doubt we over communicate, we are not afraid to be vulnerable 

We're in this together, we succeed as a team, we all have unique superpowers, and we help each other shine.

title: Transportation Manager
description:
A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company

Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food

Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging.We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement

Raise the Good in Food

We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values 

Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility

The Opportunity

As a member of the Transportation team, this position will be responsible for leading the team to developing the most efficient and cost-effective daily plan out of our plants and DC’s. This must occur within the framework of delivering results in a timely fashion to maintain shipping efficiencies while ensuring customer needs are met.  The role requires numerous daily decisions that must align with financial budgets. Building strong carrier relationships and internal relationships is imperative for success in this role. 

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do:

  • Coach and lead a team of Transportation Coordinators who plan inter-Canada and US bound shipments, building upon existing strengths within the team
  • In partnership with the Carrier Management team, complete regular meetings with carriers to provide feedback on service levels.
  • Reviewing and presenting Period results to various members of Maple Leaf Foods
  • Communication with internal customers on any risks and activities occurring within Transportation.
  • Responsible for the creation of cost-effective daily route plans that must be focused on cost effectiveness and customer (both internal and external) satisfaction in a very fast-paced make-to-order environment.
  • Provide analytical support for budgeting process
  • Responsible for generating reports and analysis to support continuous improvement and identify ongoing cost-saving opportunities
  • Assist with customer and carrier claims
  • Various other projects and cost savings initiatives
  • Other duties as assigned

POSITION OUTCOMES:

  • Strong daily plans developed by the team through ongoing carrier negotiations and route reviews
  • A strong team of transportation coordinators who manage the day to day planning of shipments
  • Achieve set targets on budget and cost-savings
  • On-going process improvement, reducing the workload of the team while increasing service to internal and external customers

What we have to offer you:

  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America
  • Professional and career development opportunities
  • Competitive Health and Wellness benefits that start on your first day of employment
  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan
  • Commitment to Learning – courses, resources and tools provided to all employees
  • Employee Assistance Program

What you will bring:

  • Strong knowledge of distribution, transportation, and freight costing
  • 3-5 years of Logistics experience including warehouse & transportation with a large organization with multiple profit centers
  • Knowledge of US Freight Customs, USDA Border cross process would be an asset
  • Professional designation (e.g.: CITT, P.Log) or other related courses would be an asset
  • Demonstrated strong team player
  • Strongly aligned with Maple Leaf Values
  • Superior oral and written communication skills
  • Exceptional analytical skills with ability to provide insight
  • Strong problem solving, prioritization & organization skills with the ability to manage multiple projects with strict timelines
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision
  • Strong interpersonal skills that allow for informal and formal networking across the organization and with external vendors/customers
  • Strong computer skills in Microsoft Excel
  • Functional capability with SAP, BEX, BI is an asset
Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees.  As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination.   In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022).  We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws
We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.
Championing diversity and inclusion is a critical component to advancing our collective purpose and vision, living the Maple Leaf Leadership Values, and delivering winning results. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired; please contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

.

This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.', 'Diverse and Inclusive Teams', 'Demonstrated strong team player', 'Reviewing and presenting Period results to various members of Maple Leaf Foods', 'Strong computer skills in Microsoft Excel', 'Strong problem solving, prioritization & organization skills with the ability to manage multiple projects with strict timelines', 'Responsible for generating reports and analysis to support continuous improvement and identify ongoing cost-saving opportunities', 'Do What’s Right', 'Strong daily plans developed by the team through ongoing carrier negotiations and route reviews', 'Strong interpersonal skills that allow for informal and formal networking across the organization and with external vendors/customers', 'Superior oral and written communication skills', 'Functional capability with SAP, BEX, BI is an asset', 'Assist with customer and carrier claims', 'Provide analytical support for budgeting process', 'Various other projects and cost savings initiatives', '3-5 years of Logistics experience including warehouse & transportation with a large organization with multiple profit centers', 'Professional and career development opportunities', 'Responsible for the creation of cost-effective daily route plans that must be focused on cost effectiveness and customer (both internal and external) satisfaction in a very fast-paced make-to-order environment.', 'On-going process improvement, reducing the workload of the team while increasing service to internal and external customers', 'Other duties as assigned']

title: Directeur Stratégique - PQ - | Transport
description:
Directeur Stratégique - Province de Québec | Équipement spécialisé pour le transport

Notre client, manufacturier spécialisé dans le domaine du transport, cherche à combler le poste de Directeur stratégique pour la province de Québec.

Le mandat: Le Directeur stratégique sera en charge des trois succursales du Québec au niveau des ventes et des pièces et service; il devra gérer son équipe afin d'atteindre les objectifs financiers et opérationnels. Son quotidien lui demandera de maintenir les relations d'affaires avec les comptes majeurs, assurer la satisfaction des clients et optimiser la qualité du service.
Il aura bien sûr à maintenir un bon niveau de communication avec son équipe de vente et service, en plus de régler les différents problèmes opérationnels. On lui demandera aussi d'établir un plan d'affaires stratégique et de gérer le budget annuel.

Avantages
Directeur stratégique - Province de Québec | Équipement spécialisé pour le transport

-Salaire de base à partir de 110 000$ +++
-Plan de bonification avantageux
-Allocation voiture + kilométrique
-Avantages sociaux complets avec cotisation de l'employeur


Responsabilités
Directeur stratégique - Province de Québec | Équipement spécialisé pour le transport

-Gestion de l'équipe du Québec et des activités opérationnelles
-Exécution du plan d'affaires annuel
-Supervision globale des ventes et du service
-Assurer la satisfaction des clients et optimiser la qualité du service
-Régler les problèmes opérationnels et les escalader à la maison-mère lorsque nécessaire
-Responsabilité P&L des succursales




Qualifications
Directeur stratégique - Province de Québec | Équipement spécialisé pour le transport

-Solide expérience en gestion
-Expérience obligatoire en VENTE dans un domaine relié au transport
-Compréhension et gestion d'un P&L
-Parfaitement bilingue
-Bagage technique; idéalement industrie du transport


Sommaire
Vous désirez en apprendre plus sur cette opportunité? Vous n’avez qu’à me faire suivre votre candidature à marie-eve.larose@randstad.ca
Votre candidature sera étudiée par un membre de notre équipe de recrutement, et nous vous contacterons directement si vos compétences correspondent à nos besoins actuels.
Contactez-moi: Marie-Eve Larose | 438.341.9694

Pourquoi faire affaire avec moi:
Carrière sur mesure pour vous
Accès à des offres cachées
Un partenaire à l’écoute de vos ambitions

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Transport Manager
description:
Company Description

About Us

American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned, Canadian-based company founded in 1936 in Montreal, Quebec. Recognized as one of North America’s most sophisticated metal recyclers, AIM has evolved into a successful and multifaceted company with a global footprint.

At AIM, we understand that the well-being of our employees is the key factor for our international success. Accordingly, we promote a safe, fair and dynamic work environment that provides excellent training programs and career advancement plans and maintains the highest safety standards.

If you are looking for career development and an opportunity to work for a company that promotes growth, then keep reading!

    Job Description

    American Iron & Metal is a growth-oriented metal recycling and processing company located in Saint John, New Brunswick. We are currently recruiting for a Transport Manager for our Atlantic location.

    The Transport Manager will be responsible for coordinating the safe and efficient delivery and pick-up of scrap metal to and from customer locations. They will work with our  Dispatch Supervisor to regularly audit current delivery and pick-up routes and identify opportunities for efficiency improvements without sacrificing safety and customer service. The Manager will ensure policies and procedures are respected throughout their work group’s day to day operations. Qualified candidates will be self-driven and demonstrate exceptional workplace safety standards, attention to detail, efficiency, customer service, continuous improvement and strong verbal and written communication skills, leadership skills and business acumen. 

    Overview

    • Responsible to oversee the day to day operations of the transport team(s) at large including supervisors, drivers, dispatch quality, safety regulations and procedures for the Atlantic footprint and the State of Maine
    • The successful candidate will be responsible for working closely with their Dispatch Supervisor to ensure timely service to our customers in the most cost-effective way possible
    • Responsible for respecting allocated budget and identifying improvement possibilities
    • Manage and Supervise overall fleet operations including regulatory requirements
    • Supervise and manage performance to ensure tasks are appropriately delegated and completed by coaching and holding employees accountable to expectations
    • Build and develop team by understanding employees career goals and provide coaching to prepare employees for growth within the Company
    • Develop and implement appropriate KPI's and controls
    Qualifications

    Experience

     

    • 5 years of relevant work experience in transportation, logistics or solid waste operations
    • BBA or BA would be considered an asset
    • 5 or more years of supervisory experience in the transportation industry
    • Competent on Microsoft Office and transportation dispatch software
    • Strong knowledge of Transport Regulations
    • GEOTAB experience is preferred 
    • Class 1 driver's license optional

     

    Attributes

    • Ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
    • Ability to work efficiently and maximize productivity
    • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with all company divisions, promoting the overall success of the company
    • Flexible working schedule to accommodate off hours, occasional weekends and evenings, available by phone after-hours
    • Ability to interact with individuals at all levels of the organization
    • Strong written and oral communication skills
    • Ability to work efficiently and maximize productivity

title: 737 Fleet Manager
description:
This position is responsible for ensuring the overall management of maintenance, and planning for the 737 fleet. This position will report to the Director of Maintenance in Canada and the US, and also directs a small Tech Records and Maintenance planning team daily to ensure accurate and appropriate maintenance procedures are followed. This position will also review Airworthiness Directives and Service Bulletins and create action plans to ensure compliance with the AD and SB. We are looking for a person that has made a career as a “Can Do” problem solver willing to work with a fast-paced team of like-minded people.

Key Responsibilities:

Maintenance Planning- Help develop Aircraft Maintenance work scopes and build work packages. Working with the planning department to establish bi-annual heavy maintenance checks in full detail ensuring all necessary tools and materials are on-site, the required personnel will be present and all paperwork is completed for each check. The Fleet Manager is also responsible for monitoring that the plan is being followed and to adjust as required to ensure completion of plan is on schedule and within budget.

Fleet Management – Responsible for crew scheduling and monitoring, identifying inventory requirements and liaising with Stores Dept to ensure appropriate tooling and parts are ordered. Be aware of all technical training requirements and work with appropriate departments to develop training as needed. Take immediate action when aircraft is AOG by communicating with personnel on ground and develop an action plan to resolve the situation

Interdepartmental Liaising – Maintain open lines of communication with various departments and individuals within the organization, such as technical records, maintenance planning, and stores to ensure that the operational needs of the fleet are being met. You will be working with a small team, dedicated to the 737 program to start building processes for long term goals.

Quality Management- Ensure that regulatory and company standards are being met for maintenance, compliance, quality, and record keeping. Working with your team to update the MSG-3 program when required. Then incorporating the new and emerging inspection requirements to ensure the highest standards are being met.

Compliance Management- Identify compliance issues that require follow up or investigation, communicate emerging compliance issues to management and employees, file appropriate compliance records with regulatory agencies, when necessary, maintain documentation of compliance activities such as complaints received or investigation outcomes.

Requirements:

15+ years of maintenance experience

10+ years of experience performing maintenance on 737 aircraft

A Balance of MRO and Line Maintenance experience necessary

Transport Canada Certified 737 course

FAA A&P License preferred

Knowledge of Canadian Aviation Regulations. Knowledge of US Regulations an asset

Proficient in the use of Boeing publications and how to navigate them.

Reading an interpreting Boeing AD’s and Service Bulletins for applicability is a must.

    Checking and verifying past compliance data.

    Familiar with Aircraft Maintenance Tracking programs

    Must be proficient with Microsoft Office programs.

     

    This position will be based on Vancouver Island in Port Alberni, BC but will require some travel to the field locations which could be anywhere in the world.

Be aware of all technical training requirements and work with appropriate departments to develop training as needed. Take immediate action when aircraft is AOG by communicating with personnel on ground and develop an action plan to resolve the situation', '10+ years of experience performing maintenance on 737 aircraft', 'A Balance of MRO and Line Maintenance experience necessary', 'Transport Canada Certified 737 course', 'Proficient in the use of Boeing publications and how to navigate them.']

title: Transportation Vehicle Manager
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for Transportation Vehicle Manager.  These roles are for Nuna's newest adventure located in Northern Canada in Nunavut.

This is your opportunity to experience one of Canada's most exclusive work locations!

Nuna offers:
  • Very competitive compensation package which consists of a balance pay schedule that will also provide income during your rotational days off; 
  • Extensive benefits package with a matching RRSP plan; 
  • Company supplied flights;
  • Single / Private room accommodations;
  • On-site recreational facilities include gym, gymnasium, and bar/ lounge; 
  • Accommodations and full meals provided;
  • Annual Bonus program; 
  • Employee recognition program;
  • Rotation allowances (provided every rotation);
  • Long-term opportunities.
 
All successful candidates will be required to clear all pre-access conditions which will include criminal backgrounds, full medical /physical testing, and Drug and Alcohol testing. 

Due to the location of this remote worksite rotations will be 8 weeks in / 8 weeks out*  

Job Duties:
  • Oversee the provision of transportation services for all the clients personnel, including movement of supplies and equipment and recovery and breakdown service.
  • Oversees the maintenance of roads and grounds services, Quarry operations, Snow and Ice Control for the Airfield,  roads and grounds maintenance efforts.
  • Maintain, update and submit weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual operational plans, reports and deliverables.
  • Supervise, train, develop and evaluate performance of staff to ensure a high level of productivity and the best use of staff capabilities


Qualifications:
  • Certification in vehicle or heavy equipment maintenance
  • Valid Class 5 Drivers License
  • 5+ years supervisory experience of maintenance personnel for vehicle maintenance, roads and grounds, and heavy equipment
  • 10+ years of overall work experience
  • Strong work ethic, ability to manage multiple priorities, solid interpersonal, communications and documentation skills
  • Must be eligible for ENHANCED RELIABILITY security clearance and pass a pre-employment medical
  • Must possess a valid passport to overnight in Thule, Greenland during on-route to  the site.
  • Ability to work cross-culturally and a strong team player is a must; will need to roll up sleeves and pitch in as and when required

All successful candidates must:
  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written.
  2. Have experience as requested in the job description above.
  3. Able to work in a remote location for extended rotations.
  4. Clear all pre-access testing. 
  5. Eligible to work for any employer in Canada.
  6. Reside within Canada and have a valid Canadian Passport.
 
*Covid-19 Quarantine periods up to 14 days will be required before each rotation.

Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   

Interested applicants are asked to apply online at: http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html
Or by email: hr@nunalogistics.com
 
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.  All resumes will be held for other current and future opportunities.
  
Nuna Logistics is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective, and innovative operator in the north.

title: Transport Operations Manager
description:
Company Description

As one of the world’s largest fashion companies with more than 171,000 employees worldwide, H&M is an exciting and dynamic place to pursue a career within the fashion industry. Our business concept is to offer fashion and quality at the best price in a sustainable way and with our fast expansion we are always looking for new talents. Would you like to be part of our team? H&M group comprises of nine independent brands: H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M Home, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. We have over 4,900 stores across more than 73 markets worldwide. Our values reflect the heart and soul of H&M. They define what it takes to work here and how we do things. When we interact with colleagues and customers around the world, our values help us develop and grow. We want to be at the forefront of both fashion and sustainability. Our employees play a key role and can contribute to more sustainable fashion, today and in the future.

Job Description

Core Responsibilities includes but is not limited to:

 •    Ensure execution of all transport activities related to OTC/RTC shipments- and production forecasts for the assigned market
•    Partner with stakeholders for a cost efficient and environmentally efficient transport set up for the assigned market
•    Maintain the transport budget for assigned market
•    KPI owner; responsible for ensuring TSP’s are executing the agreed KPIs
•    Assist and at times lead transportation improvements and projects
•    RFP and negotiation participant for all OMNI distribution contracts connected to the assigned markets
•    Maintain overview of transportation contracts associated to assigned market
•    Maintain carrier relations by setting a routine meeting structure and follow-up process
•    Partner with stakeholders to promote synergies and implement optimizations between retail and online flows
•    Follow up on local transport activities to support reg./global OKR’s
•    Set clear and defined personal development goals for each team member

Additional Accountabilities:

•    Contributes to the creation of Transportation budget of the Region
•    Manages transportation costs and approves carrier’s charges
 

Qualifications

•    Bachelors Degree, preferably in Transportation, Logistics, or International Business preferred
•    2-4 years of management experience within the transportation industry
•    Experience working with different TMS and YMS platforms preferred

ROLE REQUIREMENTS:

•         Ability to manage freight operations; as well as details of shipping operations

•         Knowledge of business processes such as profit and loss, profit margins, accounting, and other related principles

•         Negotiation and bidding experience

•         Strong computer knowledge including Microsoft Office Suite

•         Ability to work independently and in a high pressure, multi-personality, fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment

·       •Ability to establish and maintain relationships with peers, internal customers, and outside vendors



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Fleet Manager
description:
Job Description

The Fleet Manager is responsible for the development and implementation of full-cycle and cost-effective vehicle asset management that will maximize performance while maintaining a safe and reliable fleet. Duties will include the fleet specification development, servicing, operation, repair, maintenance, safety, and regulatory compliance management of vehicles and drivers. The Fleet Manager will partner with key business stakeholders and external contractors to deliver efficient fleet operations that aligns with operational, safety, environmental and profitability objectives for Civeo.

Responsibilities

  • Plan and manage the performance and functions related to the procurement, upfitting, servicing, repair, maintenance, and administration of Civeo's commercial and corporate vehicles.
  • In conjunction with Supply Chain, manage third party fleet providers and contractors and ensure the vehicle service and quality meet Civeo's objectives.
  • Conduct Vehicle Life Cycle Analysis and ensure Fleet operations and activities comply with relevant environmental, safety, transportation and industry codes, standards, and regulations.
  • Lead ongoing forecasting of Fleet needs and present recommendations and opportunities to key stakeholders.
  • Work collaboratively with key business teams, ensure objectives and outcomes align with stakeholder and operational expectations.
  • Collaborate with Operational Teams in development and implementation of all vehicle and driver policies
  • Implement and project manage initiatives and activities related to fleet improvements.
  • Manage fleet administration standards, DOT compliance, vehicle operating policies, compliance plan and safety manual.
  • Work closely with Supply Chain on the negotiation of contracts and service level agreements with third party suppliers and/or service providers; manage factory orders and vehicle specifications.
  • Manage Commercial Vehicle Inspection Program, compliance, record keeping and reporting.
  • Lead programs related to Safety Fitness, Annual Operating Authority for busses, fuel usage reporting, permits, insurance, registrations, renewals, driver logbooks and vehicle inspections.
  • Direct the selling or disposal of used vehicles in collaboration with Supply Chain
  • Research and evaluate new vehicles, coordinate with supply chain in purchasing to ensure optimal pricing and quality of vehicles that is best suited for the business.
  • Assess and coordinate commercial vehicle maintenance schedule, action service and repair activities to maintain performance and reliability.
  • Partner with HSE to develop and implement vehicle safety training, corrective and preventive measures, vehicle safety management, incident investigations, and insurance claims.
  • Manage IVMS (Geotab) system administration and user training.
  • Prepare various annual, quarterly, monthly reports for HSE, regulatory organizations, external clients, and Senior Management.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
  • Post-secondary education in Logistics, Transportation, or related field.
  • Certified Transportation Safety Professional CTSP is an asset.
  • Minimum 10 years' experience managing fleet operations.
  • Thorough knowledge of Provincial and National Safety Codes regulating commercial vehicle fleets.
  • Proficiency in MS Office applications
  • Experience in Geotab or related IVMS is considered an asset.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing external contracts on fuel usage, maintenance, IVMS system, logbooks, insurances, registration and Department of Transportation compliances and regulations.
  • Strong negotiation and vendor management skills
  • Demonstrated experience in using superior collaboration skills and abilities.
  • Superior project management and leadership skills
  • Excellent problem solving, strategic thinking, analytical and planning skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Must be able to pass Pre-Access drug and alcohol testing.
  • 25% travel to remote sites is required
  • Must have a valid Class 5 Driver's License, with a 5-year driving record satisfactory to Civeo's Safe Vehicle Use policy
About Us

Civeo Canada Employees LP is a premier remote workforce accommodations specialist supporting the Western Canadian resource industry. We help people maintain healthy, productive and connected lives while living and working away from home. Our unique approach focuses on guest wellbeing, operational efficiency and community building - making us a leading provider of accommodation solutions.

title: Project Manager Transportation and Transit
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is seeking a  Project Manager, Transportation & Transit to join our Richmond Hill or Burllington, ON office. 

 

The  Project Manager will be responsible for the successful delivery of design for and construction management projects related to multi discipline engineering services for transportation and transit. Additionally the incumbent will be involved in identifying new business opportunities with existing clients in the Transportation & Transit sectors.

 

This position will offer an excellent career development opportunity for someone who has current experience in management of projects, technical staff and client liaison, and wishes to be involved in the growth and development of our business operation.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Management of project budgets, schedules and client deliverables
  • Manage the planning and design work for transportaion & transit projects
  • Manage and supervision of technical staff
  • Oversee the preparation and review of construction contracts, plans, specifications and tender documents
  • Liaise with contract administration and construction inspection staff
  • Preparation of proposal documents
  • Client liaison and relationship management
  • Identification and development of new business opportunities

 

Skills / Qualifications

  • 8+ years of relevant infrastructure project experience with public sector clients 
  • Registered with or eligible to register with Professional Engineers Ontario
  • Registered with or eligible to register as a Project Management Professional (PMP)
  • Proven project management experience
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to support and project values compatible with the organization

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Directeur de territoire - Transport / Territory Manager - Transportation
description:
Brandt Truck Rigging & Trailers est actuellement à la recherche d'un directeur de territoire - Transport pour la région du Québec. Ce poste est responsable des ventes directes et de la location de camions et de remorques de transport lourd neufs et usagés. Grâce à une solide compréhension des tendances de l'industrie et des prochaines ventes aux enchères, le directeur de territoire - Transport fera des prévisions et déterminera les équipements potentiels à vendre ou à consigner.

Tâches et responsabilités :

  • Rechercher régulièrement des comptes potentiels et nouveaux comptes et effectuer du démarchage.
  • Participer à toutes les occasions de vente, et conclure des ventes concurrentielles.
  • Assurer de bonnes relations de travail entre le client et Brandt pour résoudre les problèmes et fidéliser la clientèle
  • Établir le profil de tous les comptes, en tenant à jour les coordonnées des clients
  • Tenir des dossiers complets relatifs à chaque vente, y compris les rapports d'appel, les devis, les spécifications, les commandes, les notes de frais et tout autre document nécessaire
  • Effectuer régulièrement des voyages dans le territoire assigné

Expérience requise :

  • Une attitude positive et professionnelle face aux défis internes et externes
  • Expérience avec Microsoft Office
  • Compréhension des équipements de transport spécialisés et de l'industrie
  • De solides compétences relationnelles, avec une forte volonté de servir les clients et d'entretenir les relations
  • Capacité à travailler sans supervision, à accomplir des tâches sous pression et à coopérer avec des membres de l'équipe qui peuvent avoir des priorités et des objectifs différents
  • 5 ans d'expérience dans la vente (ou équivalent)
  • Permis de conduire de classe 5 requis; la classe 1 serait considérée comme un atout
  • Doit pouvoir obtenir ou avoir un passeport valide et pouvoir voyager à l'étranger

Brandt Truck Rigging & Trailersis currently seeking a Territory Manager - Transportation for theQuebec area. This position is responsible for direct sales and rental of new and used heavy duty transportation trucks ans trailers. With a solid understanding of industry trends and upcoming auctions, the Territory Manager - Transportation will forecast and identify prospective equipment for sale or consignment.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Regularly prospect and cold call new accounts
  • Participate in all sales opportunities, and close competitive sales
  • Assure good working relationships between customer and Brandt to resolve problems and grow customer loyalty
  • Profile all accounts, keeping customer contact info up-to-date
  • Maintain complete records related to each sale, including call reports, quotes, specifications, sales orders, expense reports, and other documentation as required
  • Regular travel to assigned territory

Required Experience:

  • A positive and professional attitude to both internal and external challenges
  • Experience with Microsoft Office
  • Understanding of specialized transportation equipment and industry
  • Strong people skills, with high desire to serve customers and nurture relationships
  • Ability to work unsupervised, complete tasksunder pressure, and cooperate with team members who may have different focus and priorities
  • 5 years sales experience (or equivalent)
  • Class 5 drivers licence required; class 1 would be considered an asset
  • Must be able to obtain or have a valid passport and be able to travel internationally

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Grow With Us!

 

Hudson is North America's leading travel retailer. For over 30 years, Hudson has met the needs and wants of travelers in more than 1,000 duty-free, duty-paid, and food & beverage stores. We couldn’t serve our customers, landlords, and partners in airports, commuter terminals, hotels, and casinos without the continued support of our greatest assets: our team members. We’re dedicated to hiring and training exceptional team members, who are committed to serving the customer as the Traveler’s Best Friend. We strive to ensure we’re fulfilling our team members' career potentials through training, skills development, and career pathways – as our team members grow and succeed both personally and professionally, so does Hudson.


What We Will Offer You:

  • A 20% off Hudson Employee Discount
  • A 50% off Hudson Food & Beverage Discount

This Warehouse Manager Job Is For You, If You Would Enjoy:

  • Assisting the General Manager by managing and executing all activities of the warehouse in support of the overall Duty Free and Duty Paid operation
  • Promoting an overall corporate image of excellence through a strong work ethic, leadership by example, and the consistent delivery of excellent customer service throughout the warehouse operation at Edmonton International Airport.

Your Team is counting on you as a Warehouse Manager to:

  • Able to work any shift within the hours of 7 am and 6 pm on weekdays, weekend and holidays
  • Work additional hours as needed
  • Able to work a full-time schedule
  • Must have open and flexible availability


Warehouse Manager Key Accountabilities:

  • Protects all company assets in the warehouse including non-stock merchandise
  • Provides a safe and clean environment for warehouse personnel
  • Recruits and trains warehouse personnel
  • Schedules warehouse operational hours to accommodate business requirements
  • Supervises and delegates tasks to warehouse employees
  • Places stock orders as required
  • Counts and receives incoming merchandise; reports shortages/overages to vendors in a timely manner, before required deadlines
  • Counts and completes all appropriate paperwork for merchandise returns to vendors
  • Adjusts prices (mark ups/ mark downs) as per the General Manager's instructions. Provides ongoing stock replenishment to the sales floor
  • Isolates, sorts, and organizes all damaged and outdated products for subsequent supplier credits and returns
  • Arranges monthly meetings with sales representatives to provide information to the General Manager regarding new products on the market and to obtain credit for damaged/outdated products
  • Organizes all preparatory work for quarterly press counts and annual inventory


Required Qualifications:

  • Leadership qualities and demonstrated organizational skills
  • Good time-management skills and problem-solving abilities
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Ability to lift 30 kg/60 lbs
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • 1 to 3 years of previous warehouse managerial experience
  • Proficiency with SAP or similar inventory management program



Some of our company-offered benefits for you and your family include:

  • Health & Well Being: Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Various Personal and Parental Leave Programs
  • Universal Life Insurance
  • Retirement Programs & Matching Employee Contributions: 401K & RRSP
  • Hudson Employee 20% Off Discount
  • Employee Recognition & Anniversary Programs
  • Training, Development, and Growth Opportunities
  • Tuition Assistance & Scholarship Programs


Hudson is an Equal Opportunity Employer of all qualified individuals. All employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, military leave or veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace in which we value diversity and unique experiences, backgrounds and identities.

Depending on the location of the position, applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States or Canada for any employer. All offers are contingent upon successful completion and passing of background checks and/or employment verification results.

Note to staffing agencies: Please do not contact Hudson (including the recruitment team or any hiring managers) regarding this position with candidates. If assistance is needed in filling any position for Hudson, a member of our recruiting team will reach out directly.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Company Description

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

The Warehouse Manager, reporting to the Real Property Services Manager, is a key member of the contract team at a historical remote location in the Canadian Arctic. In this position, you are responsible for maintaining proper warehouse orderliness for all infrastructure workshops and storage areas, ensuring that orders are tracked and not duplicated, records are maintained for all items received, and that materiel is stored in an orderly fashion on labelled shelves to facilitate inventory control. An 8 weeks on, 8 weeks off rotational schedule with flights to and from the worksite in Nunavut leaving from Trenton, Ontario. A unique opportunity to contribute to the operation of an entire community supporting members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

This position requires Government of Canada security clearance at the Reliability Status level.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Day-to-day operation and accountability for the contract site warehouse.
  • Procurement through Department of National Defense (DND) using DND processes and protocols.
  • Responsible for warehouse operations, such as expediting purchases, maintaining communications with vendors, receiving and verifying the accuracy of shipments, stocking shelves, and auditing documentation.
  • Playing a key role in the development, implementation and monitoring of effective processes and procedures in the warehouse.
  • Setup layout and space management; work organization chart; procedures such as SOP.
  • Manage stock control: the self-assured receipt, storage, retrieval and timely delivery of goods; shipment loading and transferring; document recording and data entry into system.
  • Plan, organize and control warehouse’s over-all operations.
  • Constantly plan out all warehouse resources and activities in relation to client contract statement of work and company objectives and set targets.
  • Responsible for weekly sustainment offloading and transport of material to the supply depot.
  • Perform monthly inventory and complete inventory count sheets and reports.
  • Responsible for life cycling of material, physical reorganization of material, completion.
  • Perform client directed tasks to assist with material verifications and maintenance of site storage locations.
  • Coordinate the disposal of and/or backhaul transportation of time expired, worn, redundant and scrap items from the warehouse.
Qualifications

  • Minimum Grade 12 education; however, preference will be given to individuals with a university or technical education background.
  • Completion of Material Handling and Management.
  • Must possess forklift operator license.
  • Current First Aid training certificate is an asset.
  • Ability to obtain Government of Canada security clearance at the Reliability Status level (requires a 5 year background check and Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency).
  • Ability to obtain fit-for-duty medical assessment from a physician.
  • Experience working in remote locations is an asset.
  • Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS Excel, MS Word, and inventory control software.
  • Punctual, reliable and schedule focused.
  • Experience with warehouse management system and experience with implementation processes.
  • Excellent communication, both written and oral.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Ability to problem solve and make decisions.
  • Excellent multi-tasking, time management and organizational skills.
  • Possess strong ability to develop and maintain positive interpersonal relationships, with the flexibility and ability to work independently with minimum supervision and within a team environment.
  • Inuit cultural awareness, knowledge and respect.
  • Flexibility to meet the unique requirements of the site including potential rotational shift changes and working after hours “on-call” duties.


Additional Information

  • An opportunity for work life balance. 8 weeks on and 8 weeks off allows you to use your time to do what you enjoy.
  • Continuous wage payment throughout your time off.
  • Competitive wages, benefits and an RSP matching program.
  • Retention Bonus of up to 10% of wages earned paid on the completion of a 2 year contract.
  • Paid travel time.
  • Unique experience in the northernmost continuously inhabited place in the world.
  • Training and development opportunities to help grow and diversify your career.
  • Transfer opportunities to other Dexterra sites across Canada.

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

*Please note this job is based in Alert, Nunavut, Canada.

title: Assistant Warehouse Manager
description:
Overview

LEON’S IS NOW HIRING AN ASSISTANT WAREHOUSE MANAGER

WITH CANADA’S MOST SUCCESSFUL HOME FURNISHING RETAILER, THERE’S NO LIMIT TO WHERE YOU CAN GO!

Leon’s Furniture Ltd. is a family-owned, publicly traded company that has been a part of Canadian homes, and families for more than a century. We are committed to providing our dedicated associates with secure jobs, and a safe and satisfying work environment, and will strive to support their ongoing pursuit of personal development and career advancement.

Presently, Leon’s is looking for talented applicants for the position of Assistant Warehouse Manager. The ideal candidate has the drive and determination to continue to make Leon’s the number one choice for the Canadian consumer, and shares our core values, which are deeply embedded in our culture and reflected in our actions: Honesty. Integrity. Hard work. Family. 

RESPONSIBILITIES

Supporting the warehouse manager in:

  • Ensuring the smooth operation of a busy warehouse with several areas of responsibility, including: shipping and receiving, inventory, delivery, merchandising, packaging and maintenance
  • Managing the warehouse team
  • Ensuring the accurate and secure handling of product; balancing a large inventory
  • Overseeing maintenance and ensuring safe operation of lift trucks, warehouse bins, delivery trucks, service vehicles
  • Training and people development
  • Interviewing and hiring
  • Scheduling; ensuring provincial legislative requirements met
  • Completing, reviewing and distributing warehouse reports regularly
  • Resolving customer issues; ensuring safe delivery of product
  • Ensuring company policies and procedures are met
  • Ensuring general safety and security of store and employees
  • Chairing Health and Safety and warehouse meetings
  • Other duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS

  • High energy
  • Strong leadership and people skills
  • Ability to train and develop others to succeed
  • Goal oriented
  • Ambitious and eager to grow
  • Willingness to relocate advantageous but not necessary
  • And most importantly, a POSITIVE ATTITUDE!

WHY LEON’S?

  • On-going training and development to ensure your success
  • A fast-paced, dynamic, and fun environment with a great team
  • A generous employee discount program
  • Profit sharing

 

ONE SIMPLE CLICK COULD CHANGE YOUR LIFE. APPLY NOW

title: Manager, Inventory & Warehouse
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Key Responsibilities:

Leadership:

  • Lead a team comprising of Shipper, Receiver, Inventory Control and Material Handlers on a day to day basis while embracing the following values
    • Integrity – words and actions are aligned. 
    • Innovation – continues to look for improvements in our processes and encourages team members to do so
    • Inclusion – involves team members appropriately to ensure broad perspective is received during problem solving or improvement initiatives
    • Initiative – takes the lead on change requests and addresses outages to the point of completion when the issue pertains to Warehouse, shipping, receiving and kitting.
  • Track and reports on KPIs specific to the warehousing operations
  • Identifies resource constraints and manages to prioritize based on customer demands
  • Organizes daily, weekly, monthly tasks
  • Identifies and addresses gaps in resources given workloads
  • Collaborates with manufacturing, customer service & logistics, purchasing and management team members to meet internal and external customer deadlines

Safety

  • Maintain the safe and secure operations of the  2 separate warehouse locations in Kingston ON.
  • Ensure the safety of employees and contractors while they are in the warehouse
  • Maintain all equipment  calibrated, certified and in good working condition
  • Assess the impact of materials received at the warehouse on the safety of the facility and employees
  • Ensure safe loading and unloading of trucks and vehicles on warehouse premises

GMP/Quality

  • Ensure that the Quality Management system is implemented and maintained in the Warehousing operations to ensure accuracy and quality of the records are maintained.
  • Performing recall operations
  • Address Nonconformances, recall processes, customer complaints and product damage due to shipments
  • Ensure that inventory cycle counts are performed on time and necessary corrective actions are taken for any outages; ensure all data is secured and protected against accidental or unauthorized modifications
  • Keep accurate records for disposition or returned, rejected, recalled or falsified products
  • Approve any returns to saleable stock
  • Adhere to Lonza GMP and Environmental controls (Temperature monitoring), cleanliness requirements
  • Follow procedures to appropriately destroy/remove products/parts in a timely manner, once Material Review Board has provided authorization
  • Maintain the FIFO and/or FEFO principle.

Reliability

  • Use validated processes/SOPs to perform the work onsite
  • Train and qualify  team members on job responsibilities including Receiving, Shipping, Picking, Packing, Kitting
  • Complete PM on equipment used on a timely manner and maintain records
  • Ensure parts and product are kept as  per required storage conditions (Temperature, moisture, light, off the ground)

Costs

  • Takes responsibility for managing the departmental expenses
  • Tracks spending and address outages where needed
  • Prepares annual budgets
  • May manage capital project

Key Requirements:

  • GMP trained and qualified
  • Logistics and/or Supply Chain certifications
  • Has held leadership positions for minimum of 8 yrs
  • International shipping /Logistic experience
  • Bachelors degree in Science or Commerce
  • Prior experience in a Manufacturing environment
  • Proficient with spreadsheets, database, ERP systems
  • Lift truck/Tow motor certification
  • Working from heights certification

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
