title: Digital Program Director BHJOB13022_12156
description:
Digital Program Director – Permanent position in Vancouver (remote):

On behalf of our client in Vancouver,Ignite Technical Resources is looking for a Digital Program Director with our clientfor a permanent opportunity. 

Role Description:
Our client is looking for an experienced Program Director to successfully deliver business outcomes for an enterprise level change initiative.

In this role you will be responsible for the overall integrity and coherence of the program and requires effective co-ordination of the program’s projects and management of their inter-dependencies including oversight of any risks and issues arising. You will provide strategic guidance to teams and project managers/scrum masters in ways that promote the company’s culture. You will also oversee the progress of operations and coordinating cross-project activities.

Are you an effective and positive leader who has experience managing staff of different disciplines to produce results in a timely manner?

Are you a big picture thinker who will dive into the details when necessary to develop effective strategies and tactics and maintain a holistic view of the change initiative?

Responsibilities:
  • Lead teams toward and through transformation in support of the overall delivery of business outcomes as defined by the Program
  • Motivate and lead a group of project managers and other team members, providing development, mentorship, guidance, and performance management to his/her team
  • Plan and design the Program’s strategies and objectives and interrelated components and proactively drive its progress, resolving issues and initiating appropriate corrective action
  • Define the Program's governance structure and work with stakeholders to implement that governance structure
  • Empower senior level decision-making by executive leadership and the Board of Directors by providing timely and consistent communication and reporting to stakeholders on opportunities, progress, changes, and impact on portfolio components
  • Ensure effective quality assurance and the overall integrity of the Program - focusing inwardly on the internal coordination of the Program, and outwardly on its coherence with infrastructure planning, interfaces with other Programs and corporate, technical and specialist standards with a key focus on customer expectations and business outcomes with the aim to maximize ROI
  • Manage third party contributions to the Program
  • Manage both the dependencies and the interfaces between projects including developing and controlling deadlines, budgets and activities
  • Successfully embed change management concepts into implementation plans and execute the change management plans by leading change and communication activities across all aspects of the project.
  • Initiate extra activities and other management interventions wherever gaps are identified, or issues arise which may impact successful Program outcomes and resolve the program’s higher scope issues
Requirements:
  • A Bachelor’s Degree (a master's is preferred) in Computer Science, Management or an IT leadership related discipline; specific consulting subject-matter expertise
  • 5 years of Program Management experience / proven experience as a senior Program Manager or other senior management position
  • 7+ years experience successfully managing a portfolio of projects from inception to completion
  • Thorough understanding of project/program management techniques and methods; Program Management certification is preferred (MSP®, PgMP® or equivalent)
  • Project Management certification is an asset
  • Experience in the Financial Services industry is an asset
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office; working knowledge of program/project management software.
  • Understanding of Agile, Waterfall and Hybrid SDLC principles to support the delivery of complex technical solutions
  • Knowledge of LEAN methodologies and experience using LEAN tools to add increasing value
  • Working knowledge of change management practices to ensure success
  • Outstanding leadership, interpersonal, communication and organizational skills
  • Good knowledge of techniques for planning, monitoring and controlling programs
  • Good knowledge of budgeting and resource allocation procedures
  • The ability to find ways of solving or pre-empting problems
 
Due to the volume of resumes, only those candidates being considered will be contacted.

Based in Vancouver and proudly Canadian, Ignite Technical Resources has been providing Top Technical Talent to organizations across Canada since 2005.

Ignite. Wired for people.

Follow Ignite on Twitter @ignitetechnical and become a fan on Facebook for up-to-date information about our company including job postings!


About Ignite Technical Resources.:

Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Vancouver BC, Ignite Technical Resources has been the preferred IT Staffing provider for many of Canada’s largest and well-known organizations for over 15 years.By specializing in Information Technology, we ensure that our processes are focused exclusively on providing qualified IT Professionals and our commitment to speed ensures your teams and projects are staffed quickly and efficiently. Our years of experience provide us with one of the most well-developed networks of candidates in the Canadian market. Come see why Ignite Technical is one of Canada’s premier providers of IT Professionals On-Demand.Ignite Technical Resources – Your Source for Top Talent

title: Regional Service Delivery Manager
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Service Delivery Manager (Region)

Airports currently with vacancies

In BC: Terrace, Victoria, Kelowna, Abbotsford

In Yukon Territory: Whitehorse

Reporting to the Regional Manager, this position has full responsibility for screening operations within a certain area and for the delivery of all operational KPIs within the area of oversight while identifying operational strengths and weaknesses, and improving service delivery and operational efficiencies.  

In addition to checkpoint management, this position also supports the operations in areas such as recruitment and selection, payroll, scheduling, uniforms, procurement and inventory. Leading a team of Screening Officers, this position is accountable for promoting a workplace culture defined by our values: Integrity, Service Excellence and Teamwork.

Responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Actively engages in managing the screening checkpoint by monitoring queue lengths, service levels, reporting on changing needs and seeking additional staff as required
  • Builds and maintains a strong customer relationship with assigned business area
  • Achieves Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and ensures compliance with Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) on a daily basis
  • Manages Screening Officers by acting as a coach and mentor in order to create and maintain an engaged, motivated work force
  • Conducts regular performance reviews and makes recommendations for employee recognition program
  • Applies corrective measures as required following the progressive discipline process
  • Assigns staff to screening positions, monitors breaks and training hours to ensure service delivery levels are met; coordinates with other screening points to organize efficient staff deployment, accommodates language requirements.
  • Ensures proper time and attendance tracking
  • Compiles shift reports for the screening area under their management
  • Assists Screening Officers in dealing with potential complaints, security incidents, etc.
  • Conducts workplace investigations with the guidance of the HR team and senior management
  • Participates in recruitment as needed; conducts phone and in-person interviews and skills testing.
  • Performs administrative tasks that support the operation such as, but not limited to: scheduling, payroll, uniform ordering and distribution, records and file management, ordering CATSA consumables for the site, etc.
  • Other duties as assigned

Education, Experience and Skills

  • College or equivalent experience
  • Minimum two yearsâ€™ experience in a similar managerial role, preferably in the Aviation Security Industry in a unionized environment
  • Bilingualism (English & French) is an asset.
  • Knowledge of relevant security and employment legislation
  • Strong operational focus with the ability to act under pressure and provide creative solutions
  • Experience in the management of personnel in a unionized environment
  • Ability to work effectively with large employee groups and build partnerships at all levels of the organization
  • Effective time management and organization skills with the ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Ability to implement performance management / discipline with direct reports
  • Must be proficient in office software programs such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Google Suite
  • Willingness to work irregular hours / shift work / attend to incidents after hours
  • Strong communication, leadership, client service and persuasive skills
  • Places organizational success above individual gain
  • Must be able to acquire a Transport Canada Security Clearance and Federal Security Clearance
Closing:

Allied Universal ® is an inclusive and equitable employer, encouraging applications from qualified women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons.

title: Distribution Centre General Manager
description:
Now Hiring

Distribution Centre General Manager

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

With locations across Canada, Canada Cartage System is a recognized leader in transportation & logistics delivering customized solutions for the transportation, distribution and warehousing marketplace.

We are currently looking to add a full-time Distribution Centre General Manager to our Distribution Centre in Delta, British Columbia. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

We offer a competitive remuneration and benefits package, advancement opportunities and career development.

DC General Manager is responsible for leading the day-to-day activities of warehouse operations, administration, and finance, to effectively implement logistics services to customers and to ensure that all activities are accurately recorded in the company’s warehouse management system; customer service, productivity, and financial targets are being met, and contribute to the growth of the company.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Manage and mentor operations and office management and supervisors;
  • Hiring, firing, employee discipline and training;
  • Ensuring employees have the necessary tools to perform their job functions;
  • Ensuring team members are scheduled appropriately to meet customer expectations;
  • Troubleshooting and resolving day-to-day issues and activities;
  • Conducting regular formal employee reviews and informal feedback discussions for all staff within their area of responsibility;
  • Monitoring service levels to ensure customer expectations are met or exceeded;
  • Work with local Human Resources on administering disciplinary action as required;
  • Acting as primary front-line operations point person for any billing/payroll issues;
  • Supporting and enforcing the Company’s Health and Safety and Compliance policies;
  • Make recommendations to improve production methods, working conditions, and increase efficiency;
  • Act as liaison between supervisors, staff and customers;
  • Manage the Branch finances and analyze financial reports.

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • 5 years in a management role in the logistics/ warehouse operations industry;
  • Experience in a multi-client 3PL environment an asset;
  • Post-secondary or equivalent experience an asset;
  • Excellent leadership and analytical skills;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Ability to multitask;
  • Direct experience with staff scheduling in a variable work volume environment;
  • MS Office proficiency necessary;
  • Familiarity with WMS systems an asset.
  • Successfully pass a background check

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Distribution Center, Inventory Manager
description:
Company Description

Dedicated to telling stories and creating experiences, Indigo is always looking for bright, energetic and customer-focused people who can help bring our exciting mission to life in one of our more than 200 Indigo, Indigospirit, Chapters and Coles stores across Canada. We offer a variety of exciting opportunities at our retail stores, distribution centres, and home office for people who share our passions and want to be part of a dynamic and enriching culture.

WHO WE ARE

  • We love books and all things beautiful
  • We are Canada’s Cultural Department Store
  • Books are our heart and our soul and Great Books are JUST the Beginning…

We play by the following rules:

  • We exist to add joy to our customers’ lives each and every time they interact with us and our products
  • Our job is to create joyful moments for our customers
  • We treat each other the way we’d treat a valued friend
  • We inspire each other to do our best work
  • We seek to ignite creativity and innovation every day
  • We give back to the communities in which we operate
Job Description

You cultivate an environment that promotes authentic best-in-class employee and customer experiences and are guided by our culture and our mission of shipping joy and knowledge. Your role as a Team Manager is one of collaboration, innovation, inspiration, support, and coaching and in doing so, you help to create and sustain a high performing culture. You consistently role model the Indigo Beliefs and are a leader that sets examples for your team to follow.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Supports and empowers team to make decisions, creating a highly engaged and high performing team.
  • Develops a high-performing leadership team that is accountable for creating a best-in-class employee experience
  • Develops internal talent - build a bench for future Distribution Centre needs.
  • Unlocks full potential of employees by providing consistent, and on-going, feedback
  • Owns self-development and provides continuous feedback to Senior Leader(s)
  • Understand and follow Indigo’s core HR process – staffing, performance management, rewards and development
  • Establish effective working relationship with direct reports: Solicit their views on the work environment, potential changes affecting their work, continuous improvement, opportunities and provide them with opportunities to further develop their skills and knowledge
  • Promote and optimizes teamwork - clearly articulates the linkages between roles and sets the context in which they work with one another
  • Identifies individual development needs and works with Team Leader to develop a plan to address them
  • Participate in the recruitment process
  • Effectively conduct and deliver coaching and corrective action, as needed
  • Establish high performance peer relationships
  • Maintain positive relationships with Indigo employees and business partners
  • Role models Indigo’s High-Performance Characteristics
  • Promotes a culture of engagement, fulfilling our goal to enrich the lives of our employees
  • Cultivates an environment of trust where the opinions, voices, and well-being of employees are valued, enabling people to bring their best selves to work
  • Inspires a customer-centric culture bringing to life Indigo’s mission of creating joy and enriching lives, and Indigo Distribution Centre’s mission of shipping joy and knowledge
  • Fosters an environment where everyone knows their health and safety is a top priority and where everyone actively participates in ensuring the health and safety of each other
  • Responds to employee feedback in a timely manner ensuring that the employee remains a top priority
  • Drive Improvements to support Best-In-Class accuracy levels within the DC Network
  • Build Inventory strategies to improve speed to market (both Internal & External customer base)
  • Collaborate cross functionally on multiple assignments while meeting deadlines
  • Demonstrates knowledge of Six Sigma and supports 5S methodologies day to day
  • Exceptional technical competence with a proven capacity to become a subject matter expert (SME) within the given role
  • Provide Period/Quarterly/ Annual summaries on accuracy results across multiple sites
  • Gains alignment with Director on specific goals and objectives for fiscal year
  • Manage DC Support functions for Online and Retail distribution centers; Pricing, Rework, and KPI reporting
  • Ability to travel 10% (Domestic)
  • Challenges the status quo
  • Partner with Internal Auditors, ensuring full completion of Fiscal Audit process for multiple sites
  • Ensure Internal Cycle Counting process are on-time, completed annually
  • Manage 3rd party vendors where needed
Qualifications

  • Minimum 5-7 years of proven leadership, particularly within Inventory Control
  • University or College degree preferred or equivalent work experience
  • Experience and knowledge of warehouse management systems functionality and methods particularly with SAP & EWM
  • Have led high value and SKU intensive inventory operations for multi-site businesses       
  • Ideally steered inventory & quality assurance management within an Omni channel environment
  • Has proven success in continuous improvement working cross functionally with DC Operations, Finance, Logistics, Audit  
  • Demonstrates knowledge of Six Sigma and 5S methodologies
  • Professional ability to influence other leaders within a fast-paced environment
  • Strong computer skills, Microsoft Office Suite with an emphasis on Excel
  • Strong analytical, mathematical or data analysis


Additional Information

Indigo Books & Music is committed to treating all people in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We believe in integration and equal opportunity. Accommodations are available upon request for all applicants with a disability throughout the recruitment process. Please contact Human Resources if you require accommodation. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their individual accessibility needs. 

WELCOME HOME

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Reference code: 105028
Primary Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
All Available Locations: Vancouver

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills...whatever those may be.
Have many careers in one Firm.

Who we are

This isn't a place to have a simple desk job or fill a means to an end. This is the place to begin an exciting career that is built upon your energy and motivation to solve the bigger picture. At Deloitte, within the Digital Operate practice, we are the direct representation of what it means to serve with integrity. The trust from our team, clients, regulators, and the public has been fostered on the heels of our ability to adapt quickly, harbor continuous improvement, and seek out new opportunities to reinvent the future.
We are the face of the Digital practice and from the moment you join, you will be supported by a team of mentors and colleagues that will show you the ropes, provide context, tools, and guidance every step of the way. From there, YOU are the determining factor to how far you will go - the sky's the limit. The opportunities are endless when you stay hungry for the next challenge.
We are driven to inspire, driven to go to great lengths to help our people and community, and driven to understand what it means to have a client-first mentality all while knowing what it means to stand in the end user's shoes. We seek those that are never going to let their light dim, those that will continuously push themselves to solve the toughest of problems, those that are willing to push the boundaries and those that can quickly adapt to constantly changing requirements. We believe that if you're willing to learn, continue to push back against the odds, and maintain the right work ethic, we will be there every step of the way to lift you up and ensure you succeed.

About the team

Deloitte Digital's vision is simple. We empower our clients to re-imagine how they connect and engage with their customers. Our aim is to be a global leader in driving digital transformation using digital platforms. By redefining the customer's digital journey, clients can look forward to stronger brand loyalty, a better customer relationship, and a sales process so personal it feels effortless.
The Operate team within the Digital practice is the enabler for organizations to optimize their business performance and profitability all while implementing transformations that engage and activate customers through the customer journey. We help our clients solve complex business problems, improve performance, enhance shareholder value, drive sustainable growth, and create a competitive advantage.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

As a Service Delivery Manager, you are primarily responsible for production environments after go-live. This can include incident management, enhancements, and new phases of a project. You will be working with diverse teams, both onshore and offshore. Your responsibilities include the following:

Engagement Delivery

• Manage a team of skilled resources supporting client applications, ensuring adherence to service level agreements and key performance indicators. This can include applications requiring 24/7 support.
• Cultivate strong professional relationships with your clients, ensuring their needs are being met, and that we are delivering exceptional value.
• Help our clients to think outside the box, grow their business.
• Responsible for managing the finances for each engagement, building a business case if additional funds are required.
• Regular touchpoints with the client, including senior leadership. This will include performance reporting.

Business Development
• You will help to grow your accounts and participate in the pursuit and proposals of new business.

Practice Development
• Help manage and grow the Operate practice through recruiting, developing new offerings, refining methods and tools used by the team.

You are someone with:
• Extensive client service experience. You understand what it means to be a customer whose application is not working as it should.
• Minimum 3 to 5 years of project experience or experience supporting a production environment. Ability to work on multiple engagements simultaneously.
• Working with cross-functional, multidisciplinary teams, and ability to work in a fast-paced and changing environment.
• Demonstrated ability to take initiative, interact and communicate effectively with senior management.
• Strong presentation skills, including preparing presentation materials.
• Advanced knowledge of different support models and processes including incident management, problem management, release management and change management.
• Experience with ERP/CRM/cloud-based technologies and integrations.
• Strong organizational and follow through skills.
• Available to be on call and occasionally work outside of regular business hours, if needed.
• Advanced Excel skills, able to manage a budget.
• Experience with hiring, building a team.
• Bachelor`s degree or equivalent.
• Ability to travel. This position is mostly remote, but meetings in the office or travel could be required on occasion.

• You might also have:
• Proficiency in multiple languages (English/French).
• Experience working with Agile methodology, Jira, Confluence, Ticketing tools.
• Understanding of ITIL support processes.
• Knowledge of Salesforce Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.
• Consulting experience.

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Service Manager, Developer, Consulting, Equity, Manager, Customer Service, Technology, Finance, Management

Apply now "

title: Shipping and Receiving Manager
description:
Shipping and Receiving Manager – Amico Group of companies

We offer many opportunities for advancement within the Amico Group of Companies, along with a comprehensive benefit package, employer paid vacation, management approved tuition reimbursement and an employee referral program. Our growing team at Amico Group of Companies is looking for a Shipping and Receiving Manager.

The successful candidate will be energetic, eager, driven, and able to deal with competing demands and timelines.

Responsibilities Include:
  • Effectively lead a team of shipping and receiving employees
  • Determine best method of shipment and prepare shipping documents.
  • Source new shipping companies, negotiate pricing and delivery times.
  • Continuous improvement of packing methods to ensure product arrives to destination without damage.
  • Assemble crates, pack goods to be shipped, and prepare identifying information and shipping instructions.
  • Oversee loading and unloading of goods from trucks, etc.
  • Inspect and verify incoming goods against invoices or other documents, record shortages and reject damaged goods.
  • Unpack and route goods to appropriate storage areas.
  • Maintain internal record-keeping systems.
  • Operate forklift or other equipment to load, unload, transport and store goods.

Qualifications:
  • Educational background in supply chain management or operations management studies.
  • At least 5 years of Management experience
  • At least 3-5 years of experience in Shipping and Receiving is must
  • Must possess excellent communication skills and be self-motivated.
  • Proficient in computer and MS Office products (Excel, Word, Outlook).
  • Ability to multitask, able to work well under pressure to meet tight deadlines.
  • Proficient computer and math skills and ability to learn new software.

Work Environment: Production (Warehouse environment)

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

For more information, please visit us atwww.amico.com

*We respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from agencies.

*Please note that potential candidates may be requested to provide 3 references

*Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Manager, Delivery Team - (Job Number: 43559)
description:
Description43559
Qualifications

Working as an agent for Council, ELT and the Branch Manager, the Manager, Delivery Team contributes to the City’s Vision by performing a dual faceted role. First, as a member of the Branch, extended leadership team and operating within a collective leadership accountability, this role is focused on creating the conditions for success of the strategy, priorities and direction of the unit.


Second, the Manager is responsible for working with the Department, its stakeholders, and the Enterprise Commons Centre of Excellence to optimize business processes and deliver the appropriate enterprise-wide Finance (FIN) technology solutions/systems founded on industry leading practices.


Working in an integrated business model, the Manager is accountable for the seamless implementation, integration, innovation/enhancement and opportunity assessment of best in class enterprise system solutions in support of the City’s corporate processes.


This position will provide leadership to a team of professional staff and technical resources in the delivery of activities associated with implementing new systems, identifying requirements, recommending alternative solutions (customizations), planning resource needs, testing, implementing the most appropriate solutions to ensure the system operates within the City's requirements and managing large scale change.


Your success will be measured by your ability to achieve timely results in the context of a respectful, inclusive and service-minded style. With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to be Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:

  • Manage the Finance technology lifecycle with a commitment to continuous improvement for customer service while maintaining operational excellence with the goal of “SAP First” for all technology recommendations
  • Collaborate within the EC Centre of Excellence and with Open City and Technology teams to manage activities related to Finance systems and processes
  • Regularly liaise with Product/Process/Data Owners and/or Project Sponsors, key stakeholders and the Enterprise Commons Virtual Centre of Excellence Lead to report on system performance, project statuses, issues and risks, and impacts of upcoming changes as required
  • Monitor and make decisions on project/enhancement scope, budget, time lines, resourcing within predefined thresholds
  • Responsible for preparing detailed project charters, business cases, reporting, budget material, briefing notes and administration materials that define/recommend direction; identify issues, minimize business risks and allow for successful implementation of new projects or enhancement to the functional area applications within the City’s enterprise system
  • Ensure all project phases are thoroughly completed and documented; including requirements gathering, system fit-gap, system and process design, development of specifications, system testing, user training, organization change management and go-live activities
  • Ensure alignment to corporate project management best practices and lead, coach, mentor, and develop project SMEs and teams in agile project management best practices
  • Oversee the design of processes and implement solutions that are in compliance with Legislative Requirements, Collective Agreements, City of Edmonton directives, policies and procedures
  • Actively lead and supervise a diverse team, establishing and exemplifying the desired culture in support of the City’s vision and goals and cultural commitments
  • Provide direction and recommendations related to continuous improvements in the use of technologies related to the assigned functional business areas, and ensure recommendations align with Council and Corporate strategies
  • Review, evaluate and recommend new technologies for improvement to the branch's services, keeping in mind the “SAP First” principle
  • Participate in the planning, design, specification, procurement and implementation for all Finance related technology
  • Perform other duties as required

title: Service Delivery Manager (Vancouver, British Columbia, C)

Primary Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada 
All Available Locations: Vancouver

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Assistant Receiving Manager
description:
We are looking for an Assistant Receiving Manager.

Overview:
This individual will be responsible for managing and handling incoming shipments with a special focus on quality control. They will work closely with Purchasing Department and lead the receiving team to inspect all goods received and complete tasks in a timely manner. They will accomplish effective logistical oversight through strong leadership and high attention to detail. This individual must be an effective communicator and must work well with others.

This is a fast-paced role that requires someone who will act decisively and collaboratively to resolve issues that arise. The perfect candidate will be extremely flexible and enjoys a collaborative workplace. Candidates who are personable, possess a strong work ethic, and have a positive attitude will be at the top of our list.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Oversee all aspects of receiving, ensure all documentation for incoming and outgoing goods are complete
  • Ensure all products are verified inspected against purchase orders and ensure all discrepancies have been reported
  • Manage efficient receipt of all import containers and LTL deliveries per shift as well as a small parcel
  • Prepare all paperwork for shipments, BOL's, shipping manifests, shipping permits, etc.
  • Develop and implement inventory control and lot control procedures that conform to regulations
  • Train employees on safety standards and ensure employees comply with Occupational Health and Safety policies and procedures.
  • Communicate all delays or variances in inbound/outbound freight to the appropriate parties
Qualifications & Skill Requirements:
  • Direct working knowledge of operations, warehouse management, and transportation management
  • Excellent communication skills – must read and write English well
  • Great attention to detail
  • Able to work well in a fast-paced team environment
  • Must be physically fit and able to lift 50lbs
  • Forklift Operator Certified
  • First Aid Certification is an asset
  • Strong knowledge of ERP systems (SAP or similar) and WMS (Produmex or similar).
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office; Excel, Word, Outlook/Teams
  • Exceptional problem solver with excellent attention to detail
  • Minimum of 5 years of relevant warehouse or supply chain experience required
  • Minimum of 2 years of management experience required
To be considered, please submit with your cover letter and resume.

title: Distribution Associate Manager
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Job Summary
This position analyzes and plans for operational success and customer satisfaction in a warehouse or station. He/She monitors volume for respective clients and ensures client contractual compliance. This position develops operational goals and plans, monitors, and communicates performance against plan, reviews margins, acts as liaison with customers, sets priorities, and coordinates with various functions to improve efficiency. He/She manages supervisors and hourly employees and reviews contract guidelines to establish inventory control standards and procedures for performance measurement. This position develops operational plans to define and communicate new operating processes and compliance standards (e.g., returns, shipments, receipts, etc.) and evaluates quality goals to develop process improvements and increase quality levels.

Responsibilities:

  • Performs and reviews monthly financial reporting to analyze client profitability.
  • Manages expense margins to achieve revenue goals.
  • Ensures delivery of timely and accurate invoices to optimize management of customer accounts receivable.
  • Delegates and prioritizes workloads to employees to ensure customer deadlines and contractual requirements are met.
  • Acts as customer liaison and provides support for new opportunities and account implementation, problem resolution, and quality control.
  • Participates in reviews and revisions of statements of work to accommodate changing customer needs and manages implementation of corrective action plans to address deficient performance areas and improve productivity.
  • Conducts performance evaluations in a consistent, fair, and objective manner and encourages continuous performance improvement.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or International equivalent
  • Basic knowledge of Finance and Accounting theory and principles
  • Detailed understanding of supply chain concepts

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
A hands-on leader that oversees and coordinates the daily warehousing, logistics and facilities activities required to meet the ongoing and varied needs of Clarion’s Customers. A key member of the cross functional operations team with a primary focus to coach, mentor and measure a high performing and efficient warehouse team. In addition, the Warehouse Manager must ensure that inbound shipments and returns are received and processed according to SOPs, including the appropriate Quarantine practices, as required.


The successful applicant will:
• Supervise the shipping and receiving of goods with Clarion’s head office, ensuring that SOPs and Quarantine Practices are followed
• Ensures method of shipment determined by Shipper/Receiver personnel is done according to the product and GMP, and established timelines required to meet customer needs & expectations
• Resolves discrepancies between bills of lading and material received with carriers and advises Regulatory Affairs Office/Quality Control of any discrepancies that may impact GMP practices
• Assists in the creation and implementation of related policies and procedures, as well as shipping and receiving schedules
• Perform inventory adjustments to account for inventory created/manufactured in the Service Lab
• Provides back up support for Transfer Order Costing and approvals
• Provide leadership and guidance for Clarion’s Distribution Centre as per Clarion’s GMP Practices:
• Manage the storage, handling, organization and shipping operations to adequately serve the company's warehouses, staff, and customers
• Coordinates the planning, administration and operations of the warehouse and ensures needs of customers are being met
• Responsible for delivering clear and concise training through documentation and hands on training to ensure the team delivers quality results and ensures team receives applicable GMP training from the Regulatory Affairs Officer
• Develops, implements & tracks key performance indicators for the Warehouse team. Coaches staff when performance does not meet expectations & requirements. Uses this information to better manage the activities and team performance in the warehouse
• Provide back up support for Operation Manager when required


We are seeking a candidate with the following attributes:

• 5-10 years of supervisory experience in warehouse and logistics roles
• 2+ years’ experience ERP systems and proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word, Power Point, Access
• Secondary School diploma and preferably post-secondary education in a business administration field
• Facilities coordinator experience, with understanding of technical requirements needed for maintaining a building/warehouse
• Demonstrated track record of success in warehousing and logistics
• Ability to multi-task within a busy environment
• Excellent at building working relationships, strong listening skills, good organization and time management skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication; ability to speak clearly and concisely, conveying complex or technical information in a manner that others can understand
• Strong interpersonal skills, establishing rapport and developing high performing teams
• Attention to detail is a key attribute, with strong analytical and organization skills
• A creative solution provider, focused on team development, operational efficiencies & delivering required quality

title: Service Delivery Manager - Saint John, NB, Canada
description:
Service Delivery Manager - Saint John, NB, Canada


General information


City: Saint John


State/Province: New Brunswick


Country: Canada


Department: Service Delivery


Date: Friday, April 22, 2022


Working time: Full-time


Ref#: 20016446


Job Level: Individual Contributor


Job Type: Experienced


Job Field: Service Delivery


Seniority Level: Associate


Description & Requirements


About Xerox Holdings Corporation


For more than 100 years, Xerox has continually redefined the workplace experience. Harnessing our leadership position in office and production print technology, we’ve expanded into software and services to sustainably power today’s workforce. From the office to industrial environments, our differentiated business solutions and financial services are designed to make every day work better for clients — no matter where that work is being done. Today, Xerox scientists and engineers are continuing our legacy of innovation with disruptive technologies in digital transformation, augmented reality, robotic process automation, additive manufacturing, Industrial Internet of Things and cleantech. Learn more at www.xerox.com and explore our commitment to diversity and inclusion. (https://www.xerox.com/en-us/jobs/diversity)


Purpose:


Responsible for the management of client relationships and contract delivery of outsourcing/facilities management to end-user customers. Activities involve maintaining contracted service levels resulting in customer satisfaction, maintaining customer relationships, customer satisfaction management, contract commitments delivered within cost targets, overall profit, and revenue growth.


The purpose will vary according to the type of role:


· SBU - Oversees and manages the operations of a business unit(s) with overall responsibility for the account (i.e., service delivery, sales, operations, IT, HR, facilities).


· Operations - Plans, manages, and controls the day-to-day activities of a team that provides operational support for a business unit or group in a non-manufacturing environment.


· Account Management - Partners with client(s) to provide product/service solutions, problem resolution and to develop new business


General:


· Adapts departmental plans and priorities to address resource and operational challenges


· Requires in-depth knowledge and experience


· Decisions are guided by policies, procedures, and business plan; receives guidance from manager


· Generally domestic accountability


Primary Responsibilities:


( The main responsibilities will vary according to the type of role)


SBU:


· Acts as the principal client contact, managing the relationship to ensure customer satisfaction


· Directs and manages the daily operations of one or more SBU’s


· Has profit and loss responsibility and overall control of planning, staffing, budgeting, managing expense priorities, and recommending and implementing changes to methods for the business unit.


· Develops budget estimates and manages project/contract to meet revenue and cost projections


· Determines resource allocation levels to meet project/contract commitments


· Reviews and resolves issues affecting Company compliance, legal requirements, and client objectives


Operations:


· Establishes operational objectives and work plans, and delegates assignments to subordinate managers


· Develops systems and services that support Xerox Services and business unit needs; provides leadership and focus in the area of expertise


· Responsible for achieving measurable results on time and on budget


· Develop and subsequently implement new projects, policies, and procedures for the department(s) to meet specific goals


· Formulates and implements procedures on operational processes; ensures operations' effective achievement of objectives


· Prepares related reports and audits current procedures to monitor the efficiency of operations


· Ensures that business practices are performed in accordance with Xerox Services policy, procedure, and applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations


Account Management:


· Oversees and manages aspects of the client engagement, i.e., the sales/marketing efforts for new business development


· Partners with client’s team during budget development and problem resolution


· Maintains and enhances existing client relationships and ensures customer satisfaction


· Analyzes client’s needs and makes recommendations of additional product/services offered by Xerox Services


· Partners with senior staff in developing and marketing new client programs/services as required


· Analyzes workflow and assignments to ensure efficient and cost-effective operations; develops/implements process and service improvements as needed


· Provides regular updates to senior management regarding client issues, budgets, etc.


_Xerox is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity or expression, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law. Learn more at_ _www.xerox.com_ _and explore our_ commitment to diversity and inclusion! (https://www.xerox.com/en-us/jobs/diversity) _People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with Xerox may request such accommodation(s) by sending an e-mail to XeroxStaffingAdminCenter@xerox.com. Be sure to include your name, the job you are interested in, and the accommodation you are seeking._


_© 2020 Xerox Corporation. All rights reserved. Xerox® and Xerox and Design® are trademarks of Xerox Corporation in the United States and/or other countries._

title: Distribution Manager
description:
Distribution Manager                                        

Full-time, Permanent position

$42.00-$45.00/hour

Monday to Friday 9:00am – 5:00pm

Unit 4, 279 Kenilworth Avenue North, Hamilton, ON L8H 4S8

https://dingdongfresh.com/

416-300-8188

dingdongfresh.career@gmail.com

 

About Us:

Founded in 2015, Voilafresh Ltd. is a comprehensive fresh food shopping trading company serving Ontario and is one of the fastest growing fresh food shopping e-commerce platforms in the province. Voilafresh sources popular products from North America, South America, China, Japan, South Korea, etc. and is committed to providing customers with a convenient and quality experience with our 24-hour delivery service.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Establish goals & objectives for the department and is responsible to ensure that Key Performance Indicators are meet or exceeded.
  • Oversee all aspects of supply chain management from order creation, overseeing finished logistics and customs liaison, through warehousing, to final fulfilment, across multiple sales channels and geographies.
  • Develop and implement policies and best-practice procedures to ensure quick and reliable deliveries to our customers.
  • Continually analyze fulfilment and distribution network for improved efficiencies.
  • Manage labour scheduling, control and reduce logistics and distribution costs while maintaining efficiency and delivery commitments.
  • Encourage team to focus on continuous improvement and empower team to identify optimal operations solutions and build collocative partnership with local and overseas partners.
  • Respond to client inquiries, handle complaints and participate in client meetings to review KPI’s and to address service issues.
  • Provide training, direction, support, feedback, development and performance management to the team.

 

Qualification:

  • University degree or equivalent in Business Administration, Logistic, or related fields.
  • 5+ years' experience in managerial role working in warehouse or distribution.
  • Strong understanding of inventory metrics; knowledge of logistic of fresh food products an asset.
  • Flexible and adaptable with schedule which includes nights and working required holidays and weekends.
  • Understand customer service and strive to improve delivery reliability and customer experience.
  • Experience in forecasting, budgeting, planning and cost control.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
  • Ability to work in a dynamic and high-volume environment.
  • Ability to build consensus and relationships among managers, partners, and employees.
  • Travel to warehouse at Mississauga and visit business partners when required.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Job Description:

 

Do you want to work for a stable, growing organization that reaches back more than 130 years?   Our steel tube and pipe products have helped build landmarks and buildings in North America; Come build your career at Zekelman Industries.

 

Z-Modular, a division of Zekelman Industries, seeks an Warehouse Manager (Framing) for our location in Kitchener, ON. Reporting to the Plant Manager. This position will supervise the shift production crew and coordinate with multiple departments to ensure production

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collaborate with other functional departments to ensure that production and quality standards are achieved
  • Provide technical expertise and training to all areas of the department
  • Perform activities related to training, troubleshooting or absentee coverage
  • Maintains receiving, warehousing, and distribution operations by initiating, coordinating, and enforcing program, operational, and personnel policies and procedures.
  • Complies with federal, state, and local warehousing, material handling, and shipping requirements by studying existing & new legislation; enforcing adherence to requirements; advising management on needed actions.
  • Controls inventory levels by conducting physical counts; reconciling with data storage system.
  • Maintains physical condition of warehouse by planning & implementing new design layouts; inspecting equipment; issuing work orders for repair & requisitions for replacement.
  • Completes warehouse operational requirements by scheduling & assigning employees; following up on work results. Provide technical expertise and training to all areas
  • Work safely following established workplace safety practices
  • Review daily operating reports and report operational, manufacturing, and maintenance issues and shift events to leads to prevent operational delays
  • Troubleshoot operational problems to improve quality and efficiency
  • Build and maintain a positive team-oriented environment amongst production personnel
  • Evaluate employee performance objectively based upon the job requirements and behavioral indicators of performance
  • Identify areas of improvement in staff and provide corrective action to personnel in coordination with plant management and Human Resources
  • Obtain immediate medical treatment for all injuries
  • Notify appropriate management and enter required events (accidents, injuries, incidents) into Intelex in real time
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Follow Master Production Schedule and ensure the objectives of this schedule are met

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • University degree, Technical Diploma or equivalent experience in manufacturing and/or construction industries required
  • At least 5 years of experience in a manufacturing or construction facility
  • Ability to demonstrate thorough understanding of manufacturing and construction processes. Detailed knowledge of the relationship between work centers and how variables at each work center affect other areas.
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft office package including Outlook, Word, and Excel
  • Experience in Shop Floor interfaces such as MES as well as ERP usage such as SAP, D365 or Oracle based platforms
  • Proven leadership skills
  • Top-notch communications skills, both verbal and written

  • Regular, full-time, predictable onsite attendance per the posted schedule is an essential function of this role

  • Lead and promote health and safety work practices as required by regulatory agencies and company policy

 

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bend, twist, stoop, sit, kneel, crawl, push and pull. Able to reach in all directions
  • Walk and stand for extended periods of time
  • Other physical requirements as needed for job
  • Legally eligible to work in the Canada

 

Zekelman Industries offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including high quality medical, dental and vision benefits. In addition, we have an amazing tuition assistance program, and an RRSP with a generous company match.

 

Zekelman is an Equal Opportunity Employer compliant with all Ontario law & Human Rights Code in providing accommodation to persons with disabilities and to ensuring an accessible environment. Zekelman will accommodate persons with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and persons with disabilities will be accommodated on hiring and during employment.

Should you require accommodation, please do not hesitate to request it.

 

We are Zekelman Industries.

 

We manufacture superior quality tubular and related products and provide outstanding service for our valued customers.

 

We seek to continuously advance the skills and opportunities of our employees, utilizing the latest technology and management tools available to consistently increase profitability and the enterprise value of Zekelman Industries and of our customers.

title: Warehouse Manager 105
description:
Company Description

Be part of a community of authentic, proud and trusted people

At UAP, we believe we don’t just deliver car and heavy vehicle parts all around the country; we also help keep Canadians moving forward. This makes for a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.

We are announcing this new & exciting career opportunity of the Branch Manager responsible for the operations of the USG/NAPA Auto Parts Warehouse & AAG Branch consolidated Business Unit in Kingston, Ontario.

Reporting directly to the General Manager, USG with a dotted line report to the Regional Operations Manager, AAG, the Branch Manager will be responsible for the business operations, business development, and human capital by actively engaging and developing their Team Members; and motivating and coaching their Supervisory team in order to achieve the targets and objectives set for the Warehouse and the Branch.  They will ensure effective communication with all  Team Members in the Warehouse and the Branch, as well as with suppliers, and USG/NAPA & AAG Customers.

 

Job Description

As a Warehouse Manager, your responsibilities include: 

  • An effective and motivated communicator, you will manage the activities of warehouse & branch staff while maintaining transparency with our suppliers & customers;
  • A health & safety ambassador and champion, you will drive a proactive and prevention geared health & safety program while ensuring early and safe return to work, proper accident reporting, and accident investigation processes;
  • With workplace cleanliness and organization in mind, you will ensure the highest standard of maintenance and housekeeping of the warehouse and branch during its day-to-day operations;
  • You will be responsible for facilitating regular staff meetings and transparent communication between branch staff and the USG/NAPA & &AAG business leadership
  • You will be a key member of the USG & AAG management team, performing all administrative duties that ensure the Business Unit is run in an efficient, cost-effective, and profitable manner as per UAP Inc. policies and procedures
  • You will manage the total movement, both inbound and outbound, of products in the warehouse and the branch;
  • You will engage in activities that facilitate the continual growth of branch sales including developing and executing sales building ideas while maintaining gross profit % guidelines.  Attending customer meetings/training sessions on occasion to foster business.
  • You will ensure internal & external audit compliance, including maintenance and protection of the Business Unit’s physical assets and reporting of any violations
  • You will organize and conduct annual physical inventories as scheduled by senior management 
  • You will conduct monthly cycle counts of inventory of lines on a pre-scheduled basis
  • You will organize monthly meetings with sales teams, key Team Members, and USG/NAPA and AAG leaders to meet Customer expectations and surpass goals ​​​​​​

 

 

Qualifications

To join our team, you need: 

  • You will have superb coaching & mentorship skills
  • Your skillset will include supplier & customer relations, but most importantly Team Member experience knowledge that will assist in building & retaining a strong team of professionals
  • Strong Health & Safety; Housekeeping/5S; and Human Resources Team Member relations knowledge
  • Five (5) years of successful warehouse/distribution and wholesale operations experience
  • Solid knowledge of all MS Office applications as well as new warehouse management technologies
  • Strong leadership skills with robust verbal & written communication skills
  • Ability to manage, motivate, and drive for results!
  • Courageous and proactive problem solving, decision-making skills & focus on organization
  • Team building, relationships development, mentoring and coaching emerging leaders, and drive for success!

 

 



Additional Information

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Nutraways Enterprises

Warehouse Manager
Burnaby, British Columbia• Full-time

About the Job
Vitasave.ca is looking to hire a motivated, hardworking and experienced Warehouse manager to join our diverse, hard-working team. You have exceptional communication skills and enjoy working in a dynamic environment.

If you are a highly organized and resourceful self-starter who can confidently manage multiple duties and deadlines, goal-oriented and has a hand-on leadership style. This role is for you.

Who we are:
Vitasave is a 100% Canadian owned and operated natural health E-Commerce company headquartered in beautiful Vancouver BC, with a retail store in North Vancouver and a flagship store downtown, as well as warehouses in Vancouver and Toronto.

Vitasave carries something for everyone, with 7500 natural health products across more than 250 brands, including vitamins, supplements, food, pet care and lifestyle products. Founded in 2013 by three brothers Ali, Amir and Adam Assadkhan, Vitasave has quickly become the industry leader in Canadian natural health. At Vitasave, we’re proud to represent a group of thoughtful, diverse, and passionate individuals committed to personal development.


Responsibilities:
  • Maintains receiving, warehousing and distribution operations by initiating, coordinating, and enforcing programs, operational, and personnel policies and procedures.
  • Completes warehouse operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees-following up on work results and employee appraisals.
  • Maintain statistical information of warehouse employees, inventory control, equipment, operational schedules and service levels to monitor performance.
  • Leadership, Morale, Relationships and Communications act as a Leader in order to achieve Vitasave’s Goals and Objectives.
  • Maintaining documentation and keeping accurate records of warehouse activities.
  • Leading the team in achieving daily KPIs through tracking productivity results against the actual targets. Provide the necessary coaching /training to assist employees in achieving the daily targets.
  • Providing monthly efficiency reports to the General manager and HR.
Job Duties:
  • Strategically manage the warehouse in compliance with the company's policies and vision.
  • Ensuring all products are properly packaged, labeled and presentable for customers.
  • Maintain standards of health and safety, hygiene and security.
  • Cross train employees in various functions to improve labor costs and efficiencies.
  • Coordinate the activities of all warehouse associates.
  • Oversee the receiving and shipping of goods.
  • Ensure that all items are properly stored in an efficient and orderly manner
  • Ensure all orders from before 2PM are shipped out the same day, and that all deliveries from before 2PM are fully received and restocked the same day.
  • Maintain Vitasave’s level of warehouse cleanliness
  • Assist Warehouse Workers with their tasks when necessary
  • Comply with warehouse safety standards- practices OHS policy
  • Training new hires up to Vitasave standard
  • Maintaining staff success by monitoring and measuring performance
  • Utilizing Vitasave’s 25 Beliefs daily
  • Monitor and maintain ratio
  • Scheduling warehouse employees
  • Ensure that all warehouse procedures are rigorously followed
  • Effective communication with team members
  • Constantly striving to innovate job role
  • Acts as a coach to their team playing a hands-on role in their development. They do this by actively developing their team through vision and goals, coaching and feedback.
Warehouse Manager Skills:
  • Acts as a coach to their team playing a hands-on role in their development. They do this by actively developing their team through vision and goals, coaching and feedback.
  • Minimum Four years of leadership skills and ability to manage staff.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong decision making and problem solving skills
  • Safety Management
  • Developing Standards
  • Managing Processes
  • Surveillance Skills
  • Inventory Control
  • Reporting Skills
  • Judgment
  • Communication
  • Time management
  • Multitasking
Warehouse Manager Job Qualifications:
  • 3-5 years of experience working in a warehouse
  • 4 years previous leadership experience
  • Supply Chain Management Diploma/ Bachelors a plus
  • Logistics
  • Preferably first aid
What We Offer You:
Full-time:
  • Team dinners - One information session a month with industries top brands, consisting of complementary food at a restaurant of our choosing and a product knowledge seminar showcasing new and trending supplements.
  • Staff discounts - Discounts at both our retail store and HQ to make sure that you too can keep on top of your health.
  • Exclusive entrance to trade shows - CHFA, VegeExpo & The Wellness Show.
  • Mentor-ship and opportunity for growth.
  • Benefits after 3 months of work
You will also be responsible for ensuring that employees feel comfortable and safe reporting incidents, hazards, risks and opportunities. You will take every reasonable precaution to ensure the workplace is safe. You will meet the core competencies of the job as outlined in the job description.

About Nutraways Enterprises
Vitasave.ca is one of Canada’s fastest growing ecommerce companies in the natural health product industry. Our mission is to make health accessible and affordable for everyone. 









    About Nutraways Enterprises:

    Vitasave.ca is one of Canada’s fastest growing ecommerce companies in the natural health product industry. Our mission is to make health accessible and affordable for everyone.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
itec group Inc. is currently recruiting for a Warehouse Manager. The successful incumbent will be tasked to ensure the logistical processes and equipment are efficiently maintained. This is a great opportunity for growth and development, which places emphasis on improving technical and practical skills to prepare for future opportunities. At itec group, we provide candidates with a seamless experience to transition into suitable roles as professionals in their desired fields.

Key Qualifications include but are not limited to:
  • Education or experience in warehouse management
  • At least 5 years of experience in supply chain management
  • Experience with Excel, continuous improvement strategies, and logistics
  • Strong leadership, communication conflict resolution, and analytical skills

Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Maintain objectives, budgets, inventory, material flow, schedules, resources, and employees of the assigned business department
  • Optimize and adapt to consumer needs and demands by improving technology and providing training and reviews for employees
  • Maintain communication with clients on updates and process changes
  • Ensure processes adhere to quality and regulatory requirements and lean manufacturing

If you are interested in learning more about the Warehouse Manager opportunity and meet the required qualifications, please submit your updated resume directly to craig@itecgroup.ca.

We are recruitment industry leaders committed to quality service, integrity, respect and equal opportunity. Accommodation is available to all applicants upon request throughout our recruitment process. Please contact us at admin@itecgroup.ca or 1-877-682-8889 x223 if you
require accommodation. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their accessibility needs. By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related
to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients.

Should you wish to stop receiving electronic communications at any time, simply let us know at unsubscribe@itecgroup.ca

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
We are seeking a warehouse manager who can help our company manage all aspects of a warehouse operation for fulfillment. This is an important role that requires you to take charge of everything warehousing related. We are looking for a hard-working individual for long-term employment to grow with the company.

The ideal candidate has a combination of leadership skills, product knowledge, industry savvy and prior experience overseeing the daily workflow, budget, and schedules of the warehouse department.

Responsibilities: 

 

  • Manage product inventory levels to ensure adequate product supply with minimal spoilage
  • Manage warehouse associates and order pickers to ensure compliance with procedures, work accuracy and proper completion of tasks
  • Develop and implement warehouse best practices and processes
  • Maintain and organize warehouse inventory with first-in first-out rotation
  • Setup and use warehousing systems to ensure warehouse is functioning in optimal state and in accordance with proper system usage and processes
  • Regularly review system metrics and reporting to determine if standards are being met or implement corrective action if necessary
  • Place orders, coordinate and liaise with suppliers
  • Ensure warehouse inventory numbers are kept accurate
  • Develop and maintain warehouse policies and KPI. Create purchase orders and requisitions as needed for all supplies. Establish guidelines for purchasing and contract management.
  • Any other warehouse tasks as necessary

 

Requirements: 

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering is preferred with three years of proven work experience
  • Previous experience leading a team, managing a budget and negotiating bids and contracts
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills and strong attention to detail
  • Solid ability to meet all deadlines in an organized and timely manner

 

About Us:

Adaria Vending Services is a Vaughan based company specializing in logistics and fulfillment services for vending machines. Our clients range from offices to manufacturing plants to public areas - pretty much anywhere you'll ever find a vending machine. We're a young, dynamic team dedicated to providing industry leading fulfillment to vending machines and clients located in southern Ontario. 

 

Why work for us?:

  • Growth and advancement opportunities. We are the fastest growing company in our industry and we are always looking for hardworking employees to join our management/supervisor team.
  • Comprehensive health and benefit package (dental, vision, disability, drugs, paramedical, etc)
  • Fun, friendly, and dynamic team. (Team events and BBQ)
  • We are the market leader and innovator of technology within our industry
  • Opportunities to execute your own ideas and improvement
