title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Warehouse Manager (Branch Operations Lead).

Stallion express is growing and we are urgently hiring! Limited signing bonus of $3,000 (terms apply). Come grow your career with us!

We are looking for a dedicated Warehouse Operations Branch Manager to oversee our very first Montreal branch!

Location: Montreal, QC
Salary Range: $45,000 - $50,000
Work Hours: 11am - 7pm Monday to Friday or 12pm-8pm and possibly 12pm-4pm on Sundays as needed (Sundays are paid extra)

About Us:
  • Stallion Express is a Toronto-based company specializing in shipping and logistics solutions for online sellers.
  • Our clients range from part-time eBay sellers to bigger eCommerce web stores, shipping hundreds of packages per day!
  • We’re a dynamic team working towards a common vision: To help Canadian sellers ship parcels at the lowest possible rates. 10,000+ businesses in Canada have saved $5,000,000 in shipping costs for over 6 million parcels with Stallion Express.
  • Customer service is top priority for us, which directly reflects in our consistent 4.8-star rating on Google!

Learn more about us here: https://stallionexpress.ca

Why work for us? What’s in it for you?
  • Be a part of a growing industry and a team that dedicates itself to being the best in the game!
  • Flexible health benefits after 3-month probation.
  • Bi-annual salary reviews.
  • Fun, friendly, and challenging work environment.
  • No dress-code!
  • Healthy office snacks, coffee, and tea.
  • Always work with up-to-date technology.
  • Opportunities to execute your own creative ideas without being micromanaged!
  • Opportunities for growth and to make a visible impact!
  • Grow your career with us!

Who are we looking for?
As a Warehouse Operations Branch Lead, you will be responsible for all day-to-day operations of the Montreal branch. You will need to have a strong operations background (a background in logistics or eCommerce is a huge asset) with experience in leading successful teams. You will also be the point of contact to some of our larger Montreal enterprise clients to ensure that their accounts are being looked after. Overall, you are someone who makes sound decisions, is extremely independent, reliable, client-focused, and values the importance of great culture in team building.

Responsibilities:
  • This position will report directly to the Head of Operations of Stallion Express.
  • This role will also work very closely with our customer service team and account executives.
  • Ensure day-to-day operations adhere to all of Stallion's processes and protocols (some tasks include, but not limited to: shipping and receiving, sorting, scanning, processing, organizing, loading/unloading, providing customer service to walk in clients).
  • Communicate with key individuals within the organization to ensure smooth operations and clients are happy (via phone, email, and internal communication tools).
  • Oversee some of our enterprise accounts to ensure our clients are taken care of.
  • Provide coaching and valuable feedback to direct reports (warehouse team members, drivers, etc).
  • Set an example to the team by providing excellent customer service to Stallion's standards.
  • Ensure the team is adhering to all safety requirements.
  • Perform some administrative duties such as border documentation.
  • Promotes Stallion's culture and values within the team.

Training:
The CEO of Stallion Express is currently in Montreal and will train you until both parties feel you are able to run the show on your own!

Requirements:
  • 1-2 years of experience in an Operations Leadership role of a branch or facility (Logistics experience preferred). This is great to have but not mandatory, we can train the right person!
  • Valid G License and ability to enter the USA if needed.
  • Must be available to work 11 am-7 pm Monday to Fridays and 12 pm-3 pm on Sundays as needed.
  • Willing to accept full responsibility and accountability of all branch operations.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build trusting and supportive relationships with team members.
  • Must be trustworthy and reliable (it's you running the show!).
  • Able to stand for long periods of time and be physically fit to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Can multitask in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
  • Decisive, assertive, and strong communication skills.
  • Excellent computer skills.
  • Must be proactive and be comfortable helping out in all aspects of the operations when necessary.

Job Type: Full-time.

Salary: $45,000.00-$50,000.00 per year.

title: Senior Delivery Manager - EUS/SIAM- Toronto, Canada
description:
About Capgemini


Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion.


About Infrastructure Services:


The Cloud Infrastructure Services Global Business Line is Capgemini's consulting and infrastructure build-and-run provisioning offering and supports the group's cloud-based services. As part of the integrated cloud offering from Capgemini, Cloud Infrastructure Services delivers a broad range of cloud services to build and support the hybrid cloud estate by encompassing the leading public cloud players and leading private cloud technologies. With EUR 1.5 billion annual revenue, Cloud Infra Services helps clients virtualize and optimize their IT estates through infrastructure outsourcing services such as data center, helpdesk, network support, and service integration and service maintenance support. Our other services also include infrastructure transformation services-helping clients consolidate and migrate entire workloads and data centers.


Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Capgemini.


Visit us at https://www.capgemini.com/us-en/ . People matter, results count.


Job Title: Senior Manager, Service Delivery - Infrastructure Managed Services


Location: Toronto, CA (must be resident of Toronto area and willing to go into client office as required)


Travel: 25%


Job Description:


The Service Delivery Manager (SDM) is the interface role between Client, Account Executive and Service Delivery Operations –that provide the different IT Infrastructure services to the client. In this role, the SDM is accountable for managing the contract obligations, the financial agreements (revenue, billing), organic sales opportunities and overall client satisfaction. This role is accountable for the timely completion of all internal reporting within business lines and external reporting to the client teams. The SDM is responsible for cost control, add on sales at defined contribution margins, customer satisfaction & managing our services to the terms & conditions of the contract. The SDM Acts as single point of contract for the client with regards to Service delivery issues and challenges. The SDM works closely with the assigned Operational Leads (OL) and assists with resolving customer escalations.


Relationships:


+ Direct People Management of all CIS SDM resources within the Cluster

+ Overall senior leadership of all CIS Operational and Delivery resources aligned to the Cluster – onshore and GDC’s

+ Ensure attrition and talent development is managed effectively across all CIS Delivery resources within the Cluster, working closely with direct Line Managers and RMG


Responsibilities:


+ Ensure effective review and approval of all new Solutions and deals for the Cluster from a Delivery perspective

+ Customer Satisfaction for all CIS delivery engagements within the Cluster

+ Quality of Service across all CIS Delivery engagements for the Cluster

+ Work with the Cluster Head and Cluster BD Lead to identify and progress organic growth opportunities

+ Implementation of best practices as defined by the Global Practices

+ Implementation and exploitation of defined CIS standards and tooling

+ Accountable for the delivery of services by the managed and unmanaged suppliers contracted by the client

+ Ensuring the adoption, utilization and adherence to following the ITIL based SIAM processes including:

+ Change Management

+ IT Services Incident Management

+ Configuration Management

+ Problem Management & Major Incident Management

+ Service Request Management

+ Knowledge Management

+ Event Management

+ enabling consistent and seamless management of IT Services across a variable number of environments.

+ Monitors SLA achievement and Continuous Service Improvement performance to identify negative trends and agree with OL get-well plans implementation

+ Consult and review supplier SIP with the client. Oversees contract change process as part of Contract Management and Maintenance to ensure contractual consistency

+ Works with operations to ensure cost containment and reduction SIAM delivery responsibilities include:

+ Ensuring the SIAM Technology Platform is used for all SIAM Services and the associated suppliers

+ SIAM Technology Platform is used as the single source of record and reporting for the Service Level compliance and operational performance reporting.

+ Ensuring managed suppliers follow SIAM Services processes as identified in the Operations Procedures Manual.

+ Managing and reporting on the Deliverables and Obligations results on a monthly basis

+ Hosting the supplier governance and operational meetings with the entire SIAM Services team


Primary KPI’s:


+ Effective delivery of end-to-end CIS services across all accounts within the Cluster

+ End to end profitability of all CIS Delivery engagements for the Cluster

+ Forecasting of Delivery P&L (Run and P&C)

+ Leadership of all Delivery resources servicing the Cluster (direct and indirect, onshore and GDC’s)

+ Ensure effective review, approval, planning and mobilisation for all new CIS Delivery engagements


What You Bring:


Required:


+ 10 years infrastructure managed services delivery

+ Practical experience with ITIL based SIAM processes

+ Ownership of large P&L - revenue and growth

+ Proven track record partnering with client


Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.

This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.


Click the following link for more information on your rights as an Applicant - http://www.capgemini.com/resources/equal-employment-opportunity-is-the-law


What we offer:

Your career matters to you and is important to us too. Because your goals and needs are constantly evolving, we offer visibility, leeway and support to help you grow and progress in your career. This approach builds notably on our comprehensive competency framework, our personal development, training and career management programs, and our University innovative and business-focused learning curriculums.

We promote a culture of diversity. We believe working with talented individuals from different backgrounds and points of view is a strategic advantage and an ongoing opportunity. Diversity enriches our creative solutions and adds value for our clients.

Our Shared values have been at the heart of the group since our formation. They are honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty and fun. These values influence the way we meet client needs while respecting the regulatory requirements of each country in which we operate, and the way we promote ethically sound practices within Capgemini and in our partnerships.

Capgemini is committed to building a workforce of employees with diverse backgrounds and work experiences.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
The Service Delivery Manager position within the AutoSync Program Delivery Team will be instrumental in the continued growth and success of our Digital Retailing technology platform used by Automotive OEMs and Dealers.

The Service Delivery Manager requires a self-driven approach with the ability to effectively collaborate and communicate across multi-functional teams including product, engineering, client operations, customer success, and support, in order to successfully deliver a premium digital experience, through a connected retail software platform. The ideal individual is a highly effective critical thinker who is a catalyst for positive change and continuous improvement and motivated by innovation and the challenge to build a service delivery center of excellence.

What youâ€™ll doâ€¦

  • Lead, manage, and integrate the day-to-day execution of complex, multi-dimensional product feature delivery activities in accordance with prioritized platform workstreams and contractual Statement of Work (SOW) requirements for OEMs.
  • Ensure that platform and OEM work items are smoothly flowing through the established Kanban framework while mitigating risks around blockers (taking items from the â€˜commitment pointâ€™ to the â€˜delivery pointâ€™).
  • Contribute to the success of the Program Delivery Team by facilitating and championing the change of continuous improvement activities leading to increasing delivery cadence, improving costs, and shortening the response to market demand. 
  • Facilitate daily standups in order to motivate and drive the team, and help maintain a streamlined, obstacle-free workflow with a focus on delivery.
  • Ensure that delivery processes are working towards providing an enhanced digital retailing platform experience and customer satisfaction.
  • Takes full accountability over the outcome of the delivery success and invokes immediate action when risks or issues occur.
  • Manage program governance through reporting service delivery capability data and metrics (Lead Times, Quality Measures, Delivery Cadence, Flow Efficiency, etc).
  • Provide weekly data inputs to the Account Management team in order to relay OEM delivery item cadence health.

Key Relationships:

  • Reports to the Director of Program Delivery. 
  • Close collaboration with Product Managers/Directors, Engineering Leads/Directors, and Account Directors.

What youâ€™ll needâ€¦

  • 5 years of lean delivery management experience in a SaaS environment.
  • Strong Knowledge of release and delivery management and software quality principles.
  • Prior experience in the automotive industry, e-commerce, or with a digital agency would be an asset but is not required.
  • Extensive and proven experience with successfully delivering enterprise-scale web-based software build and implementation projects/programs in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
  • Extensive experience working collaboratively with Product Management, UX/design, and Engineering teams.
  • Familiar with the common technology stacks used for web-based software products that can be delivered as a service.
  • First-class leadership, influencing, and change management skills.
  • Advanced leadership skills and the ability to motivate team members in a cross-functional environment.
  • Expert proficiency in Lean Kanban Delivery Methodology.
  • Strong proficiency in using MS Office, Google Apps, and Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence, Trello) products.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills proven by presenting complex delivery plans to colleagues.
  • Impeccable attention to detail and strong organizational skills are an absolute must.
  • Self-starter that is comfortable working with minimal oversight.
  • Ability to effectively collaborate across (virtual) teams, time zones, and cultures.
  • Ability to work and be flexible among changing priorities and timelines.

Education & training:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in business, computer science, or related field preferred.
  • Project management certification (PMP), change management certification (CCMP), or other formal project management training. 
  • Kanban Management Professional (KMP) accreditation or higher.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Westmill Industries has been serving the panel board manufacturing industry for over 40 years. We are the primary dryer parts supplier and dryer rebuilder in North America. We supply new longitudinal dryers and jet dryer systems and offer consulting and engineering services, focusing on machinery used for plywood and gypsum production. 

We are hiring a Warehouse Manager to supervise all activities including overseeing team performance, expediting the receiving and shipping of goods, and ensuring efficient, organized storage.

Responsibilities include:
  • Oversee receiving, warehousing and shipping.
  • Implement operational policies and procedures.
  • Ensure effective and safe use of warehouse equipment and staff safety.
  • Motivate and manage the team.
  • Maintain documentation and keep accurate records of warehouse activities.
  • Other duties as required.

Skills and Experience:
  • 5 plus years of warehouse management experience.
  • Knowledge of inventory and inventory controls.
  • Valid drivers' license.
  • Able to operate forklift effectively.
  • Proficient computer skills.
  • Solid verbal and written English communication skills.

title: Home Delivery Director
description:
Home Delivery Director Career Opportunity

The Dufresne Group is currently seeking a Home Delivery Director for our Logistics Team within our Home Office located at 147 Commerce Drive in Winnipeg, MB.

Our Integrated Platform team is responsible for the end-to-end supply chain from; Demand Planning, Inventory fulfillment/Replenishment, Data & Analytics, Logistics & Network Optimization, Transportation Management, Warehousing & Distribution, to Final Mile Home Delivery. 

We will scale to support national fulfillment and result in an optimized network designed specially for big and bulky Home Delivery in Canada.

This team is looking for individuals to leverage automation, innovation and converging technology and lead a disruption in the marketplace.

The Dufresne Group is committed to investing in our team members; we offer:

  • Market competitive wages;
  • Comprehensive benefits plan and excellent employee discounts;
  • Employer Sponsored Retirement Savings Plan;
  • Career growth and continuous development;
  • Respectful and family-oriented working environment with strong company values.

As the Home Delivery Director, you will:

  • Design our growing network of home delivery / final mile offerings.
  • Lead our Fleet Planning and Management Team in the following areas:
    • Delivery Planning and Route optimization
    • Safety and Compliance (the management of our central registrar for all accidents involving corporate owned and rented/leased vehicles, and programs/audit records in relation to corporate compliance requirements.)
    • Fleet Management (the management and maintenance of the corporate fleet asset register and all relevant lease documents)
  • Manage a team of Operations Final Mile Leaders and Delivery Specialists to ensure that we meet and exceed the goals for our home delivery strategy.
  • Ensure compliance with all safety and compliance policies and procedures
  • Develop and propose new and/or revised processes, metrics, and route models using lean methodology and applying TDG’s change/process management philosophies, that will improve the customer experience while maximize efficiencies.
  • Ensure all contractual obligations are being met and performance levels meet or exceed client requirements
  • Work with local DC Fleet Managers to develop performance improvement action plans
  • Evaluate/Implement new and emerging technologies to enhance the customer experience.
  • Manage RFP (Request for Proposal) processes providing expertise in multiple supply chain elements to achieve best total value in the selection of services and or carriers.
  • Enhance Home Delivery claim and fuel analytics and implement initiatives to drive improvement.

As a successful candidate you will have the following:

  • A strong sense of; “Hunger” and “Humility”
  • Experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership
  • 10+ years of senior management experience in a Transportation or Logistics role.
  • Legal and fiscal knowledge inherent to the transport industry
  • Strong executive leadership skills, ability to build and manage teams.
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communications skills with strong negotiating tactics and conflict resolution skills
  • Strong organizational skill with ability to prioritize and multi-task
  • Working knowledge of routing and transportation software preferred
  • An exposure to furniture handling activities a distinct advantage.

Apply now!

The Dufresne Group welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Service Delivery Manager


The Service Delivery Manager is responsible for leading application management services projects for CGI. This individual will be accountable for planning, delivering, operating, monitoring and maintaining a stable, secure and responsive support to the client for application management services, in accordance with the client contract documents and internal CGI frameworks. The Service Delivery Manager prepares recommendations for service improvement(s) and handles or prevents escalations for the service delivery area(s). Focuses on quality of service, end user satisfaction and cost management.










Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

title: Assistant Warehouse Manager
description:
We believe in rising to a challenge, creating a vision, and providing a solution. We believe in dedication, hard work, and a job well done. We believe in superior service, strong relationships and building lasting impressions. Who are we? We are EFCO.

At EFCO, we believe in helping those responsible for the construction of the world's concrete structures with a safe, reliable, and cost efficient concrete formwork solution. We do this by engineering, designing, manufacturing, supplying and field servicing forming and shoring products for concrete construction. Our Core Values represent the manner in which we expect to do business with our customers and interact with those people around us in the business community. At EFCO, our core values are at the very heart of who we are and what we believe. Quality. Innovation. Integrity. Super Service. These 4 Core Values describe very high standards of professional behavior that all EFCO employees must seek to achieve.

Duties

  • Assists with managing warehouse activities to ensure that efficient and economical utilization for storing, reconditioning and distributing finished goods inventories.
  • Supervises the distribution of EFCO Forming Systems in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Manages daily work schedules to ensure customer requirements are met.
  • Works with the Warehouse Manager to plan and schedule warehouse functions to ensure on time, accurate and complete delivery of EFCO goods and services.
  • Recommends changes in procedures to improve the operational efficiency of the warehouse.

Requirements

  • College degree of equivalent, plus 4-6 years experience in manufacturing or distribution.
  • Must have the ability to read and interpret blueprints.
  • Mechanical aptitude with ability to complete basic mathematical calculations is essential.
  • Exposure to sheet metal fabrication is helpful.
  • Excellent communication, problem solving, organizational, and PC skills are required.
  • Must work effectively under pressure, exercise good judgement, and be a good negotiator.
  • Must be able to sit or stand for extended periods of time with the ability to squat, lift, push, and pull up to 50 lbs.
  • Limited travel required.

title: Assistant Distribution Center Manager
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Are you looking for a new challenge within distribution management? Maybe this job as Service Manager in Mississauga, ON is for you! Amarr is hiring a hands-on, experienced Assistant Distribution Center Manager (Service Manager) to join our team in Mississauga. This is the ideal position for the person who loves to manage a small team with an all-hands-on-deck approach, as well as be directly involved with directing the day to day operations of a warehouse. What you will be doing: * Coordinating assembly, work schedules (including temporary personnel as needed), and warehouse operations to ensure service leads are met. * Be responsible for establishing and enforcing operational procedures for verification of incoming and outgoing shipments, handling and disposition of merchandise, and keeping of warehouse inventory. * Ensuring that corporate programs regarding safety, security, care of equipment and facility are followed. Enforce OSHA compliance and to assure an "injury-free" workplace. * Be responsible for all aspects of hourly warehouse staff from hiring to termination, which includes staffing, development, supervision, and direction. Working conditions and experience: * Manual dexterity and hand to eye coordination for operation of hand/power tools. * Extended time on feet, walking distances up to 200 feet. * Frequent stooping, bending, walking, carrying and lifting (up to 75 lbs.). What we are looking for: * Minimum of 2 years of distribution center/warehouse supervisory experience. * Clear and effective written and oral communication skills. * College education or related experience. * Organizational, time management and analytical skills. * Good supervisory, leadership and motivational skills. * PC / Windows skills. * Mechanical aptitude / power tools. * Must be able to clear background/drug/MVR screenings This position is Monday - Friday from 7:30am -- 5:30pm. Supplemental benefits, RRSP, and Paid Time Off are provided. Candidates for this position must have a good attitude, a desire to work hard with a great team, and the ability to be a self-starter. As one of North America's leading garage door manufacturers, Amarr Company takes pride in fostering a culture where employees enjoy many opportunities for career growth, rapid advancement, and relocation to some of America's most desired cities. Although Amarr Company is an international business, employees enjoy a family-oriented, caring culture and rewarding work environment. Amarr Company offers competitive wages, generous benefits, and a bonus program for every employee. At Amarr Company, the door is always open and there is no ceiling to your career growth. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled</section>

title: Warehouse Assistant Manager
description:
EQ3 was born in opposition to trends, vowing instead to focus on timeless designs. We make furniture not fast, but to last. Our greatest hope is to have our pieces passed down like heirlooms. We pride ourselves on being innovators in our industry, and we believe that the more voices and choices we incorporate into our perspective, the better we’re able to find creative solutions for modern life. Everything we do is made in consideration of people, of the planet and of our space.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, collaborative individual to join our Warehouse Team as a Warehouse Assistant Manager.

THE DETAILS:

You’ll be joining our Mont Royal team at 7900 Devonshire Road, in a full-time capacity

  • You’ll keep the stock room organized, adjusting shelving to make way for new items, and replenishing items as the need arises
  • You’ll work with Shipping and Receiving to help process shipments, review them for accuracy, keep inventory, and ensure items are properly price tagged before going to the floor
  • You’ll be responsible for managing, coaching, and recruiting for the Stock Associate team
  • You’ll work closely with the visual coordinator to create a dynamic, visually appealing storefront and maintain standards for merchandise presentation, signage and general housekeeping
  • You’ll assist customers directly with in-store pickups, taking items to their cars as needed
  • You’ll have a hand in building maintenance: identifying issues, scheduling repairs, and taking feedback from the building manager and service provider
  • You’ll be reporting to the Warehouse Manager

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:

  • Minimum two (2) years of Warehouse Management experience
  • High school diploma/GED. Post-secondary courses in sales & retail customer service would be a bonus
  • Proficiency in retail operations and systems (Point of Sale, Microsoft Office)
  • Strong verbal/written communication skills. You should be comfortable motivating, coaching, and managing a retail team
  • Knowledge of the retail furniture industry with a strong understanding of marketplace potential
  • Knowledge and experience in building maintenance

WORK LIFE AT EQ3:

  • A company that supports work-life balance with paid time off and flexibility
  • Competitive compensation and benefit packages
  • Employee discount program for products, wellness plans, group banking and more
  • EQ3 Spirit Committee that promotes community engagement, rewards, and recognition for all employees
  • Surround yourself with a community that supports professional growth and collaboration

CLOSING DATE: Open until filled

HOW TO APPLY: Submit your complete application by clicking on “Apply to Position” now!

We thank all interested individuals, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: SDM (Service Delivery Manager)
description: At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment. Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us. As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.  What you will be doing...

title: Service Delivery Manager (Hybrid)
description:
Service Delivery Manager (Hybrid)
 

Job Number:

  3187484

Posting Date

:  Mar 17, 2022

Primary Location

:  Americas-Canada-Quebec-Montreal
Education Level:  Bachelor's Degree

Job

:  Project and Program Management
Employment Type:  Full Time
Job Level:  Associate
 

Description

We offer:

 

  • To work with some of the best professionals in the business - for a firm that values individual intellect as much as teamwork
  • State-of-the-art offices that are designed to maximize collaboration
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Enriching challenges that provide opportunity for constant learning and advancement
  • An environment which is leveraging technology to its highest potential

 

 

Team Profile:

 

Enterprise Technology & Services (ETS) delivers shared technology services for the Firm supporting all business applications and end users. ETS provides capabilities for all stages of the Firm’s software development lifecycle, enabling productive coding, functional and integration testing, application releases, and ongoing monitoring and support for over 3,000 production applications.

 

ETS also delivers all workplace technologies (desktop, mobile, voice, video, productivity, intranet/internet) in integrated configurations that boost the personal productivity of our employees. Application and end user services are delivered on a scalable, secure, and reliable infrastructure composed of seamlessly integrated datacenter, network, compute, cloud, storage, and database services.

 

 

Position Description:

 

A dynamic change agent, with a passion for collaborative working, to contribute on our teams to deliver exceptional output and drive continuous improvement. You will work directly in a squad or squads to drive improving performance using Agile values, practices, and processes. Working with the Product Owner, you will facilitate the work being done by the squad, with specific activities that include maintaining the backlog and facilitating Agile ceremonies like stand ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives. You will monitor team performance through the Squad’ s metrics and KPI dashboards and help identify continuous improvement opportunities to support the team to work smarter, and more effectively.  In this role, you will help the squad(s) mature to be more customer focused with more frequent delivery of high value outputs that are embraced by users and stakeholders.  Additionally, this role will drive the firm’s transition from on-premises Business Intelligence products to Public Cloud products.     

 

  • Enable organizational change in how we approach our work
  • Model behaviors to support the organization’s transformation to a new way of working
  • Actively create and maintain the culture within the squad based on the organization and Agile leadership behaviors
  • Facilitate sprint planning, stand ups, retrospectives and other Agile ceremonies
  • Provide constructive feedback to team members to help drive Agile maturity
  • Help your Product Owner to manage and prioritize work through the backlog
  • Review and manage backlog items to ensure the latest work status is captured and updated as appropriate
  • Maintain and update KPIs and squad process metrics and artifacts to ensure accurate and transparent communications to Product Owner and other stakeholders
 

Qualifications

Skills Required:

 

  • Experience working in Agile teams and an expert on Agile practices
  • Proficiency facilitating Squad meetings to ensure they are solutions-oriented, with focus on customer needs and delivering business value as well as gathering client requirements
  • Experience leading Agile teams to adopt consistent norms and practices that are evaluated and improved as the teams mature
  • Maintain a centralized strategy (upgrades, planning, etc.) across products to ensure a broader view of firm initiatives (i.e. hygiene)
  • Strong collaboration skills to help all team members to resolve challenges and remove obstacles
  • A data driven mindsight, leveraging business driven KPI’s and available metrics to manage and communicate team performance
  • A continuous improvement mind-set and dedication to finding creative ways of working
  • Ability to influence behavior across a large, complex global organization
  • A dedication to cross-function collaboration, communication and breaking down of silos
  • Experience in contract and vendor management

 

 

About us:

 

Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. At Morgan Stanley Montreal, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas.

 

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximize their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives, and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing, and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.

 

All our positions are located in Montreal, Quebec.We offer a hybrid work environment, combining remote work and attendance in the office.

 

Knowledge of French and English is required.

 

Spotlight on our Montreal Technology Centre: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oo5GaXpCwKs

*Video dated October 2019.

 

Build a career with impact. Visit morganstanley.com for more information.

title: Engagement Manager/Service Delivery Manager
description:
Responsibilities

Job Description:
  • 10 - 15 years' experience in delivering large and complex Application Management Services engagements as an Engagement Manager or Delivery Leader
  • Own and achieve the assigned revenue, client satisfaction and team utilization targets
  • Preferable having working experience on SAP ERP solution
  • Not be a purest about any method or framework but must possess the knowledge and experience to advise clients for implementing required industry best practices to achieve better business outcomes
  • Manage global onshore/offshore AMS teams and the work they are delivering
  • Establish distributed Agile practices, but with the recent COVID-19 pandemic, make delivery of work effective with even 100% remote working of teams
  • Attract, hire, retain, inspire, and manage the new age talent required for the successful
  • Proven track record of successfully managing global teams in delivering large scale Application Management Services for clients
Proven track record of sensing and responding to new opportunities while delivering work at clients and ensuring it is brought to the attention of Account and Consulting Practice leadership.

title: Géstionnaire du département - centre de distribution
description:
WORLDPAC Canada est à la recherche d’un ou d’une Gestionnaire du département – Centre de distribution à temps plein pour son centre de distribution de Saint-Léonard au Québec.

WORLDPAC, une filiale d’Advance Auto Parts, importe et distribue de l’équipement d’origine et des pièces automobiles de rechange de qualité destinés à des ateliers spécialisés dans l’entretien de véhicules importés et nord-américains.

Ce qui est offert par l’entreprise :

  • Des possibilités d’avancement de carrière – des promotions internes
  • Un régime d’avantages sociaux concurrentiel après 90 jours d’emploi, y compris l’assurance maladie complémentaire, l’assurance dentaire, l’assurance vie, l’assurance en cas de décès ou de mutilation accidentels, l’assurance invalidité de courte durée, l’assurance invalidité de longue durée, etc.
  • Un REER collectif avec contribution de contrepartie de l’employeur
  • Un régime d’achat d’actions à rabais pour tous les employés
  • Un rabais employé sur les pièces automobiles
  • Des régimes de congés de maladie et de vacances
  • Une indemnité pour l’achat de bottes de protection
  • L’accès à un excellent système de formation en ligne
  • Un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire
  • Un programme de dons de bienfaisance

Description sommaire du poste :

La personne titulaire du poste assure la supervision et la coordination des activités de réception et d’expédition du service et veille à ce qu’elles soient menées avec rigueur et précision dans le respect des échéanciers fixés. Il/Elle supervise les directives données aux employés quant au travail à effectuer et met en œuvre des politiques et des procédures visant à offrir un environnement de travail favorable. Il/Elle donne l’exemple en assurant un leadership positif et favorise le travail d’équipe en cherchant des occasions de soutenir et de rehausser le moral du groupe.

  • Établir les procédures et les horaires de travail et accélérer l’exécution du travail au moyen d’instructions écrites et verbales.
  • Attribuer les tâches et inspecter le travail pour en vérifier l’exactitude, la qualité et la conformité aux politiques et aux procédures. 
  • Évaluer la productivité individuelle et en discuter avec les employés.
  • Au besoin, mener des consultations d’orientation auprès des employés et prendre les mesures disciplinaires qui s’imposent, traiter les plaintes et résoudre les problèmes.
  • Tenir des registres des heures et de la production et préparer des rapports de synthèse.
  • Observer régulièrement le flux de travail dans l’ensemble du service.
  • Évaluer les procédures et les méthodes pour améliorer l’efficience et établir des normes. Recommander des mesures pour améliorer les méthodes de production, la performance du matériel, ainsi que la qualité des produits et du service.
  • Effectuer les évaluations de rendement annuelles des employés du service et faire des recommandations pour les promotions et les augmentations de salaire au mérite en fonction du rendement des employés.
  • Discuter des priorités avec les gestionnaires des autres services pour coordonner les activités de façon à maximiser la productivité.
  • Participer à la planification des activités de sécurité du personnel, de formation et de protection des bâtiments. S’assurer que les procédures de sécurité sont respectées et formuler des recommandations sur des questions liées à la sécurité. S’assurer que les installations répondent aux normes de sécurité et s’efforcer d’atteindre un objectif de zéro blessure au sein de l’établissement.
  • Communiquer aux employés de l’information pertinente sur les événements du jour ou les enjeux saisonniers.
  • Veiller à ce que le matériel et les outils nécessaires soient disponibles et en bon état de fonctionnement pour atteindre les objectifs du service. Maintenir un environnement de travail propre et sécuritaire et en assurer la surveillance.

Compétences et expérience exigées :

  • De 4 à 6 années d’expérience en gestion d’une petite équipe ou d’un petit service en entrepôt
  • Solides compétences en gestion et en leadership.
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication verbale et écrite.
  • Sens aigu de l’organisation et de la planification.
  • Maîtrise de la suite d’applications Microsoft, y compris Word et Excel, ainsi que du système AS/400.
  • Diplôme d’études secondaires ou de formation générale.
  • Prendre couramment des décisions importantes et contribuer à l’élaboration de politiques et de procédures d’exploitation normalisées dans le cadre des exigences du poste.
  • Être généralement guidé par une politique et des procédures établies ou par une expertise technique et/ou une formation, et soumettre uniquement les questions ou les problèmes inhabituels au superviseur.
  • Interagir avec des personnes à l’intérieur et à l’extérieur de son service et, souvent, avec des contacts externes.
  • Recevoir des directives générales sur les tâches prioritaires tout en bénéficiant d’une grande marge de manœuvre pour la gestion des employés
  • Bilingue (français et anglais).

La présente description de poste a été conçue pour illustrer la nature générale et le niveau du travail effectué par les membres de l’équipe dans le cadre de ce poste. Elle ne se veut pas une liste exhaustive de toutes les tâches, responsabilités et qualifications requises des titulaires de ce poste, ni ne doit être interprétée comme telle. D’autres fonctions ou tâches peuvent leur être confiées, et l’entreprise se réserve le droit de modifier la description du poste à tout moment et sans préavis.

WORLDPAC Canada s’engage à utiliser un processus de recrutement accessible à tous et toutes. Des accommodements raisonnables seront offerts, sur demande, aux personnes ayant une incapacité afin que le processus de recrutement et de sélection respecte le principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Veuillez communiquer avec le service des ressources humaines de WORLDPAC en composant le 647-999-0734, afin de faire une demande d’accommodement raisonnable pendant toute étape du processus de recrutement et de sélection. Ce numéro est destiné uniquement aux demandes d’accommodement; n’utilisez pas ce numéro pour connaître l’état de votre demande d’emploi.

title: Warehouse Manager (Halifax Head Office) FULL-TIME
description:
Maritime Beauty Supply is the leading distributor of professional beauty supplies in the Maritime Provinces. We have a store network of 17 locations representing numerous top professional lines s including but not limited to: Redken, Matrix, L’Oreal Professionnel, Pureology, Moroccan Oil, Olaplex, Verb, Bain de Terre, Cezanne, Babe, Babyliss, Avanti, Sam Villa, Quannessence, OPI, CND, Allpresan, and Gehwol.

We are currently seeking a Full-Time Warehouse Manager for our Halifax Distribution Centre. Schedule: Monday to Friday.

 

Key Responsibilities:

•        Manage the reception, handling, distribution, and storage of all freight, product, and supplies that come in and out of our Distribution Centre.

•        Planning and implementation of new systems, policies & procedures, and technologies to continuously improve the total functionality of the Distribution Centre.

•        Ongoing assessment of the Distribution Centre’s performance and develop/achieve quarterly objectives to improve the DC’s work environment and operation.

•        Communicate all delays or variances in inbound/outbound freight to the appropriate parties.

•        Supervise a team of warehouse employees, including hiring, delegation, training, retention, performance evaluation, disciplinary actions, and termination.

•        Plan the Distribution Centre’s workload to ensure and co-ordinate staff levels so all departments are on schedule and orders are processed in a timely and accurate manner.

•        Ensure the efficiency and accuracy of operations by regularly tracking key performance indicators and providing ongoing training, as well as updating of all policies & procedures.

•        Develop and/or enforce corporate policies regarding security and safety in order to maintain a safe working environment. Ensure said policies are understood and followed by all staff – allocate training time at monthly meetings, complete required documentation and conduct regular inspections.

•        Develop and maintain solid relationships with our carriers ensuring the sharing of information is prompt and consistent.

•        Negotiate rates with existing carriers and periodically check with other sources for possible savings.

•        Plan warehouse layout and space requirements in order to prevent loss or damage, and to achieve full warehouse optimization.

•        Maintain strict control over inventory levels in order to meet internal and external demand of product.

•        Maintain appropriate and complete documentation regarding regulated products and/or hazardous materials.

•        Conduct periodic spot-checks of inventory levels, supplies, or equipment.

•        Regular completion of administrative tasks.

•        Total facility maintenance including repairs, improvements, and waste management.

•        Assess the need for, and arrange the purchase of, moving equipment like forklifts, crash pads, dollies, and so on.

•        All other duties as assigned.

 

Qualifications & Core Competencies:

•        University or College degree/diploma with a focus on business management, warehousing, transportation, supply chain management

•        3+ years of direct management in warehouse operations

•        3+ years of directly managing and/or supervising a large number of staff and multiple departments

•        Experience in multiple warehouse settings and or technology (such as WMS, warehouse planograms)

•        Strong and proven project people & process management skills and flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities and deadlines.

•        Excellent analytical capabilities and strong detail focus

•        Proficient in Microsoft Office and use of technology

 

Shaping Success Together: 

The ability of Maritime Beauty Supply to remain competitive and successful in today’s world is directly attributable to our employees. These beliefs, our commitment to open lines of communication and our policies and practices, ensure that we all operate in a positive employee relations environment that is supportive of our employees. We value our employees and strive to offer an environment of challenge, continued growth and learning opportunities. 

  • Medical benefits (Health, Dental and Life Insurances)
  • RSP Matching Contribution Plan
  • Service Recognition Program
  • Enhanced Vacation plan and personal days
  • Corporate Charitable Donation Program 
  • Employee Fitness Program
  • Personal, Professional and Career Development Program
  • Maternity Leave Top-Up

While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those candidates being considered will be contacted. No telephone calls please.

Maritime Beauty Supply is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Service Delivery Manager - Call Centre
description:
Position Summary:

Directs the entire operations of the organization's call center facility(ies) as assigned. Implements and reviews policies and operating structure of the call center. Sets standards and guidelines for interaction with customers. Monitors the calls to ensure that the expectations of the customers are met.

Overall Responsibilities:

  • Overall responsibility for the delivery of overall operational metrics of a regional or global client.
  • Proactively maintains regular engagement with key client contacts in line with client expectations.
  • Ensures delivery of Client KPIs and targets including day to day service levels, customer experience, quality measures and compliance measures.
  • Responsible for the development of the operational talent pool by optimizing the skills of the existing team, in partnership with recruitment to attract the very best external talent, in line with the agreed framework and succession planning to ensure key roles are filled and individual talent is recognized.
  • Deliver well-defined Communication and Engagement to ensure all teams understand the performance of the business and also understand the needs of their teams.
  • Responsible and accountable for the operational performance and for meeting/exceeding targets of all required metrics.
  • Continuously identify and implement of operational best practices.
  • Motivate and effectively performance manage direct reports to ensure delivery of overall targets and the business plan.
  • Select, effectively manage and coach direct reports.
  • Manage and develop the operational client relationships by conducting (where appropriate) operational client review meetings and day to day communication within key workstream.
  • Identify and highlight further opportunities for services and process improvements.

Job Requirements:

  • Experience with forecasting/scheduling and related software packages.
  • Proven ability to manage people, processes, and technology.
  • Strategic thinker and tactical implementer.
  • Experience in developing a team in a contact center site, while meeting all operational and financial objectives.
  • Senior management leadership abilities and skill, such as the ability to build teams and manage operational, organizational and financial elements. Demonstrated experience coaching and developing individuals.
  • Ability to influence and motivate others.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent leadership and developmental skills.
  • Demonstrated success managing new initiatives while meeting operating and budgetary requirements.
  • Must have strong technical, project management, implementation and process improvement skills.
  • General business acumen, including reporting and analysis, presentation skills, and organizational abilities.

Education/Experience:

  • 7-20 years call center experience.
  • Minimum 5-7 years managing operations in a call center environment.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Management or a related field or equivalent work experience.
  • Experience in a leadership role in a large contact center setting with extensive client and senior management interface.

All of the above job duties may be changed/modified/deleted at any time by the Company; any other job duties may be assigned as needed.

title: National Distribution Manager
description:
The Position:

Arch Insurance Canada is seeking a distribution leader to join one of Canadaâ€™s fastest growing specialty insurance providers. The National Distribution Manager will be responsible for refreshing the companyâ€™s distribution strategy, including building a team to service our distribution partners nationally. The successful candidate will encapsulate Pursuing Better Together â€“ our approach to insurance that is based on collaboration, responsiveness and a genuine commitment to continually raising the bar.    This position is directly accountable for the following responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities:

Planning

  • Consultatively manage the development of enterprise marketing and strategic broker engagements plans nationally
  • Utilize broker data platforms and other data-driven distribution tools to optimize distribution strategy and support targeted business initiatives
  • Identify, communicate and work to vet market dislocation opportunities
  • Support Business Units in the development of fact-based, data-driven regional and national distribution strategies

Executing

  • Steer the execution of enterprise marketing plan and strategic broker relationships nationally by collaborating with Business Units and distribution partners
  • Implement distributor Voice of the Customer initiatives (surveys, councils, etc.) that provide valuable feedback and direction for Arch Canada
  • Leverage broker data platforms and other data-driven distribution tools to deliver and communicate actionable analysis within Arch Canada
  • Elevate the brand by supporting specific local and national industry associations
  • Coordinate regional and national marketing events
  • Administer Enhanced Commission plans or Service Agreements with our key distribution partners

Measuring

  • Regularly evaluate production results by Business Unit and distributor to ensure achievement of goals
  • Monitor the execution of specific initiatives and achievement of distribution goals and make adjustments to initiatives as necessary
  • Monitor publicly-available information to maintain in-depth knowledge of distributor performance, strategies, and direction

Partnering

  • Collaborate with North American Strategy and Distribution team to manage cross-border opportunities that support business goals
  • Coordinate with Speed to Market in support of new product or program development and launch
  • Work closely with North American Distribution Data/Analytics team to deliver actionable information within Arch
Required Skills/Experience:

Key Competencies:

  • Proven strategic and critical thinking capabilities
  • Sound leadership and influencing capabilities
  • Broad understanding of Canadian insurance marketplace
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, including ability to effectively interact with team members at all levels of Arch and its distribution partners
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills and executive presence
  • Exceptional organizational and project management skills
  • Able to connect dots/see patterns across projects and the organization
  • Excellent problem-solving and organizational skills; ability to manage multiple priorities work
  • Demonstrate a high level of personal initiative, setting and achieving challenging goals

Preferred Technical Skills:

  • Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Outlook)

Experience:

  • Experience developing and implementing growth strategies across multiple lines of business
Education:
  • Bachelor degree preferred

Expected Travel:  

  • This is a hybrid role based in Toronto and estimated travel of 15%
The Company:

Arch Insurance is a global insurer offering our clients superior coverage and service. We embody the Arch guiding principle of focusing on retaining experienced and talented employees to differentiate us from the rest of the pack. Our group operates from offices in the US, Canada, Bermuda, UK, and Australia, providing specialty risk solutions to clients worldwide across a wide range of industries.

With nearly 20 years of operating history and strong financial ratings, our track record remains solid.

 

Arch Insurance employs a disciplined underwriting approach and prudent risk selection across all types of business. Our mission is to provide our insureds with superb coverage and claims handling through careful and diligent underwriting of risks and business-friendly solutions. Across our global operations, Arch Insurance employees are ready to meet your needs with professionalism and excellence.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Why CompuCom? (Overview):

The Technical Support Manager is a highly visible leader responsible for day-to-day planning, measuring and executing contact center service quality and operations. This position is responsible for building and maintaining long-term internal and external relationships as well as guiding the development of a leadership framework and delivering a range of enterprise-wide initiatives aimed at building a deeper, more flexible leadership bench to serve our growth strategies. The Technical Support Manager will work closely with front level management, support departments, internal stakeholders and other leaders in support of business needs.

 

This is an onsite role that is located downtown, Toronto.

 

Proof of full Covid-19 vaccination will be required prior to employment.  

What We Need & What You'll Do (Responsibilities):
  • Develop and supervise a team of front line management; directing their activities for the achievement of company targets and goals
  • Identify, monitor and articulate reporting requirements; which includes targets, specific data, anticipated outcomes and other key performance indicators
  • Identify, recommend and support the implementation of various programs for the improvement of contact center processes through support of quality and training efforts
  • Prepare, develop and conduct performance evaluations, make employment decisions, set up performance goals and targets for assigned team
  • Lead and drive key initiatives that align with end state goals by working cross-functionally with internal and external teams
  • Performs duties professionally and contributes to a positive work environment
  • Promote employee-centric culture that encourages employee satisfaction and engagement
  • Other duties as assigned
Who You Are (Qualifications):
  • 5+ yearsâ€™ experience in a call center management role  
  • Must have the ability to work collaboratively with a variety of people at all levels within the organization to ensure effective communication and success of key initiatives
  • Must have excellent leadership and communication skills with an ability to manage a team and the ability to lead and influence others
  • Well-rounded Business Acumen and experience (Operations, Finance, People Management, Training)
  • Detail-oriented with effective time management, organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work independently (self-starter) and as a member of various teams or committees
  • Calculates risk associated with sound decision-making skills

title: Warehouse Operations Manager
description:
About Us:

Fresh Start Foods Canada Ltd.  was founded in 1993 to provide Foodservice Customers with a fresh alternative. An outstanding supply network, efficient distribution through our three regional locations, and our thoroughly modern processing plant are all part of our commitment to provide the freshest fruits and vegetables possible.

 

We are currently seeking a full time  Warehouse Operations Manager Night Shift  to join our team for the  Milton Facility.

 

In conjunction with the Director Operations, the Warehouse Operations Manager Night is responsible for improving the efficiency and cost-effectiveness of the warehouse operations by refining the current systems, developing improved systems, reducing costs, developing employeesâ€™ skills and abilities and leadership development.

Responsibilities & Qualifications:

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Establishes and maintains productivity standards for all warehouse job functions to the teamâ€™s efficiency
  • Responsible for managing the balance between volume/staff levels and thru-put
  • Responsible for the proper inventory, storage, receiving, rotating and shipping of all produce and similar items.
  • Responsible for the management and tracking of product waste and ways to reduce waste
  • Identifies variances in actual costs vs. budgeted costs and identifies methods for reducing costs
  • Examines and implements methods for reducing costs in all aspects of the warehouse to achieve a continual reduction in costs per case
  • Retrieve orders from the answering service as needed, route runs and print picking slips as required
  • Ensures good employee/supervisor relations through consistent application of policies throughout the shift
  • Conducts shift meetings to ensure staff is kept up to date on company and department matters as well as inventory issues and areas of concern.
  • Handles disciplinary problems within the department by investigating the problem with all parties involved and following positive discipline procedures
  • Determines long-term skill requirements for the department and develops staff to meet long-term needs
  • Responsible for overseeing the training program for all new staff members

Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:

  • 1-3 years experience managing a warehouse department in a private, competitive company
  • 1-3 years operations experience in material handling
  • Must have experience in the distribution/handling of produce or food products
  • Able to take a proactive approach to customer service and build strong relationships with all levels of customers
  • Excellent leadership, organizational and multi-tasking skills.
  • Strong PC skills, proficiency with Microsoft Office software, email systems, website product ordering.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must have valid license for operating counter-balance, forklift and electric pallet jacks
  • Must be willing to work night shift schedule:

Sundays through Fridays (Saturdays are off)
Time: 6:00 pm to 4:00 am (end time will vary depending on business needs)

Our Commitment:

Fresh Start Foods  offers successful candidates competitive wages, Health Care Benefits and RRSP Program. If you possess these skills and experience and want to learn more about this exciting career opportunity, please apply directly through our career website.

 

Fresh Start Foods  is an equal opportunity employer who strives to provide an inclusive work environment that involves everyone and embraces the diverse talent of its people.

All qualified applicants and employees will receive consideration for employment, or in terms or conditions of employment, without regard to any enumerated or analogous grounds of discrimination, including race, religious beliefs, colour, gender, gender identity, gender expression, physical disability, mental disability, age, ancestry, place of origin, marital status, source of income, family status, sexual orientation or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Datavail helps customers manage their data and maximize IT efficiency through application of our deep expertise in databases, analytics, and applications. We are North America’s largest data integration and database administration company with more than 900 employees on payroll and core operations in four countries. Founded in 2007, Datavail is based in Broomfield, Colorado and supports mid-market and enterprise clients headquartered in North America. For more information, visit www.datavail.com.

Title:Service Delivery Manager (SDM)

LOCATION: Greater Toronto Area - Canada

The objective of the Service Delivery Manager is to provide the greatest amount of value to our customers by working alongside our data focused operations teams. The SDM is the key interface between Datavail and its Enterprise clients and is responsible for the overall operational and financial performance, along with the long-term relationship of the account. The SDM must be capable of anticipating customer needs, fostering strong customer relationships, and delivering solutions that ensure consistent reliable service performance. The SDM will be responsible for all business relationship management activities and must act in a leadership role within Datavail. The SDM will help support the setting of long-term support plans for customers and will look for growth opportunities within the account while following the ITIL service management framework.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Function as primary post-sale point of contact for Datavail customers.
  • Manage the commercial and operational aspects of Datavail's relationship with assigned clients.
  • Organize and lead company and customer activities to achieve new client on-boarding.
  • Identify and pursue opportunities to expand service revenue within assigned accounts.
  • Identify and coordinate all issues, milestones and status while performing the role of project manager for major customer initiatives.
  • Participate in, and as appropriate lead, customer meetings regarding service delivery, project management and work scheduling.
  • Monitor service performance, identify issues and work with all levels of Datavail and client personnel to drive issue resolution. Implement processes, procedures and other mechanisms to assure service performance.
  • Conduct regular service performance reviews.
  • Manage service scope and coordinate change orders.
  • Ensure that effective communication and problem management occurs between all Datavail service support team members.
  • Ensure all internal stakeholders have clear visibility into the status of all projects and timely information needed to execute on their plans.
  • Ensuring all internal stakeholders are effectively collaborating to produce expected results.
  • Provide analysis of key metrics and recommend improvements.
  • Coordinate, lead and drive the problem management process to ensure all appropriate constituencies are participating and the root cause of issues are identified, resolved and appropriately communicated to the client.
  • Manage Service Level Agreements and Key Performance Indicators. Act as the customer's advocate and coordinate all non-technical communications between client and Datavail
  • Responsible for customer satisfaction, business retention and account growth.
  • Responsible for the collective strategy of delivery, growth, risk management

Education:

  • Bachelors degree in business or technical discipline.
  • Certified Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent PM experience preferred ITIL

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 6-10 years' experience in Information Technology or related field
  • 6-10 years' experience in account management, customer service or service management, preferably with an IT managed service or outsourcing provider.
  • Light Experience in project management and business operation with exposure to business process and information flow.
  • Experience with complex inter-related projects in matrix-managed environments.
  • Experience leveraging a Customer Success framework to proactively lead the customer and mitigate churn risks
  • Knowledge of IT industry practices and standards.
  • Exposure to application development & QA services (ADM)
  • Experience working in a customer success manager role or similar

The successful candidate will possess the following attributes:

  • Interpersonal skills - ability to build strong relationships with customers and internal team members and to work across the organization to achieve results.
  • Professional communication skills - Ability to work effectively with middle, senior, and executive level customer contacts face to face, electronically and over the phone.
  • Integrity - words and actions are always consistent and behavior is always in accordance with highest ethical standards.
  • Customer focus - responsive, service oriented and attuned to customer needs.
  • Technical acumen - ability to grasp technical concepts and establish credibility with technical contacts.
  • Process orientation - ability to recognize process deficiencies and implement improvements
See Job Description

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
We are currently recruiting a Warehouse Managerfor our Dorval Unit.

Humility, simplicity, efficiency, and a sense of responsibility, these are the values â€‹â€‹of Newrest. As the world's leading independent player in airline catering, Newrest is the only operator to operate in all sectors: airline catering, base stations, rail catering and retail. With 29,500 employees in 57 countries, the group achieved a turnover of 1.07 billion euros in 2020.

Newrest is committed to constantly improving and innovating for its customers, to ensuring the well-being and progress of its employees and executives, to ensuring a sustainable and sustainable development of the company, and to respecting social values â€‹â€‹and environmental issues in all of its activities. For more information on Newrest: https://www.newrest.eu/

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze shipment logs
  • Review timeliness of scheduled deliveries.
  • Track inventory levels
  • Order new supplies on time
  • Constantly work to improve processes
  • Make suggestions for productivity improvements
  • Optimize employee workflow
  • Determine and track the most crucial warehouse KPIs
  • Ensure that facility equipment is appropriately maintained.
  • Communicate and collaborate with other team members
  • Train, guide and evaluate new warehouse workers.
  • Track expenses related to fuel, storage, and truck maintenance.
  • Manage a team of warehouse workers;
  • Manage their daily schedule;
  • Communicate any problem with the manager (operational or disciplinary);
  • Receive and check goods;
  • Check product temperatures upon delivery;
  • Complete traceability documents;
  • Unpack and store products in various storage areas following FIFO rules;
  • Perform material outputs following good hygiene and manufacturing practices;
  • Clean and organize the different storage areas;
  • Pack and label any open product;
  • Daily inventory control (quantity, breakage, DLC, visual product, protection product ...) ;
  • Check temperatures of different cold chambers (positive and negative);
  • Communicate to the hierarchy anomalies (BBD, ruptures, error handling ...);
  • Participate in inventories;
  • Perform cleaning, washing and sanitation of premises and equipment at the end of each shift;
  • Empty trash (cardboard, inedible food and other waste);

Profile:

Warehouse Manager requirements and qualifications

  • Commercial Driverâ€™s License
  • Forklift Operation Certification.
  • Four years of experience as a Warehouse Manager or similar role
  • Ability to work overnight shifts.
  • Ability to manage inventory
  • Ability to analyze data and provide insights from data
  • Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
  • Team player
  • Good time-management skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Good knowledge of HACCP;
  • Have a bachelorâ€™s degree in business administration, logistics or relevant fields.

SALARY:  28.85

AVAILABLE POSITIONS: 1

CONTRACT: Permanent â€“ Full time

LOCALISATION:  Montreal, Dorval â€“ Canada

To apply, please send an e-mail at

dorval.rh@newrest.eu

with the following information:

Full name, email address, phone number, mailing address and mention the reference of the ad Warehouse Managerfor our Dorval Unit

PLEASE NOTE THAT ALL APPLICATIONS WITHOUT A CV WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.

PLEASE NOTE THAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR CANDIDATES WHO ARE ALREADY PRESENT IN CANADA WITH A VALID WORK DOCUMENT.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Job description

Glen Recruiters specializes in providing its clients with the best staffing for the Construction, Manufacturing and Warehousing industries. We are the next evolution of professional recruitment firms, partnering with companies across all industry sectors to achieve their objective of finding the best talent for their unique needs. Our personalized, hands-on approach and exclusive video technology greatly shorten the hiring cycle for employers and for job seekers.

We are currently seeking professional Warehouse Manager for an immediate start!!!

Are you looking for a career or industry change? Do you have excellent communication skills, a positive attitude and operational knowledge? Are you looking for another source of income or a full-time position with dependable weekly hours?

The you might be the ideal candidate for this position. Warehouse staff is responsible for the safe, accurate and clean handling of customerâ€™s inventory as it relates to paperwork supplied by office staff and with the safe use by licensed Material Handling Equipment (MHE) operators. This includes accountability for inbound and outbound moves, offloading and loading vehicles, addressing exceptions and logging issues. Location of work can be both onsite and offsite as required and assigned. Cleaning areas of the warehouse and other duties as assigned.

 

*Urgent* *Starting Immediately* Warehouse Manager

__________________________________________________________________

Qualifications:

  • 3 years experience overseeing operations in air/ ocean/ truck/ rail/ warehousing
  • Experience in all areas above not required but are an asset and will be used in the role. Willingness to learn areas without experience is a must.
  • Ability to safely lift up to 35 pounds (approx. 23 kgs) on a regular basis
  • Forklift certification is an asset
  • Strong Time Management- ability to prioritize tasks and multitask in a fast-paced environment.
  • Sense of Urgency, Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are a must.
  • Strong communication skills- verbal and written
  • Ability to remain calm under stressful situations, work under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Office product- including Excel, Word and Outlook
  • Proactive, Positive, Enthusiastic and self driven.

 

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Manual as well as use of MHE for inventory movement and handling of various types of items such as cartons, skidded goods, unpackages items, tubs/pails, etc. on behalf of customers in a safe manor and using safe operating /handling techniques.
  • Equipment to be used is manual and powered such as pump trucks, two-wheel dollies, counterbalance and reach machines for material handling. Other equipment can be computer based such as laptops with RF scanners or when needed use of System connected RF scanners.
  • Using documents supplied from the office, match documents to items as needed and process accordingly for inbound and outbound services as required. Note necessary details for every order as required for billing purposed such as # of cartons and/or skids used.
  • Notify office staff of any and all exceptions with respect to shipments to be handled and any issues that may arise, not issues as well on paperwork as applicable.
  • Warehouse cleanliness is key for safe operation of equipment to reduce possible damage to equipment due to debris.
  • Perform regular and/or required inventory counts and stock checks
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

 

Salary based on skills, experience, and certifications.

How to apply:

If you are interested in this opportunity, please send us your resume on indeed with your contact information

Expected start date: Immediate

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Job Types: Full-time

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $50,000 to $70,0000 per year; flexible for the ideal candidate.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$70,000.00 per year
