title: Operations Engineer
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Lonza Kingston is hiring a Operations Engineer. In this position you will be responsible for providing engineering solutions, identifying, sourcing, and bridging new and existing manufacturing technologies that can create efficiencies of scale. You will be responsible for process design and manufacturing process optimization. This is a hands-on position where you will be expected to identify requirements and source equipment and develop metrics for evaluating technologies. You will lead the facility’s calibration/maintenance program by performing, coordinating and documenting instrument calibrations and maintenance activities while assuring strict adherence to ISO and cGMP requirements. You will be expected to work in a high performing, cross-functional team with the goal of driving innovation in the development of scalable processes related to the manufacture of high end laboratory medical equipment and Single-Use-Products.

Key responsibilities:

1. Manufacturing 

  • Support the design, procurement and delivery of automation, fixtures and tooling to support product manufacturing and operational excellence execution 
  • Support all manufacturing equipment and process qualification activities while working closely with the MSAT department. 
  • Perform continuous improvement actions to ensure process reliability and COGS reduction targets 
  • Support manufacturing process planning 
  • Initiate actions to prevent the occurrence of any nonconformance relating to products or processes 
  • Complete/Coordinate the completion of associated cGMP production documentation including drawings, design specifications, acceptance testing, batch records, SOPs, PFMEA, Non-Conformances, ECN, etc. 

2. Process 

  • Analyze processes for improvement and scalability, and utilize background and expertise to establish and optimize new processes for eventual incorporation into large scale cGMP high end laboratory medical equipment and Single-Use-Product manufacturing processes 
  • Perform process capability and gap analysis 
  • Utilize technology and Lean design methodologies to improve process efficiency 
  • Improve process control and reduce COGS by utilizing automation 
  • Provide engineering solutions that maximize process efficiency and improve quality performance of the assigned processes 

3. Equipment 

  • Responsible for the maintenance and calibration program per ISO9001, ISO 13485 requirements and ISO 10012 guidelines 
  • Develop specifications for equipment and process improvement initiatives 
  • Troubleshoots equipment and processes to resolve issues that may arise during manufacturing  
  • Maintain accurate and up to date records, including appropriate lab notebook recordings.  Capable of achieving deliverables in a timely fashion 
  • Maintain a working knowledge of calibration fundamentals and hands-on experience in the day-to-day functions of the calibration equipment 
  • Use existing procedures to perform daily hands-on calibration work, ensuring calibrations are performed as scheduled and as defined by calibration program SOPs.  
  • Schedule, supervise and review maintenance/calibration activities with outside contractors 
  • Communicate with outside vendors and/or equipment manufacturers for technical support and to obtain instrument specifications and/or testing procedures for instrumentation 
  • Perform other duties as assigned. 

Key requirements:

  • Bachelor of Science degree or equivalent in Engineering and 1-3 years’ experience in a cGMP manufacturing facility preferred  
  • Hands-on experience with scalable manufacturing concepts and methodologies 
  • Passion for new engineering technologies and innovation 
  • Experience with manufacturing equipment/automated systems  
  • Experience with maintenance and calibration systems 
  • Experience in process improvement plans and process mapping 
  • Familiarity with cGMPs, ISO9001, ISO13485, ISO10012 and FDA regulatory guidelines  
  • Computer skills, MS Office, SolidEedge/SolidWorks 
  • Knowledge in calibration and use of metrology measuring and testing equipment for the purpose of calibrating and adjusting instruments 
  • Analytical and mathematical skills 
  • Detail orientation; keen sense for data integrity and accuracy 
  • Through and clear documentation, communication abilities 
  • Systematic and organized workflow 
  • Independent task management and ability to make decisions 
  • Ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing 

Every day, Lonza's products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Directeur de service
description:
Établi au Québec depuis près de 25 ans, notre client est une entreprise familiale spécialisée dans la distribution d’équipement industriel. Nous recherchons actuellement un Directeur de service pour son usine située à Drummondville.


Ce que notre client vous offre :

  • Une carrière stimulante dans une entreprise dynamique et humaine;
  • Une ambiance amicale et stimulante;
  • Des équipements à la fine pointe de la technologie;
  • Des assurances médicales et voyages;
  • Possibilité de cotiser au REER et de recourir à un système de bonification;
  • Des vacances payées par l'employeur.

DESCRIPTION DU POSTE

Relevant de la directrice générale, le titulaire du poste, en collaboration avec son équipe, verra à la planification, l’organisation et la gestion des activités opérationnelles du département technique.

Principales responsabilités :

  • Gérer et/ou développer l’ensemble des activités du département technique, justifier les résultats, documenter à l’aide de rapports ou documents de suivis;
  • Faire des recommandations à la direction sur les améliorations possibles à apporter au département;
  • Planifier, organiser, diriger, prioriser et optimiser les activités de son département afin d’atteindre l’autonomie et la rentabilité de ce dernier;
  • Développer et utiliser des outils de travail permettant la lecture des résultats et permettant une amélioration continue des processus;
  • Participer à la décision des objectifs de l’entreprise;
  • Vérifier, approuver et acheminer la facturation de main-d’œuvre auprès des clients;
  • Préparer et acheminer aux clients les devis de formation et les offres de service.

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

Pour mobiliser, développer et faire grandir son équipe, le candidat devra faire preuve d’un fort leadership, posséder d’excellentes habiletés de communication et de relations interpersonnelles. Gestionnaire éprouvé, le titulaire du poste démontre une grande capacité décisionnelle et est orienté à trouver des solutions aux problèmes tout en gardant un équilibre entre l’atteinte des résultats, la mobilisation des employés et les compétences techniques.

La nature de son travail demande une très grande capacité à gérer différents dossiers à la fois et à bien gérer le stress. Avec une attitude axée sur le service client, le candidat devra aussi faire preuve de professionnalisme, de rigueur et d’un sens de l’organisation élevé.

Qualifications :

  • Formation dans un domaine connexe;
  • Expérience d’au moins 5 ans en gestion de personnel;
  • Expérience dans la gestion d’un département technique;
  • Bilinguisme (français et anglais).

Le genre masculin a été utilisé dans le seul but d’en alléger le texte. Toutes les candidatures reçues seront traitées confidentiellement. Seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

title: Director of Service (Contract, Full Time)
description:
Director of Service

Are you looking for an inviting and exciting career opportunity? Do you want to positively contribute to an organization that serves the community? If the answer is “Yes!" this is the job for you!

Catholic Social Services is currently recruiting for a contract,full time, forty (40) hours per week, Director of Service to join our Immigration & Settlement Service in Edmonton, AB.

This position is a one (1) yearcontract (benefits eligible). Contract ending August 2023.

You will be joining an established Agency that is guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect. With more than 60 years of service delivery, Catholic Social Services is one of the largest multi-function social services agencies in Canada, with more than 1800 staff, and hundreds of volunteers delivering 100+ programs throughout Edmonton and Central Alberta.

Job Summary:

Reporting to the Vice President of Service, the Director plans, organizes, and directs the activities of the various departments. This position is part of the Service senior leadership team that carries out the overall strategy to develop, implement, monitor and evaluate programs. The Director will promote traditional and non-traditional partnership approaches implementing initiatives designed to integrate services and utilize funding to maximize resources and service impact within the community. The Director ensures delivery of quality of services and compliance with regulatory and funding requirements. This includes planning and development of programs and procedures in accordance with the Agency mission. The Director will manage budgets, quality assurance and will play a large role in the ongoing support and development of the staff.

Job Duties

  • Proactively build and maintain strategic collaborations and coalitions of stakeholders beneficial to the Agency based on a strategic understanding of the Agency’s mandate and challenges.
  • Take a long-term view of the needs of the Agency when focusing on potential alignments.
  • Identify interdependencies, define priorities and drive resolution of issues across groups, as appropriate.
  • Create and participate in strategic alliances and partnerships with key stakeholders to better meet emerging and future client needs and enhance the Agency and/or sector’s long term strategy.
  • Work with funding agencies and representatives to ensure ongoing and sustainable funding for programs. Foresee obstacles, risks and opportunities for the Agency (with a long-term horizon) and act accordingly.
  • Defines issues, generates opinions and selects solutions that are consistent with the strategy and vision.
  • Scan, seek out and assesses information on potential future directions.
  • Oversee the general management and accountability requirements of a comprehensive group of programs, which includes program development, delivery and evaluation as well as budget preparation and setting and knowledge management.
  • Maintain awareness of the external and internal social/human service, political and economic landscapes.
  • Stays knowledgeable about current legislation and policies affecting newcomers, including refugees, immigrants, temporary foreign works and others.
  • Collaborate with other members of the Service Leadership team to promote the Agency’s mission by identifying and developing programs/services to meet current and future needs of newcomers and communities.
  • Engage others in order to accomplish organizational goals and strategies, with a commitment to succession planning.
  • Attract, develop, coach, and retain high-performance team members, empowering them to elevate their level of responsibility, span of control and performance.
  • Delegate full authority and responsibility with the latitude to do a task in their own way in order to develop specific characteristics, including the opportunity to make and learn from mistakes in a non-critical setting.
  • Encourage others to assess their strengths and weaknesses, career goals, and strategies for achieving them.
  • Together with the Vice President, will have overall responsibility for the Service resource allocation, including staffing, financial and property.
  • Develop the necessary systems, processes, protocols and tools to better support the facilitation, collection and sharing of knowledge that is generated by the programs.
  • Ensure Service activities comply with organizational requirements for quality management, legal compliance and client services.
  • Recognize the inherent risks involved in the delivery of social service programming and able to identify, evaluate and develop strategies to mitigate risk while maintaining quality service delivery and care.
  • Keep the Vice President informed of the department’s operations, including strategies to respond to emerging and evolving program and operation needs.
  • Participate in the recruitment and appointment of Service Program Managers.
  • Convene, conduct and ensure serious occurrences and internal investigations are completed in accordance with Agency protocols and expectations.
  • Manage high-risk, complex, sensitive and multidisciplinary issues.
  • Prepare/coordinate multiple funding proposals and applications and interim and final reports.
  • Be familiar with funding, contract and accountability obligations and requirements.
  • Have experience with the management of multiple immigrant and refugee services.
  • Contributing to a communication strategy, supporting website updates/development and social media promotion.
  • Commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion development initiatives.

Requirements

Education & Experience

  • Master degree in related human services discipline or equivalent.
  • An experienced leader with 7 years or more of progressive leadership in a social services organization, with multi-site programs and services, multiple funders, including the immigrant settlement and refugee serving sector.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced cross-cultural and diverse environment.

Skills and Abilities:

  • The ideal candidate will have a track record of effectively leading a performance-based and outcomes based multiple program and staff. The individual will demonstrate maturity, self-awareness and insightfulness and possesses high ethical standards and an uncompromising sense of integrity.
  • Strategic thinker who is able to analyze internal and external environmental factors in order to identify current and future opportunities, challenges and risks and ensure ongoing service excellence
  • The ideal candidate will be passionate about the mission of the Catholic Social Services and understands the intricacies of the nonprofit sector, including the immigrant settlement sector.
  • Be a voice/advocate for Catholic Social Services, is a persuasive, credible and an effective communicator, including experience with public speaking and media relations
  • Be a strong negotiator, problem solver and possess excellent conflict resolution skills and have experience in solving complex issues.
  • Knowledgeable about immigration, settlement and adjustment issues affecting newcomers.

Please apply online at www.cssalberta.ca/careers to competition number 2745.

Closing date for Applications: May 11, 2022

The successful candidate must be able to travel to various locations, have a valid driver’s license and possess a vehicle. They will have ability to travel, with some overnight stays, if required.

If you are a strategic leader who consistently provides high quality and effective results, please submit your application today.

We offera competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package and a supportive working environment.

Police Information Check, Intervention Record Check and/or summary of driving record are conditions of employment and the financial responsibility of the candidate.

We embrace diversity and offer equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless of origin, culture, ethnicity, age, ability, gender identity, sexual orientation, and people of faith or no faith.

We thank all applicants. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: 2181 - Therapeutic Recreationist
description:
Company Description

We are a private, non-profit organization committed to providing top quality accommodations and care to senior citizens.  We offer a variety of living arrangements to fit the needs of our residents including, long term care, supportive housing apartments, and wellness suites. We also have a strong mandate to meet their social, physical, health and spiritual needs.  

We pride ourselves on our ability to really live our Mission of Excellence, Love and Dignity, both with residents and staff.   We provide a work environment where teamwork, staff involvement and personal development are essential for success.  Our staff, leadership, and Board are progressive thinkers and supportive of each other.  We offer competitive benefits, excellent challenges, and opportunities.

Our Mission:  To provide with excellence, love, and dignity a full continuum of affordable housing and services to senior citizens. We serve seniors who wish to live in a community of Christian faith.

Job Description

Job Posting # 2181
Radiant Care Pleasant Manor
Therapeutic Recreationist
Casual, Permanent

Hourly Wage Range:   $19.96 - $21.75

General
A Casual Permanent Therapeutic Recreationist position is being offered in the Radiant Care Pleasant Manor Therapeutic Recreation department. The start date of this position is to be determined.

Qualifications

Qualifications for this position include, but are not limited to,

  • Training and education in recreation/leisure services, Therapeutic Recreation or Kinesiology from a recognized community college or university as per Ministry of Health standards
  • Excellent oral and written communication
  • Computer skills and proficiency in MS Word, Excel
  • Experience in recreation programming and planning
  • Montessori training, or knowledge of Montessori approaches/theories would be an asset

Eligibility and Selection Criteria
This posting has been posted within Radiant Care Pleasant Manor and externally.  Internal applicants will be given priority based on seniority. External candidate selection will be made based on interviews. While we thank each applicant for applying, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 



Additional Information

Duties and Responsibilities

Some responsibilities include, but are not limited to,

  • Assists in identifying and assessing the resident’s needs and developing activities and programs in collaboration with the Therapeutic Recreation Supervisor
  • Encourages and records resident participation in programs
  • Assist with the creation of monthly activity calendars
  • Attend team conferences, as required
  • Ability to coordinate volunteers to compliment programs, as required
  • Collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to achieve program objectives
  • Participates in multi-disciplinary Resident Care Plan meetings to discuss resident response to programs, new admissions, special issues, and new goals
  • To establish and maintain a close liaison with all departments, volunteers, families and participants in a team effort to provide total care for the resident
  • Maintains clinical documentation and records
  • Requisitions supplies and services for program activities
  • Other duties as assigned

 

We Offer

  • Competitive compensation
  • Medical, dental and vision benefits available for full-time and part-time employees
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan with matching Employer contribution
  • Paid sick days for full-time and part-time employees
  • Paid Orientation
  • Flexible Scheduling for Casual employees
  • Free onsite parking
  • Training in Montessori Methods for Dementia Care (Staging environments & engaging residents in meaningful and purposeful activity to enhance quality of life)
  • Affordable access to our Fitness & Wellness Centre
  • Paid Covid-19 Vaccination
  • Full-time, part-time and casual positions
  • Excellent work environment
  • Our staff, leadership and Board are progressive and supportive

For more information about our home, please visit our website at: www.radiantcare.net

Radiant Care is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal employment opportunity.  If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation during any aspect of the selection process, please let Human Resources know by phone at (905) 934-2548. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

title: Operations Engineer
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Lonza Kingston is hiring a Operations Engineer. In this position you will be responsible for providing engineering solutions, identifying, sourcing, and bridging new and existing manufacturing technologies that can create efficiencies of scale. You will be responsible for process design and manufacturing process optimization. This is a hands-on position where you will be expected to identify requirements and source equipment and develop metrics for evaluating technologies. You will lead the facility’s calibration/maintenance program by performing, coordinating and documenting instrument calibrations and maintenance activities while assuring strict adherence to ISO and cGMP requirements. You will be expected to work in a high performing, cross-functional team with the goal of driving innovation in the development of scalable processes related to the manufacture of high end laboratory medical equipment and Single-Use-Products.

Key responsibilities:

1. Manufacturing 

  • Support the design, procurement and delivery of automation, fixtures and tooling to support product manufacturing and operational excellence execution 
  • Support all manufacturing equipment and process qualification activities while working closely with the MSAT department. 
  • Perform continuous improvement actions to ensure process reliability and COGS reduction targets 
  • Support manufacturing process planning 
  • Initiate actions to prevent the occurrence of any nonconformance relating to products or processes 
  • Complete/Coordinate the completion of associated cGMP production documentation including drawings, design specifications, acceptance testing, batch records, SOPs, PFMEA, Non-Conformances, ECN, etc. 

2. Process 

  • Analyze processes for improvement and scalability, and utilize background and expertise to establish and optimize new processes for eventual incorporation into large scale cGMP high end laboratory medical equipment and Single-Use-Product manufacturing processes 
  • Perform process capability and gap analysis 
  • Utilize technology and Lean design methodologies to improve process efficiency 
  • Improve process control and reduce COGS by utilizing automation 
  • Provide engineering solutions that maximize process efficiency and improve quality performance of the assigned processes 

3. Equipment 

  • Responsible for the maintenance and calibration program per ISO9001, ISO 13485 requirements and ISO 10012 guidelines 
  • Develop specifications for equipment and process improvement initiatives 
  • Troubleshoots equipment and processes to resolve issues that may arise during manufacturing  
  • Maintain accurate and up to date records, including appropriate lab notebook recordings.  Capable of achieving deliverables in a timely fashion 
  • Maintain a working knowledge of calibration fundamentals and hands-on experience in the day-to-day functions of the calibration equipment 
  • Use existing procedures to perform daily hands-on calibration work, ensuring calibrations are performed as scheduled and as defined by calibration program SOPs.  
  • Schedule, supervise and review maintenance/calibration activities with outside contractors 
  • Communicate with outside vendors and/or equipment manufacturers for technical support and to obtain instrument specifications and/or testing procedures for instrumentation 
  • Perform other duties as assigned. 

Key requirements:

  • Bachelor of Science degree or equivalent in Engineering and 1-3 years’ experience in a cGMP manufacturing facility preferred  
  • Hands-on experience with scalable manufacturing concepts and methodologies 
  • Passion for new engineering technologies and innovation 
  • Experience with manufacturing equipment/automated systems  
  • Experience with maintenance and calibration systems 
  • Experience in process improvement plans and process mapping 
  • Familiarity with cGMPs, ISO9001, ISO13485, ISO10012 and FDA regulatory guidelines  
  • Computer skills, MS Office, SolidEedge/SolidWorks 
  • Knowledge in calibration and use of metrology measuring and testing equipment for the purpose of calibrating and adjusting instruments 
  • Analytical and mathematical skills 
  • Detail orientation; keen sense for data integrity and accuracy 
  • Through and clear documentation, communication abilities 
  • Systematic and organized workflow 
  • Independent task management and ability to make decisions 
  • Ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing 

Every day, Lonza's products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Marine Modal Manager
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

The Marine Modal Manager for the Western Region is an execution-oriented position with the primary goals of ensuring that Lafarge ships the right cementitious product to the right location in accordance with demand-driven shipment schedules, as well as ensuring that the marine fleet and assets are maintained to the proper condition in line with legal and operational requirements. As such, the Modal Manager will work closely with freight carriers and the Supply Chain team. This position will also be the regional Supply Chain Team’s single point of contact for plant shipping personnel for marine-related topics.  Additionally, the Marine Modal Manager will support the RFP process by defining service requirements and reviewing bids.

Responsibilities

Safety Culture:

  • Promote safety culture through engagement with employees, JHSC and subcontractors, implementation and management of local and regional initiatives with an objective of “zero” safety incidents
  • Administer, promote and review safety policies, processes and procedures to maintain relevance while ensuring the site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
  • Has ownership of the implementation and management of all local and regional safety initiatives, providing feedback as necessary

Operational:

  • Manage all outbound and a portion of inbound shipment activity for assigned transportation mode
  • Operate in accordance with the Jones Act and the Coasting Trade Act
  • Operate as single point of contact for plant shipping personnel for marine-related topics
  • Manage demurrage for assigned transportation mode
  • Report performance and elevate service issues
  • Manage assets – regular maintenance as well as major program work for barges as well as dock facilities
  • Ensure that marine movements are maximized in order to drive down cost of delivery.
  • Maintain relationships with vendors.
  • Liaise with Aggregate Marine division.
  • Work with vendors, plants and terminals to optimize loading and unloading through process and equipment improvement.
  • Maintain data for respective mode within the region (freight rates, fuel surcharges, asset costs, cycle times, etc)
  • Maintain awareness of modal business, including competitors’ distribution situation 

Relationships with Others Functions:

  • Works closely with sales, manufacturing and logistics team
  • Works closely with plant staff, quality and area safety staff 

Specific Accountabilities:

  • Accurate and timely transportation scheduling
  • Modal compliance to plan
  • Cost performance of assigned mode
  • Optimal asset utilization
  • Support of business and financial analysis
  • On time performance
  • Cycle time
  • Promotes safety culture
  • Develops and implements effective maintenance systems
  • Provide key operational data and analysis
  • Ensure best practices are implemented, utilized and supported
  • Assist with capital planning and status reporting

Qualifications

Education/Work Experience:

  • Three to five years of relevant work experience
  • Post-secondary Degree

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Excellent organizational and planning skills, process-oriented
  • Understanding of pneumatic conveyance systems an asset
  • Strong analytical skills, research, problem solving and decision making
  • Deep knowledge of a specific mode and working knowledge of other modes of transport
  • Proficiency with various computer applications is a definite asset
  • Good written and verbal communications
  • Knowledge of fleet maintenance management

Knowledge of applicable regulationsAs part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Director, Fleet Services & Assets
description:
We Are The Employer Brand of Choice.It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for a Director, Fleet Services & Assets in London - Kitchener/Waterloo.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Position Overview

Reporting directly to the President, the Director, Fleet Service and Assets is responsible for a wide spectrum of responsibilities dealing with company vehicles & maintenance facilities and must be able to multitask with ease and proficiency. This position will be based in SW Ontario (London – Kitchener/Waterloo) but have accountability for our garage and third party operations throughout Ontario.

Who Is Your Boss?

You report to a leader who appreciates your ability to lead with emotional intelligence and intuition. They expect you to ask questions, try, take risks and make mistakes. Knowing that numbers do not get past you inspire their confidence; and, the assurance that you will never put in a process that is detrimental to the team secures their trust!

Primary Responsibilities

1. Procurement & Asset Management

  • Establish and oversee the strategic management of physical assets (mainly fleet and facilities) of the
  • company, including procurement, replacement and disposal.
  • Assesses divisional vehicles for replacement
  • Optimizes the use of the fleet throughout the lifecycle
  • Establish service standards, policies and procedures
  • Negotiates parts/fluids/tools/services with vendors & manufacturers
  • Performs vendor visits/reviews

2. Maintenance

  • Ensures maintenance of Company vehicles in accordance with established standards and policies
  • Ensure the safety, availability and reliability of the fleet
  • Controls the maintenance costs
  • Reviews of all maintenance schedules on an annual basis
  • Obtains estimates, issue work order, purchase order or insurance work order
  • Coordinates all shop maintenance outsourcing and outside garage work
  • Coordinates vehicle repairs; liaise with insurance
  • Obtains vehicle/component warranties
  • Responsible for overseeing Fleet Services’ garage locations and physical facilities

3. Financial

  • Collect, analyze, and present key performance indicators related to fleet services to management and operations
  • Inventory management
  • Responsible for Fleet Services’ budgets and actual results
  • Provides a long-term view of vehicle replacement capital expenditures and vehicle operational expenditures according to fleet projections.

4. Leadership

  • Accountable for a team of licensed mechanics and administrative support staff in multiple locations
  • Completion of a University or College education or equivalent in a relevant field of study
  • 5-7 years experience in a similar role
  • 310S or 310T license is an asset but not required
  • Experience working in a management capacity
  • Leadership skills
  • Computer literate in MS Office
  • Analytical skills for evaluating shop operation processes
  • Familiar with Health & Safety Act and National Safety Code
  • Knowledge of procurement policies

Why work for us?

  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Competitive Benefit Offering
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Award Winning
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)

Sounds interesting? Please send your resume and salary expectations directly to Sandra Grant, VP Human Resources at sandra.grant@voyago.ca

Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Transportation Manager
description:
Transportation Manager

 

With approximately 3300 employees, JBS Food Canada ULC (“JBS Canada”) is one of Canada's largest beef processors. Consisting of four locations—the main processing facility located in Brooks, Alberta, where approximately 4,200 head of cattle are harvested and processed daily; the Head Office and a case ready plant, both based in Calgary, Alberta; and JBS Ontario, a case ready plant located in Belleville, Ontario. The JBS Canada facility in Brooks has the capacity to produce products ranging from boxed beef primals, ground beef, beef trimmings, beef by-products and hides which are shipped across Canada and worldwide. At the multi-protein Mountain Creek Farms case-ready facility in Calgary, JBS Canada produces value-added products including marinated, portion sized, multi-pack options, kebabs and much more. JBS Ontario in Belleville produces fresh meat and seafood products for leading retailers in Canada.

We are currently seeking a Transportation Manager to lead the logistics and transportation requirements for all JBS Canada products. You will coordinate with vendors to manage logistics activities to meet service level expectations.

 

This role will work closely with JBS’s freight providers and internal teams to maintain a reliable and scalable logistics operation that functions on an international scale. With an understanding of North American transportation and trade compliance, you will make sure that JBS can provide a predictable delivery experience for all shipments. This role will also serve as the trade compliance subject matter expert, providing support related to all logistics activities ensuring JBS’s compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and best practices.

 

The ideal candidate has expertise working in a global environment with a proven track record of working in Logistics or other supply chain groups. The person in this role will be required to work in a demanding and fast-changing environment, demonstrate speedy decision-making to meet aggressive deadlines, and drive effective communication with senior stakeholders. Proficiency in logistics and supply chain processes and the skill to work independently to drive results are key requirements to be successful in this role.


You will:

  • Lead the organization’s Performance Improvement plan and Operational Efficiency initiatives; ensuring a data-driven and results oriented approach that supports successful execution of company strategic objectives.
  • Provide leadership for direct reports that both maximize and optimize resources in support of the company’s goals and objectives in serving customers.
  • Ensure that performance goals are set and achieved, through the proper execution of performance metrics as it relates to Productivity, Safety, Quality and Customer Service.
  • Oversee the development and management of carrier contracts, negotiations and relationships to provide industry leading competitive rates, programs and exceptional customer service.
  • Resolve internal problems or complaints and problems or complaints with carriers/customers
  • Plan, examine, analyze and evaluate day-to-day operations in respect to supporting procedures, quality standards, and customer expectations.
  • Ensure quality shipment data from origin to end-delivery.
  • Develop and oversee, JBS policies, systems and procedures necessary to support cost reduction and system utilization goals (KPI’s).
  • Develop and maintain KPI’s for quality, quantity, shipments, inventory, delivery times, transportation costs and efficiency
  • Manage expenses to budget and forecast.
  • Participate in and support business reviews with service providers; drive corrective actions, if necessary, based on performance.
  • Review and research with new and existing transportation vendors; programs to reduce, replace and improve upon transportation costs.

 

You Have:

  • A Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, or another related field preferred
  • 3 plus years of experience in Logistics; at least 3 years of supervisory experience
  • Experience with perishable goods
  • Knowledge of SAP or similar ERP system preferred
  • A proven track record in developing new processes and bringing about change and improvement without major disruption to the business
  • Strong people management and supervisory skills
  • Strong analytical skills with high proficiency in Excel; ability to tell a compelling story through data
  • Process driven mentality, with the ability to plan, be strategic, and execute operationally on a regular basis
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to distill large amounts of information into concise summaries

 

Exceptional Benefits including:

 

Competitive Wage | Relocation Assistance | Extended Health/Medical Benefit | Group Life & Accidental Death Insurance | Short/Long Term Disability | Vision/Dental Care | Employee Beef Purchasing Program | Voluntary Employee RRSP Contributions | Employer RRSP Contributions | Medical Clinic on-site | Career Growth and Continued Training

 

JBS Food Canada ULC

PO Box 1868, Brooks, AB

www.jbsfoodcanada.ca

title: Senior Project Manager, Rail & Transit Sector
description:
Overview:

TYLin is a full-service, professional engineering firm focused on the planning, design, and construction of infrastructure solutions for public and private clients worldwide. The firm is an internationally recognized pioneer in solving the most difficult engineering challenges. Headquartered in San Francisco, California for over 65 years, TYLin has more than 3,200 professionals throughout the Americas, Asia, and Europe. TYLin is a member of Dar Group, a global, privately-owned professional services group, and its industry-leading family of Global Infrastructure companies.  

 

This is a key position, requiring a demonstrated seller/doer and top performer who is well established in the Greater Toronto Area marketplace. This position requires experience in transportation practice growth, broader team development, and a sound understanding of the transportation market and project delivery. The individual must demonstrate leadership in the pursuit of transportation projects such as bus rapid transit, transit corridor (rail and bus), operation and maintenance facilities, and â€œgreeningâ€ modes. This individual will collaborate company-wide on strategic transit and transportation pursuits and as needed, support delivery of those projects. The duties include client development, proposal support, and management of projects and project teams.

Responsibilities:

Project Functions

  • Provides a significant contribution to winning projects as Project Manager or key team member. Serve as Project Manager on projects where beneficial to the Company and the project; and assume the financial, staffing, scope and schedule management responsibilities of that role.
  • Has demonstrated experience and can serve as key technical lead in planning, design, and/or construction management of significant rail related projects.
  • Lead responsibility for the preparation of the project proposals for rail/transit clients.
  • Directs the preparation, tracking and submission of the project deliverables.
  • Preparation and tracking of project schedules and delivery of projects on-time.
  • Preparation and tracking of project work tasks and budgets and delivery of projects within budgets.
  • Tracking of additional and out-of-scope work. Communication with clients, negotiation of fees for additional services and delivery of contract modifications for such services.
  • Client contact and communication. Managing Client expectations and assuring client satisfaction related to project.Supervision and coaching of other Project Managers and technical staff as required.
  • Responsible for project quality. Assures QA/QC processes are completed on each project.

Staff Development

  • Support and assistance in staff technical training.
  • Support in staff development.

Business Development/Marketing

  • Communicate TYLin capabilities, locally and nationally in delivering rail/transit projects. Cross geographic boundaries as required to support Sector project pursuits and delivery.
  • Identify potential markets, clients and opportunities. Participate in developing, executing and delivering local business plans for marketing existing and potential clients.
  • Develop/Maintain relationships with current and potential clients and teaming partners. Serve as Client Manager for certain clients, when requested.
  • Coordinate Business  Development and Marketing efforts with TYLinâ€™s local and area staff, and the Sector Leaders.
  • Participate in go/no-go decisions for projects.
  • Assist in and lead, when requested, delivery of winning proposals.
  • Proposal Preparation
  • Serve as lead on proposal preparation and delivery, when requested.
  • Prepare scope/schedule text.
  • Prepare/review fees estimates â€“ TYLin and Subconsultants.
  • Negotiation with staff, client and subconsultants.
Qualifications:
  • Requires Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Civil Engineering, Urban Planning or related field.
  • P. Eng. preferred but not required.
  • Must have strong Business Development experience with a proven track record of project management and business relationships in the transit industry, especially in the Greater Toronto area.
  • Successful candidate will have a history of developing and maintaining effective business relationships with clients and peers.
  • Excellent verbal and written and presentation skills are required.
  • Client focused, always striving to give clients the best solutions.
  • Strong commitment to innovation by creating new and better ways to solve clientsâ€™ toughest challenges.
  • High levels of integrity, always doing the right thing in an ethical, fair, and sustainable way.
  • Demonstrated experience of collaboration in a diverse and inclusive team, working together toward technical excellence.

 

TYLin is an equal opportunity employer and we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type as protected by federal, state, or local laws. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. TYLin remains committed to complying with all local health authority, legal or lawful client requirements, as such this role may be situated in a jurisdiction with masking or vaccinate or test requirements to attend office or client locations (controlled location). You should ask your manager about this prior to starting. Should you be subject to the requirements, you are required to disclose your vaccination status within the first week of starting or before entering a controlled location, whichever comes first.    In addition to the above, we ask that applicants in Canada, please note the following:,  TYLin is committed to employment equity and providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (â€˜AODAâ€™). If you require accommodation for a disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources at  

hr-careers@us.tylin.com

.

title: Terminal Manager Trainee Western Canada
description:
Company Description

Manitoulin Transport has the most extensive transportation network in North America, making it easy to provide dependable on-time delivery and faster transit times. Sustained by its 60 years experience, Manitoulin developed the transportation knowledge that is relied on and trusted by clients in various industries.

Job Description

  We are open to training an individual for Western Canada, but that training could take place in the East. This program has successfully produced many Terminal Managers in our network which is why we are again looking to develop someone. You will learn the LTL business during training of approximately 6 months, to 1 year. Please only apply if you are willing to be relocated as there will be assistance for a move. Some skills you will learn, or refine your knowledge of, are: -Daily P&D operations -Managing Daily Terminal Operations -Ensuring Health & Safety Standards are followed -Controlling and maintaining financial targets -Monitor and control of daily reports -Working closely with customer base -Ensuring Service Standards targets are met -Ensuring Health & Safety standards are met -Training of Terminal staff as required -Other duties as assigned  

    Trainees perform a combination of observation, actual work experience and leadership soft skills training. Each individual will gain exposure to the different facets of the business. Some time will be spent in the field with Sales, Operations, and other business units. The program also includes external training courses specific to enhancing each trainee’s management potential.

 

Qualifications

We are looking for high potential candidates with the following skills and qualifications:

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Organizational skills and time management

• Ability to work well under pressure

• Flexible with hours of work • Maintain a professional image

TDG Certified

Forklift Certification

 • Eager and willing to learn

 • Excellent problem solving skills • Leadership experience • Knowledge of the Transportation Industry would be considered an asset



Additional Information

As an Operations Professional with The Manitoulin Group of Companies, your career will have many benefits, including:

  • Profit Sharing
  • Incentive Bonus
  • Comprehensive Benefits
  • Excellent Salary

Each individual will gain exposure to the different facets of the business. Some time will be spent in the field with Sales, Operations, and other business units. The program also includes external training courses specific to enhancing each trainee’s management potential.']

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Grow With Us!

 

Hudson is North America's leading travel retailer. For over 30 years, Hudson has met the needs and wants of travelers in more than 1,000 duty-free, duty-paid, and food & beverage stores. We couldn’t serve our customers, landlords, and partners in airports, commuter terminals, hotels, and casinos without the continued support of our greatest assets: our team members. We’re dedicated to hiring and training exceptional team members, who are committed to serving the customer as the Traveler’s Best Friend. We strive to ensure we’re fulfilling our team members' career potentials through training, skills development, and career pathways – as our team members grow and succeed both personally and professionally, so does Hudson.


What We Will Offer You:

  • A 20% off Hudson Employee Discount
  • A 50% off Hudson Food & Beverage Discount

This Warehouse Manager Job Is For You, If You Would Enjoy:

  • Assisting the General Manager by managing and executing all activities of the warehouse in support of the overall Duty Free and Duty Paid operation
  • Promoting an overall corporate image of excellence through a strong work ethic, leadership by example, and the consistent delivery of excellent customer service throughout the warehouse operation at Calgary International Airport.

Your Team is counting on you as a Warehouse Manager to:

  • Able to work any shift within the hours of 7 am and 5 pm on weekdays, weekend and holidays
  • Work additional hours as needed
  • Able to work a full-time schedule
  • Must have open and flexible availability


Warehouse Manager Key Accountabilities:

  • Protects all company assets in the warehouse including non-stock merchandise
  • Provides a safe and clean environment for warehouse personnel
  • Recruits and trains warehouse personnel
  • Schedules warehouse operational hours to accommodate business requirements
  • Supervises and delegates tasks to warehouse employees
  • Places stock orders as required
  • Counts and receives incoming merchandise; reports shortages/overages to vendors in a timely manner, before required deadlines
  • Counts and completes all appropriate paperwork for merchandise returns to vendors
  • Adjusts prices (mark ups/ mark downs) as per the General Manager's instructions. Provides ongoing stock replenishment to the sales floor
  • Isolates, sorts, and organizes all damaged and outdated products for subsequent supplier credits and returns
  • Arranges monthly meetings with sales representatives to provide information to the General Manager regarding new products on the market and to obtain credit for damaged/outdated products
  • Organizes all preparatory work for quarterly press counts and annual inventory


Required Qualifications:

  • Leadership qualities and demonstrated organizational skills
  • Good time-management skills and problem-solving abilities
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Ability to lift 30 kg/60 lbs
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • 1 to 3 years of previous warehouse managerial experience
  • Proficiency with SAP or similar inventory management program



Some of our company-offered benefits for you and your family include:

  • Health & Well Being: Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Various Personal and Parental Leave Programs
  • Universal Life Insurance
  • Retirement Programs & Matching Employee Contributions: 401K & RRSP
  • Hudson Employee 20% Off Discount
  • Employee Recognition & Anniversary Programs
  • Training, Development, and Growth Opportunities
  • Tuition Assistance & Scholarship Programs


Hudson is an Equal Opportunity Employer of all qualified individuals. All employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, military leave or veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace in which we value diversity and unique experiences, backgrounds and identities.

Depending on the location of the position, applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States or Canada for any employer. All offers are contingent upon successful completion and passing of background checks and/or employment verification results.

Note to staffing agencies: Please do not contact Hudson (including the recruitment team or any hiring managers) regarding this position with candidates. If assistance is needed in filling any position for Hudson, a member of our recruiting team will reach out directly.

title: Assistant Warehouse Manager
description:
Overview:

LEONâ€™S IS NOW HIRING AN ASSISTANT WAREHOUSE MANAGER

WITH CANADAâ€™S MOST SUCCESSFUL HOME FURNISHING RETAILER, THEREâ€™S NO LIMIT TO WHERE YOU CAN GO!

Leonâ€™s Furniture Ltd. is a family-owned, publicly traded company that has been a part of Canadian homes, and families for more than a century. We are committed to providing our dedicated associates with secure jobs, and a safe and satisfying work environment, and will strive to support their ongoing pursuit of personal development and career advancement.

Presently, Leonâ€™s is looking for talented applicants for the position of Assistant Warehouse Manager.
The ideal candidate has the drive and determination to continue to make Leonâ€™s the number one choice for the Canadian consumer, and shares our core values, which are deeply embedded in our culture and reflected in our actions: Honesty. Integrity. Hard work. Family.  

RESPONSIBILITIES

Supporting the warehouse manager in:

  • Ensuring the smooth operation of a busy warehouse with several areas of responsibility, including: shipping and receiving, inventory, delivery, merchandising, packaging and maintenance
  • Managing the warehouse team
  • Ensuring the accurate and secure handling of product; balancing a large inventory
  • Overseeing maintenance and ensuring safe operation of lift trucks, warehouse bins, delivery trucks, service vehicles
  • Training and people development
  • Interviewing and hiring
  • Scheduling; ensuring provincial legislative requirements met
  • Completing, reviewing and distributing warehouse reports regularly
  • Resolving customer issues; ensuring safe delivery of product
  • Ensuring company policies and procedures are met
  • Ensuring general safety and security of store and employees
  • Chairing Health and Safety and warehouse meetings
  • Other duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS

  • High energy
  • Strong leadership and people skills
  • Ability to train and develop others to succeed
  • Goal oriented
  • Ambitious and eager to grow
  • Willingness to relocate advantageous but not necessary
  • And most importantly, a POSITIVE ATTITUDE!

WHY LEONâ€™S?

  • On-going training and development to ensure your success
  • A  fast-paced, dynamic, and fun environment with a  great team
  • A generous employee discount program
  • Profit sharing

 

ONE SIMPLE CLICK COULD CHANGE YOUR LIFE. APPLY NOW

title: Shipping and Receiving Manager
description:
Shipping and Receiving Manager – Amico Group of companies
 
We offer many opportunities for advancement within the Amico Group of Companies, along with a comprehensive benefit package, employer paid vacation, management approved tuition reimbursement and an employee referral program. Our growing team at Amico Group of Companies is looking for a Shipping and Receiving Manager.
 
The successful candidate will be energetic, eager, driven, and able to deal with competing demands and timelines.

Responsibilities Include:
 
  • Effectively lead a team of shipping and receiving employees
  • Determine best method of shipment and prepare shipping documents.
  • Source new shipping companies, negotiate pricing and delivery times.
  • Continuous improvement of packing methods to ensure product arrives to destination without damage.
  • Assemble crates, pack goods to be shipped, and prepare identifying information and shipping instructions.
  • Oversee loading and unloading of goods from trucks, etc.
  • Inspect and verify incoming goods against invoices or other documents, record shortages and reject damaged goods.
  • Unpack and route goods to appropriate storage areas.
  • Maintain internal record-keeping systems.
  • Operate forklift or other equipment to load, unload, transport and store goods.
 
Qualifications:
 
  • Educational background in supply chain management or operations management studies.
  • At least 5 years of Management experience
  • At least 3-5 years of experience in Shipping and Receiving is must
  • Must possess excellent communication skills and be self-motivated.
  • Proficient in computer and MS Office products (Excel, Word, Outlook).
  • Ability to multitask, able to work well under pressure to meet tight deadlines.
  • Proficient computer and math skills and ability to learn new software.
 
Work Environment: Production (Warehouse environment)

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent
 
For more information, please visit us at www.amico.com

 *We respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from agencies.
 
 *Please note that potential candidates may be requested to provide 3 references

 *Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Parts and Warehouse Manager
description:
Company:

Finning Canada

Number of Openings:

1

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

The Warehouse Operations Manager is responsible for providing clear and effective leadership and demonstrating a healthy and safe work environment for all parts employees. Accountable for all operations related to the running of the Warehouse, execution and facilitating targeted levels of customer satisfaction, and the delivery of branch goals and objectives.

Job Description:

Safety Leadership

  • Lead, demonstrate and champion a healthy and safe work environment ensuring that all safety standards, policies, procedures and compliance requirements are communicated, implemented and followed.
  • Ensure that all safety practices and policies and compliance requirements are followed
  • Employees hold and maintain the appropriate safety training required for their position
  • Monthly spot audits are conducted and that at a minimum, safety TRIF and LTI targets are met, while always striving for zero
  • Ensure all training is completed and up to date for employees, updated in Workday
  • Performs site safety inspections and daily walkthroughs.

People Leadership

  • Demonstrate clear and effective leadership to Warehouse employees
  • Provide role and responsibility guidance, performance management, coaching, mentoring and training to support growth and development
  • Recruitment and selection of employees
  • Provide quality, timely feedback to employees through formal and informal conversations to support the performance management process
  • Share Employee Experience Survey (EES) results, solicit feedback, develop and post an action plan on the Action Planning website.
  • Provides feedback to the inventory control group on stock requirements to meet customer demands
  • Responsible for the day-to-day leadership of staff, orientation, coaching and mentoring, employee engagement, performance feedback and supporting growth and development opportunities.
  • Conduct performance conversations and provide timely feedback
  • Conduct yearly performance reviews for hourly employees
  • Lead a large group of salaried and unionized employees
  • Fill in for Manager, Regional Distribution Centre where needed

Results and Financial Management

  • Manage day-to-day warehouse operations, assets, finances including planning, managing and reporting of Warehouse financial results, assets and facilities requirements.
  • Responsible for reviewing the monthly metrics related to People, Quality, Velocity and Cost with Warehouse employees
  • Manage the successful execution of Finning’s Warehouse operational processes and customer service commitment within the branch
  • Direct timely resolutions to customer issues and goodwill settlements
  • Collaboration with sales and service leaders within the branch
  • Customer facing accountability for Warehouse related issues
  • Defining/changing/creating more efficient processes and procedures

Qualifications:

  • The desire to lead and manage people
  • Effective leadership / supervisory skills
  • Journeyperson Parts or Warehouse Certification
  • Three years of previous parts experience
  • Strong business acumen
  • Computer literate with knowledge of MS Office, Lawson
  • Thorough understanding of the union and Finning’s collective agreement.
  • WHMIS and TDG

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Company Description

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

The Warehouse Manager, reporting to the Real Property Services Manager, is a key member of the contract team at a historical remote location in the Canadian Arctic. In this position, you are responsible for maintaining proper warehouse orderliness for all infrastructure workshops and storage areas, ensuring that orders are tracked and not duplicated, records are maintained for all items received, and that materiel is stored in an orderly fashion on labelled shelves to facilitate inventory control. An 8 weeks on, 8 weeks off rotational schedule with flights to and from the worksite in Nunavut leaving from Trenton, Ontario. A unique opportunity to contribute to the operation of an entire community supporting members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

This position requires Government of Canada security clearance at the Reliability Status level.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Day-to-day operation and accountability for the contract site warehouse.
  • Procurement through Department of National Defense (DND) using DND processes and protocols.
  • Responsible for warehouse operations, such as expediting purchases, maintaining communications with vendors, receiving and verifying the accuracy of shipments, stocking shelves, and auditing documentation.
  • Playing a key role in the development, implementation and monitoring of effective processes and procedures in the warehouse.
  • Setup layout and space management; work organization chart; procedures such as SOP.
  • Manage stock control: the self-assured receipt, storage, retrieval and timely delivery of goods; shipment loading and transferring; document recording and data entry into system.
  • Plan, organize and control warehouse’s over-all operations.
  • Constantly plan out all warehouse resources and activities in relation to client contract statement of work and company objectives and set targets.
  • Responsible for weekly sustainment offloading and transport of material to the supply depot.
  • Perform monthly inventory and complete inventory count sheets and reports.
  • Responsible for life cycling of material, physical reorganization of material, completion.
  • Perform client directed tasks to assist with material verifications and maintenance of site storage locations.
  • Coordinate the disposal of and/or backhaul transportation of time expired, worn, redundant and scrap items from the warehouse.
Qualifications

  • Minimum Grade 12 education; however, preference will be given to individuals with a university or technical education background.
  • Completion of Material Handling and Management.
  • Must possess forklift operator license.
  • Current First Aid training certificate is an asset.
  • Ability to obtain Government of Canada security clearance at the Reliability Status level (requires a 5 year background check and Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency).
  • Ability to obtain fit-for-duty medical assessment from a physician.
  • Experience working in remote locations is an asset.
  • Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS Excel, MS Word, and inventory control software.
  • Punctual, reliable and schedule focused.
  • Experience with warehouse management system and experience with implementation processes.
  • Excellent communication, both written and oral.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Ability to problem solve and make decisions.
  • Excellent multi-tasking, time management and organizational skills.
  • Possess strong ability to develop and maintain positive interpersonal relationships, with the flexibility and ability to work independently with minimum supervision and within a team environment.
  • Inuit cultural awareness, knowledge and respect.
  • Flexibility to meet the unique requirements of the site including potential rotational shift changes and working after hours “on-call” duties.


Additional Information

  • An opportunity for work life balance. 8 weeks on and 8 weeks off allows you to use your time to do what you enjoy.
  • Continuous wage payment throughout your time off.
  • Competitive wages, benefits and an RSP matching program.
  • Retention Bonus of up to 10% of wages earned paid on the completion of a 2 year contract.
  • Paid travel time.
  • Unique experience in the northernmost continuously inhabited place in the world.
  • Training and development opportunities to help grow and diversify your career.
  • Transfer opportunities to other Dexterra sites across Canada.

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

*Please note this job is based in Alert, Nunavut, Canada.

title: Corporate Parts Warehouse Manager
description:
We have a position available for a Corporate Parts Warehouse Manager in our Monctonlocation.This position is responsible for managing all aspects of the Corporate Parts Warehouse operation and is responsible for its operational performance.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Shipping, receiving, and warehousing
    • Oversee the execution of all daily warehouse operations, including on-time order delivery, receiving inbound shipments, inventory control, and warehouse storage optimization
    • Apply and adjust the allocation of resources throughout the day based on current workload
    • Ensure all staff maintain a high degree of customer service during direct customer order pickup interactions
    • Collaborate with local branch management to coordinate and align daily activities to meet both branch and CPW operational requirements.
    • Perform regular workforce planning to meet all demands of the CPW
    • Investigate and resolve issues, as required, with shipping documentation
    • Alleviate operational issues and remove roadblocks for warehouse staff
    • Coordinate facility and equipment maintenance or repairs
  • Inventory control
    • Manage inventory control processes, such as cycle counting, following Brandt’s inventory control procedures
    • Work with key stakeholders in Corporate Parts Ordering and Value Parts to plan large inbound shipments to the CPW.
    • Resolve inventory discrepancies as they arise
    • Coordinate the annual physical inventory of all parts and related inventories
    • Perform regular analysis of inventory held in the CPW and collaborate with key stakeholders to optimize inventory held to support the Brandt branch network as well as manage warehouse space.
    • Execute weekly parts return process to Brandt’s OEM partners
  • Safety
    • Create and maintain a safe work environment by ensuring that company and OH&S standards are met in all interior and exterior areas of the operation
    • Participate in the local Joint Health & Safety Committee and drive a safety culture throughout the warehouse
    • Conduct regular Safety Talks with warehouse staff
    • Ensure 5S and general housekeeping standards are maintained throughout the facility
  • Financial management
    • Drive positive financial performance of the Corporate Parts Warehouse through management of operational expenses and cross-functional collaboration on parts stocking, part returns, and order fulfillment strategies
    • Contribute to the development of the annual operating budget and monitor the spend monthly
  • Employee supervision
    • Lead and supervise a warehouse team of approximately 6 employees on various shifts
    • Set employee performance goals, perform regular performance reviews, and document/address performance issues as required
    • Oversee employee training plans and provide ongoing coaching to all staff members
    • Implement and maintain compliance with HR and payroll policies, procedures, and practices, as well as general labour standards
  • Employee engagement
    • Conduct regular communication meetings with the warehouse staff to share warehouse performance metrics, project updates, and general corporate communications
    • Maintain an inclusive warehouse environment
    • Solicit and implement Continuous Improvement ideas generated by warehouse staff
  • 3-5 years of progressive work experience in warehouse and/or other supply chain operations, preferably in a medium to large sized warehouse
  • 2 years of direct supervisory experience in warehouse or other supply chain operations
  • Knowledge and skill in the operation of material handling equipment
  • Proven ability to organize work, set priorities, and achieve work-related goals
  • Strong leadership skills with an ability to delegate effectively
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Must be highly motivated, service-driven, and possess a professional attitude; demonstrates a strong customer service orientation and exercises sound judgment when dealing with internal and external customers
  • Must be able to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing
  • Experience working with a warehouse inventory management system required
  • Must possess a working knowledge of computer and web-based applications
  • Knowledge of Lean/5S principles would be considered an asset
  • Knowledge of or experience working with heavy equipment would be considered an asset
  • Completion of or interest in completing a professional designation in supply chain management considered an asset
  • Demonstrates a strong commitment to occupational health and safety
  • Must be able to travel as required
