title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Warehouse Manager (Branch Operations Lead).

Stallion express is growing and we are urgently hiring! Limited signing bonus of $3,000 (terms apply). Come grow your career with us!

We are looking for a dedicated Warehouse Operations Branch Manager to oversee our very first Montreal branch!

Location: Montreal, QC
Salary Range: $45,000 - $50,000
Work Hours: 11am - 7pm Monday to Friday or 12pm-8pm and possibly 12pm-4pm on Sundays as needed (Sundays are paid extra)

About Us:
  • Stallion Express is a Toronto-based company specializing in shipping and logistics solutions for online sellers. 
  • Our clients range from part-time eBay sellers to bigger eCommerce web stores, shipping hundreds of packages per day!
  • We’re a dynamic team working towards a common vision: To help Canadian sellers ship parcels at the lowest possible rates. 10,000+ businesses in Canada have saved $5,000,000 in shipping costs for over 6 million parcels with Stallion Express.
  • Customer service is top priority for us, which directly reflects in our consistent 4.8-star rating on Google!

Learn more about us here: https://stallionexpress.ca

Why work for us? What’s in it for you?
  • Be a part of a growing industry and a team that dedicates itself to being the best in the game!
  • Flexible health benefits after 3-month probation.
  • Bi-annual salary reviews.
  • Fun, friendly, and challenging work environment.
  • No dress-code!
  • Healthy office snacks, coffee, and tea.
  • Always work with up-to-date technology.
  • Opportunities to execute your own creative ideas without being micromanaged!
  • Opportunities for growth and to make a visible impact!
  • Grow your career with us!

Who are we looking for?
As a Warehouse Operations Branch Lead, you will be responsible for all day-to-day operations of the Montreal branch. You will need to have a strong operations background (a background in logistics or eCommerce is a huge asset) with experience in leading successful teams. You will also be the point of contact to some of our larger Montreal enterprise clients to ensure that their accounts are being looked after. Overall, you are someone who makes sound decisions, is extremely independent, reliable, client-focused, and values the importance of great culture in team building.

Responsibilities:
  • This position will report directly to the Head of Operations of Stallion Express. 
  • This role will also work very closely with our customer service team and account executives.
  • Ensure day-to-day operations adhere to all of Stallion's processes and protocols (some tasks include, but not limited to: shipping and receiving, sorting, scanning, processing, organizing, loading/unloading, providing customer service to walk in clients).
  • Communicate with key individuals within the organization to ensure smooth operations and clients are happy (via phone, email, and internal communication tools).
  • Oversee some of our enterprise accounts to ensure our clients are taken care of.
  • Provide coaching and valuable feedback to direct reports (warehouse team members, drivers, etc).
  • Set an example to the team by providing excellent customer service to Stallion's standards.
  • Ensure the team is adhering to all safety requirements.
  • Perform some administrative duties such as border documentation.
  • Promotes Stallion's culture and values within the team.

Training:
The CEO of Stallion Express is currently in Montreal and will train you until both parties feel you are able to run the show on your own!

Requirements:
  • 1-2 years of experience in an Operations Leadership role of a branch or facility (Logistics experience preferred). This is great to have but not mandatory, we can train the right person!
  • Valid G License and ability to enter the USA if needed.
  • Must be available to work 11 am-7 pm Monday to Fridays and 12 pm-3 pm on Sundays as needed.
  • Willing to accept full responsibility and accountability of all branch operations.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build trusting and supportive relationships with team members.
  • Must be trustworthy and reliable (it's you running the show!).
  • Able to stand for long periods of time and be physically fit to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Can multitask in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
  • Decisive, assertive, and strong communication skills.
  • Excellent computer skills.
  • Must be proactive and be comfortable helping out in all aspects of the operations when necessary.

Job Type: Full-time.

Salary: $45,000.00-$50,000.00 per year.




    About Stallion Express Inc.:

    Stallion Express is a Toronto-based company specializing in shipping and logistics solutions for online sellers. Our clients range from part-time eBay sellers to bigger eCommerce web stores, shipping hundreds of packages per day!We’re a dynamic team working towards a common vision: To help Canadian sellers ship parcels at the lowest possible rates. 10,000+ businesses in Canada have saved $5,000,000 in shipping costs for over 6 million parcels with Stallion Express. Customer service is a top priority for us, which directly reflects in our consistent 4.8-star rating on Google!Learn more about us at https://stallionexpress.ca

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Company Description

We are moving at full throttle over here at NAPA Auto Parts! Our Cambridge Distribution Center is at the core of keeping parts moving at throughout Ontario. Our mission is simple, we keep Canadians moving each day through outstanding customer experience, delivered by the most dedicated and trusted team in the industry. Join a team that is focussed on continuous improvement, safety and well being of our people and takes pride in why we put on our symbolic hat each day.

The successful Warehouse Manager, reporting to the Distribution Centre Operations Manager, will be responsible to recruit, motivate and develop a Team of Warehouse Supervisors and Lead Hands for them to achieve DC objectives, and ensure effective communication among all warehouse employees, as well as with suppliers and customers.

Job Description

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • An effective and motivated communicator, you will manage the activities of warehouse teams while maintaining transparency with our suppliers & customers.
  • A health & safety champion, you will drive a proactive and prevention geared health & safety program while ensuring early and safe return to work, proper accident reporting, and accident investigation processes.
  • With workplace cleanliness and organization in mind, you will ensure the highest standard of maintenance and housekeeping of the warehouse during its day-to-day operations.
  • You will manage the total movement, both inbound and outbound, of product in the warehouse.
  • You will manage the picking of customer orders accurately and on time delivery of picked products.
  • you will manage all aspects of receiving, put-away, stock location of supplier shipments
  • you will improve inventory plans, control stock movement and stock accuracy; and
  • you will effectively manage the processing of customer returns in an accurate and timely manner.
Qualifications

Qualifications:

  • Excellent employee and customer relations skills
  • Health & safety/HR employee relations knowledge
  • Seven (7) years of successful warehouse/distribution and operations experience
  • Solid knowledge of MS Office applications as well as new warehouse management technologies
  • Strong leadership skills with robust verbal & written communication skills
  • Ability to manage, motivate, and drive for results!
  • Courageous and proactive problem-solving, decision-making skills & organization
  • Team building, relationships development, mentoring and coaching emerging leaders, and drive for success!

If this sounds like the hat fits, we can’t wait to speak with you!



Additional Information

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Sort Manager- Warehouse Operations
description:
Job Summary:

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing team in an emerging Final Mile E-commerce business with Precision Home and Office Deliveries. We are seeking an outstanding Sort Center Manager to join our Final Mile team. The Sort Manager will drive engagement and execute excellence in our Sortation operations. The ideal candidate will be comfortable managing and inspiring a team, able to think strategically, while paying careful attention to detail, and enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic and data-intensive operations environment.

The successful candidate will be a natural self-starter who is comfortable supporting daily operational activities. This individual must have a curious mind-set, excellent analytical abilities, as well as superior written and verbal communication skills.

Please note you must be available to work nights/days and weekends when required, so flexibility is required.

Key Responsibilities:

Oversee and improve performance of all aspects of sortation operations including but not limited to:

  • Lead sort center activities across a shift and support coordination of staff plans and operating schedules.
  • Support developing and implementing process quality and continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Ensuring the assignment board is fully utilized for each shift.
  • Coordinating all sort hours with temp agencies and maintain KPIâ€™s.
  • Encourage and strengthen our strong culture of health and safety best practices.
    Contribute to cross-functional projects as needed.
  • Collaborating with partner supervisor and other leaders on the floor.
  • Addressing all safety infractions, and escalating where necessary.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in supply chain, logistics, engineering, business analytics or other technical discipline.
  • Proficiency in advanced MS Excel (macros, pivot tables, etc.)
  • Ability to prepare, report and interpret large sets of data.
  • Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.
  • Excellent inter-personal and relationship-building skills.
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • 2 years of professional supply chain and logistics, operations, and/or e-commerce experience.
  • 2 years of experience leading a frontline operations team.

Precision Home and Office Deliveries is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Precision is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request any accommodation, please notify your Recruiter

title: Warehouse Assistant Manager
description:
EQ3 was born in opposition to trends, vowing instead to focus on timeless designs. We make furniture not fast, but to last. Our greatest hope is to have our pieces passed down like heirlooms. We pride ourselves on being innovators in our industry, and we believe that the more voices and choices we incorporate into our perspective, the better we're able to find creative solutions for modern life. Everything we do is made in consideration of people, of the planet and of our space.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, collaborative individual to join our Warehouse Team as a Warehouse Assistant Manager.

THE DETAILS:

You'll be joining our Mont Royal team at 7900 Devonshire Road, in a full-time capacity

  • You'll keep the stock room organized, adjusting shelving to make way for new items, and replenishing items as the need arises
  • You'll work with Shipping and Receiving to help process shipments, review them for accuracy, keep inventory, and ensure items are properly price tagged before going to the floor
  • You'll be responsible for managing, coaching, and recruiting for the Stock Associate team
  • You'll work closely with the visual coordinator to create a dynamic, visually appealing storefront and maintain standards for merchandise presentation, signage and general housekeeping
  • You'll assist customers directly with in-store pickups, taking items to their cars as needed
  • You'll have a hand in building maintenance: identifying issues, scheduling repairs, and taking feedback from the building manager and service provider
  • You'll be reporting to the Warehouse Manager

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:

  • Minimum two (2) years of Warehouse Management experience
  • High school diploma/GED. Post-secondary courses in sales & retail customer service would be a bonus
  • Proficiency in retail operations and systems (Point of Sale, Microsoft Office)
  • Strong verbal/written communication skills. You should be comfortable motivating, coaching, and managing a retail team
  • Knowledge of the retail furniture industry with a strong understanding of marketplace potential
  • Knowledge and experience in building maintenance

WORK LIFE AT EQ3:

  • A company that supports work-life balance with paid time off and flexibility
  • Competitive compensation and benefit packages
  • Employee discount program for products, wellness plans, group banking and more
  • EQ3 Spirit Committee that promotes community engagement, rewards, and recognition for all employees
  • Surround yourself with a community that supports professional growth and collaboration

CLOSING DATE: Open until filled

HOW TO APPLY: Submit your complete application by clicking on “Apply to Position” now!

We thank all interested individuals, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: warehouse manager
description:
Are you a Warehouse Supervisor/Manager looking for your next opportunity in the London, Ontario area where you will work for an organization that knows their employees and you aren't just a number?
If you are someone who can take charge, delegate, and be humble enough to learn from your employees, then we've got the role for you!

This role will require you to:
- manage 10 -20 direct reports
- maintain strong communication with all levels of the organization
- arrange and negotiate rates for couriers
- be hands on and work alongside your employees assisting with picking, shipping, equipment operation
- maintain a strong grasp on inventory
- provide first class service to customers from coast to coast


Advantages
- straight day shift
- work for a manager that wants you to succeed and will provide all tools necessary to do so
- work with an experienced team
- $67000 - $78000, pending on your experience
- management wants you to take control of decision making
- tuition reimbursement for company approved courses
- fitness reimbursement
- discounts on everyday purchases
- 1 hour lunch break daily
- rrsp automatic and matching components
- bonus plan
- annual increases
- 3 weeks vacation to start
- closed between Christmas and New Years typically


Responsibilities
- inspire team members to perform at top level
- encourage teamwork and have fun with your employees
- maintain strong relationships
- order all consumables
- oversee anywhere from 10-20 employees (a mix of full time and contract employees)
- make decisions without the input from managment
- safe operation of industrial lifting equipment, including counterbalance and reach trucks
- maintaining inventory
- overseeing overtime shifts as needed (flex time will be provided)

Qualifications
- 7-10 years of experience in a Warehouse or Distribution Centre as a Warehouse Manager or Supervisor
- comfortable using the basics of the Microsoft office suite of programs (pivot tables, outlook, excel)
- it's beneficial if you have an educational background in Logistics or Supply Chain, but not required
- able to lead a team of tenured and newer employees
- able to handle making decisions without having the input from management on a constant basis
- extreme organization
- able to physically handle being on the floor, working alongside your employees for 50% of your shift
- live within an easy commute of London, Ontario

Summary
If you think that this may be the opportunity for you after reviewing the responsibilities and qualifications, then give Shannon a call at 519-679-0058 x2, or, email your application to shannon.davies@randstad.ca. You can also apply online at randstad.ca.



Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Service Delivery Manager


We are looking for a self-motivated, career driven, ambitious, candidate, experienced in IT service management with good communication skills and strong drive to deliver results and to grow a career in IT Application Managed Services.

The ideal candidate will work closely with Director of Client Engagement and Service Delivery as well as internal and external clients. If you are a driver in building client relationships with a strong IT consulting background, this will be the role for you.










Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

title: SuccessFactors SDM - SuccessFactors Service Delivery Manager (CDC) (Montreal, Quebec, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada 
All Available Locations: Montreal; Fredericton; Gatineau; Moncton; Quebec City; Saint John; Sherbrooke 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.


Have many careers in one Firm.
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Experience a firm where wellness matters.
 

 

At Deloitte, we are committed to recognizing, affirming and celebrating the diversity of opinion, talent and expertise that make each person unique.

A career in Consulting will offer you the opportunity to:

  • Work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective SuccessFactors field
  • Develop solutions through debate and discussion, in our teams and with clients
  • Continue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career path
  • Work with high profile clients on a variety of Canadian engagements

What will your typical day look like?

 

Deloitte is specifically looking to hire talented employees with experience in SuccessFactors. Experience with Workday, or Oracle will also be considered.
The roles and responsibilities of a SuccessFactors Service Manager within Deloitte’s Operate team are to provide professional and effective functional SuccessFactors support and expertise.


As a SuccessFactors Service Delivery Manager you will : 


•    Work in a collaborative team environment analyzing client issues and provide solutions through configurations, testing, meetings and knowledge transfer
•    Oversee and resolve incident management and case escalation flow to ensure investigations are performed in a timely manner and that roadblocks to resolution are removed
•    Track and drive appropriate performance objectives and measures to support team member and customer satisfaction while maintaining operational excellence and cost effectiveness
•    Cultivate strong relationships with clients by developing an understanding of customer's business and solution
•    Engage with customers to do regular health checks and advise on optimal utilization of their investment in SuccessFactors 
 

About the team

From our  Canadian Delivery Center, we work with the consultants to design, develop and build solutions to help clients reimagine, reshape and rewire the competitive fabric of entire industries. Our center house a multitude of specialists, ranging from systems designers, architects and integrators, to creative digital experts and Cyber Risk and Human Capital professionals. All work together on diverse projects from advanced preconfigured solutions and methodologies, to brand-building and campaign management. We are a unique blend of skills and experiences, yet we underline the value of each individual, providing customized career paths, fostering innovation and knowledge development with a focus on quality.

 

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone with :

•    Proven track record implementing and supporting SuccessFactors from a functional or Technical perspective
•    Strong problem solving and analytical skills
•    French and English bilingualism is preferred
•    Experience in a client facing role and working directly with senior client management team
•    Thorough understanding of the application support process
•    Proven ability to lead multiple workstreams simultaneously
•    Ability to work in a fast-paced and changing environment
 

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.


The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by [insert date].
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Director of Service (Contract, Full Time)
description:
Director of Service

Are you looking for an inviting and exciting career opportunity? Do you want to positively contribute to an organization that serves the community? If the answer is “Yes!" this is the job for you!

Catholic Social Services is currently recruiting for a contract, full time, forty (40) hours per week, Director of Service to join our Immigration & Settlement Service in Edmonton, AB.

This position is a one (1) year contract (benefits eligible).  Contract ending August 2023. 

You will be joining an established Agency that is guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect. With more than 60  years of service delivery, Catholic Social Services is one of the largest multi-function social services agencies in Canada, with more than 1800 staff, and hundreds of volunteers delivering 100+ programs throughout Edmonton and Central Alberta.

Job Summary:

Reporting to the Vice President of Service, the Director plans, organizes, and directs the activities of the various departments. This position is part of the Service senior leadership team that carries out the overall strategy to develop, implement, monitor and evaluate programs. The Director will promote traditional and non-traditional partnership approaches implementing initiatives designed to integrate services and utilize funding to maximize resources and service impact within the community. The Director ensures delivery of quality of services and compliance with regulatory and funding requirements. This includes planning and development of programs and procedures in accordance with the Agency mission. The Director will manage budgets, quality assurance and will play a large role in the ongoing support and development of the staff.

Job Duties

  • Proactively build and maintain strategic collaborations and coalitions of stakeholders beneficial to the Agency based on a strategic understanding of the Agency’s mandate and challenges.
  • Take a long-term view of the needs of the Agency when focusing on potential alignments.
  • Identify interdependencies, define priorities and drive resolution of issues across groups, as appropriate.
  • Create and participate in strategic alliances and partnerships with key stakeholders to better meet emerging and future client needs and enhance the Agency and/or sector’s long term strategy.
  • Work with funding agencies and representatives to ensure ongoing and sustainable funding for programs. Foresee obstacles, risks and opportunities for the Agency (with a long-term horizon) and act accordingly.
  • Defines issues, generates opinions and selects solutions that are consistent with the strategy and vision.
  • Scan, seek out and assesses information on potential future directions.
  • Oversee the general management and accountability requirements of a comprehensive group of programs, which includes program development, delivery and evaluation as well as budget preparation and setting and knowledge management.
  • Maintain awareness of the external and internal social/human service, political and economic landscapes.
  • Stays knowledgeable about current legislation and policies affecting newcomers, including refugees, immigrants, temporary foreign works and others.
  • Collaborate with other members of the Service Leadership team to promote the Agency’s mission by identifying and developing programs/services to meet current and future  needs of newcomers and communities.
  • Engage others in order to accomplish organizational goals and strategies, with a commitment to succession planning.
  • Attract, develop, coach, and retain high-performance team members, empowering them to elevate their level of responsibility, span of control and performance.
  • Delegate full authority and responsibility with the latitude to do a task in their own way in order to develop specific characteristics, including the opportunity to make and learn from mistakes in a non-critical setting.
  • Encourage others to assess their strengths and weaknesses, career goals, and strategies for achieving them.
  • Together with the Vice President, will have overall responsibility for the Service resource allocation, including staffing, financial and property.
  • Develop the necessary systems, processes, protocols and tools to better support the facilitation, collection and sharing of knowledge that is generated by the programs.
  • Ensure Service activities comply with organizational requirements for quality management, legal compliance and client services.
  • Recognize the inherent risks involved in the delivery of social service programming and able to identify, evaluate and develop strategies to mitigate risk while maintaining quality service delivery and care.
  • Keep the Vice President informed of the department’s operations, including strategies to respond to emerging and evolving  program and operation needs.
  • Participate in the recruitment and appointment of Service Program Managers.
  • Convene, conduct and ensure serious occurrences and internal investigations are completed in accordance with Agency protocols and expectations.
  • Manage high-risk, complex, sensitive and multidisciplinary issues.
  • Prepare/coordinate multiple funding proposals and applications and interim and final reports.
  • Be familiar with funding, contract and accountability obligations and requirements.
  • Have experience with the management of multiple immigrant and refugee services.
  • Contributing to a communication strategy, supporting website updates/development and social media promotion.
  • Commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion development initiatives.

Requirements

Education & Experience

  • Master degree in related human services discipline or equivalent.
  • An experienced leader with 7 years or more of progressive leadership in a social services organization, with multi-site programs and services, multiple funders, including the immigrant settlement and refugee  serving sector.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced cross-cultural and diverse environment.

Skills and Abilities:

  • The ideal candidate will have a track record of effectively leading a performance-based and outcomes based multiple program and staff. The individual will demonstrate maturity, self-awareness and insightfulness and possesses high ethical standards and an uncompromising sense of integrity.
  • Strategic thinker who is able to analyze internal and external environmental factors in order to identify current and future opportunities, challenges and risks and ensure ongoing service excellence
  • The ideal candidate will be passionate about the mission of the Catholic Social Services and understands the intricacies of the nonprofit sector, including the immigrant settlement sector.
  • Be a voice/advocate for Catholic Social Services, is a persuasive, credible and an effective communicator, including experience with public speaking and media relations
  • Be a strong negotiator, problem solver and possess excellent conflict resolution skills and have experience in solving complex issues.
  • Knowledgeable about immigration, settlement and adjustment issues affecting newcomers.

 

Please apply online at www.cssalberta.ca/careers to competition number 2745.

Closing date for Applications: May 11, 2022 

The successful candidate must be able to travel to various locations, have a valid driver’s license and possess a vehicle. They will have ability to travel, with some overnight stays, if required.

If you are a strategic leader who consistently provides high quality and effective results, please submit your application today.

We offera competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package and a supportive working environment.

Police Information Check, Intervention Record Check and/or summary of driving record are conditions of employment and the financial responsibility of the candidate.

We embrace diversity and offer equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless of origin, culture, ethnicity, age, ability, gender identity, sexual orientation,  and people of faith or no faith.

We thank all applicants. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Foresee obstacles, risks and opportunities for the Agency (with a long-term horizon) and act accordingly.', 'Identify interdependencies, define priorities and drive resolution of issues across groups, as appropriate.', 'Oversee the general management and accountability requirements of a comprehensive group of programs, which includes program development, delivery and evaluation as well as budget preparation and setting and knowledge management.', 'Education & Experience', 'Develop the necessary systems, processes, protocols and tools to better support the facilitation, collection and sharing of knowledge that is generated by the programs.', 'Strategic thinker who is able to analyze internal and external environmental factors in order to identify current and future opportunities, challenges and risks and ensure ongoing service excellence', 'Encourage others to assess their strengths and weaknesses, career goals, and strategies for achieving them.']

title: Grinding & Terminal Manager
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview:

 

The Grinding & Terminal Managerâ€™s primary objective is to manage the grinding of cementitious and non-cementitious products through the finish mill(s) at Woodstock as well as manage and coordinate truck and rail unloading, distribution, storage and blending activities of the terminal facilities. The incumbent will oversee facility optimization while maintaining the high level of performance standards in safety, production, quality and customer service at Woodstock and operating within environmental regulations consistent with the business strategy and objectives of ECAN and the existing certificates of the Woodstock facility. In addition, this role will act as a liaison between the manufacturing, sales and logistics functions to analyze infrastructure requirements and make recommendations to the required parties. Lastly, the incumbent is responsible for the purchasing of supplies, equipment and managing of capital projects.

Responsibilities:

 

Safety:

  • The primary focus of the Grinding & Terminal Manager is to safely and efficiently manage the assets of the plant to drive for performance through its grinding operations and distribution terminal.
  • Development and implementation of activities related to functional and safety training throughout the facility, as well as training related to manufacturing & terminal specific operations, policies and procedures.

 

Compliance & Environment:

  • Ensure that facility is compliant with all environmental and safety requirements through on-site leadership related to conducting training and completing all required documentation of training events.
  • The incumbent must co-ordinate the incoming rail car and truck shipments to assure quick, efficient and environmentally clean unloading at the terminals.
  • The incumbent must ensure all activities related to environmental requirements on the grinding side is maintained to meet certificate and regulatory requirements.

 

Human Resources:

  • Responsible for managing workforce from recruitment, training, disciplinary actions and terminations.  
  • The incumbent will foster effective employee relations with the union and ensure employees have a daily job list and inform them as soon as possible of any irregular work hours.
  • Coaching and development of the workforce including the preparation and management of individual development plans.

 

Operational Performance:

  • Responsible for effective and efficient utilization of mill(s) to grind materials to support the needs of the customers and as per the countries directive.
  • Responsible for planning production schedules, optimizing equipment and maximizing quality cement production safely, within budgeted costs.
  • Coordinate the ordering and purchasing of raw materials, grinding media, fuels, etc to meet budgeted production while maintaining adequate inventories.
  • Ensure effective troubleshooting of any problems in the department using direct reports and other departments as required. Coordinate with the proper department to have these problems repaired as quickly as possible to minimize downtime.
  • Effectively manage the operating budgets to ensure costs are controlled and objectives are met
  • An effective inventory management strategy utilizing communication of potential issues to manufacturing, sales and distribution to reduce the risk of customer service issues
  • Responsible for updating standard operating procedures for process modifications and/or equipment additions.
  • Implement and track maintenance, production processes and strategies to achieve targeted Key Performance Indicators (KPIâ€™s).
  • Employ daily communication process with management and Quality to drive group efficiencies, manage inventories and production performance.
  • Ensures systems are in place to effectively and accurately monitor key indicators (including monthly and annual adjustments) and consumption variables such as labour, subcontracting, energy, and fuel.

 

Maintenance:

  • Responsible for the annual maintenance budgets planning and monitoring process (i.e. plant and HME tires, wear parts, etc.) for all operations.
  • Report monthly on spend/variances, and ensure maintenance programs are implemented and budgets are met.
  • The incumbent is responsible housekeeping of the site, and updating the mechanical and electrical preventive maintenance programs.
  • The incumbent is responsible for the initiation of appropriation requests for improvements or modifications to the site that ensure economic viability for the operations and distribution of product.

Specific Accountabilities:  

  • Co-ordinate with Area Manager, sales managers, logistics managers, shipping locations, and carriers to ensure adequate inventories.
  • To operate the site in a safe and efficient manner. Administer all Health and Safety programs and ensure that all Company safety standards are met.
  • To attain optimum quantity and quality of production by utilizing manpower and equipment efficiently and safely.
  • Maintain good employee relations and promote a harmonious working environment within the manufacturing, sales and logistics team as well as other Lafarge product lines.
  • To provide training and development of staff to ensure continuity for the siteâ€™s operations.
  • Provide long term vision to ensure the terminal is positioned to meet long-term market requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with local environmental regulations and maintain a good corporate image in the community.
  • Prepare and submit capital and operating budgets to the Area Slag Grinding Plant Manager.
  • Management and implementation of a preventative maintenance program for the terminals.

Dimensions

Number of Employees:   20-28                                                                                                    

Annual throughput: 130 K+ Metric Tonnes (grinding) & 300K+ Metric Tonnes (terminal)

Qualifications:

 

Education:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree or equivalent in Finance, Construction Management, Engineering or other related fields.
  • 7-10 years of work experience in construction or manufacturing related fields.
  • Safety certifications a plus.

 

 

Job Specific Competency Profile (Lominger):

  • Informing
  • Planning
  • Drive for Results
  • Functional/Technical Skills
  • Problem Solving
  • Managing Through Systems
LafargeHolcim:

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.  

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodations are available on request for  candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Assistant Warehouse Manager
description:
Grow With Us!

 

Hudson is North America's leading travel retailer. For over 30 years, Hudson has met the needs and wants of travelers in more than 1,000 duty-free, duty-paid, and food & beverage stores. We couldn’t serve our customers, landlords, and partners in airports, commuter terminals, hotels, and casinos without the continued support of our greatest assets: our team members. We’re dedicated to hiring and training exceptional team members, who are committed to serving the customer as the Traveler’s Best Friend. We strive to ensure we’re fulfilling our team members' career potentials through training, skills-development, and career pathways – as our team members grow and succeed both personally and professionally, so does Hudson.

 

What We Will Offer You:

 

  • Competitive Salary
  • Health & Well Being: Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
  • Universal Life Insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Retirement Programs & Matching Employee Contributions: RRSP
  • A 20% of Hudson Employee Discount
  • A 50% off Hudson Food & Beverage Discount

 

 

This Assistant Warehouse Manager Job Is For You, If You Would Enjoy:

 

  • Managing and executing all activities of the warehouse in support of the overall operation;
  • Helping to promote an overall corporate image of excellence through a strong work ethic, leadership by example,
  • Providing consistent delivery of excellent customer service throughout the warehouse operation.
  • Working in the Warehouse at Halifax Stanfield International Airport

 

Your Team is counting on you as an Assistant Warehouse Manager to:

 

  • Provide full flexible and open availability to work any shift throughout the day (between the hours of 6:00 am and 9:00 pm), any day of the week, including weekends & holidays
  • Work a full-time schedule

 

 

Assistant Warehouse Manager Key Duties:

 

  • Protects all company assets in the warehouse including non-stock merchandise.
  • Provides a safe and clean environment for warehouse personnel.
  • Recruits and trains warehouse personnel.
  • Schedules warehouse operational hours to accommodate business requirements.
  • Supervises and delegates tasks to warehouse employees.
  • Places stock orders as required.
  • Counts and receives incoming merchandise; reports shortages/overages to vendors in a timely manner, before required deadlines.
  • Counts and completes all appropriate paperwork for merchandise returns to vendors.
  • Adjusts prices (mark ups/ mark-downs) as per the General Manager’s instructions.
  • Provides ongoing stock replenishment to the sales floor.
  • Isolates, sorts, and organizes all damaged and outdated products for subsequent supplier credits and returns.
  • Organizes all preparatory work for quarterly press counts and annual inventory.
  • Consults and helps plan activities with Warehouse Manager; manages the activities of warehouse staff.
  • Provides supervision, guidance and support to warehouse staff.
  • Works with vendors, on-site jobbers and sales representatives.
  • Communicates with home office personnel.

 

 

Required Qualifications:

 

  • Minimum 6 months warehouse manager/supervisor experience
  • High organizational and administrative skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Must be well versed with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook)
  • SAP – inventory control
  • Leadership qualities and demonstrated organizational skills.
  • Good time-management skills and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to multi-task.
  • Requires the ability to speak, read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence, and policy documents, as well as converse comfortably with subordinates.
  • The ability to lift and/or move up to 20 kg / 40 lbs
  • Requires the ability to bend, twist, and stand to perform normal job functions

 

 

Preferred Qualifications:

 

  • Retail and/or office management beneficial

 

 

Some of our company-offered benefits for you and your family include:

 

  • Health & Well Being: Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
  • Paid Time Off
  • Various Personal and Parental Leave Programs
  • Universal Life Insurance
  • Retirement Programs & Matching Employee Contributions: 401K & RRSP
  • Employee Recognition & Anniversary Programs
  • Training, Development, and Growth Opportunities
  • Tuition Assistance & Scholarship Programs
  • Referral Bonus Program

 

 

“Depending on the location of the position, applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States or Canada for any employer.”

“Hudson is an Equal Opportunity Employer of all qualified individuals. All employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin,disability, military leave or veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace in which we value diversity and unique experiences, backgrounds and identities.”

 

All offers are contingent upon successful completion and passing of background checks and/or employment verification results.

 

 

Note to staffing agencies: Please do not contact Hudson (including the recruitment team or any hiring managers) regarding this position with candidates. If assistance is needed in filling any position for Hudson, a member of our recruiting team will reach out directly.

title: Warehouse Manager in Training
description:
Overview

LEON’S IS NOW HIRING A WAREHOUSE MANAGER IN TRAINING

 

WITH CANADA’S MOST SUCCESSFUL HOME FURNISHING RETAILER, THERE’S NO LIMIT TO WHERE YOU

CAN GO!

Leon’s Furniture Ltd. is a family-owned, publicly traded company that has been a part of Canadian homes, and families for more than a century. We are committed to providing our dedicated associates with secure jobs, and a safe and satisfying work environment, and will strive to support their ongoing pursuit of personal development and career advancement.

Presently, Leon’s is looking for talented applicants for Warehouse Manager in Training position. The ideal candidate has the drive and determination to continue to make Leon’s the number one choice for the Canadian consumer, and shares our core values, which are deeply embedded in our culture and reflected in our actions: Honesty. Integrity. Hard work. Family.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ensuring the smooth operation of a busy warehouse with several areas of responsibility, including shipping and receiving, inventory, delivery, merchandising, packaging and maintenance
  • Ensuring the accurate and secure handling of product; balancing a large inventory
  • Overseeing maintenance and ensuring safe operation of lift trucks, warehouse bins, delivery trucks, service vehicles
  • Training and people development
  • Interviewing and hiring
  • Scheduling; ensuring provincial legislative requirements met
  • Completing, reviewing and distributing warehouse reports regularly
  • Resolving customer issues; ensuring safe delivery of product
  • Ensuring company policies and procedures are met
  • Ensuring general safety and security of store and employees
  • Chairing Health and Safety and warehouse meetings
  • Other duties as assigned

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR IN A WAREHOUSE MANAGER IN TRAINING?

  • High energy
  • Strong leadership and people skills
  • Ability to train and develop others to succeed
  • Goal oriented
  • Ambitious and eager to grow
  • And most importantly, a POSITIVE ATTITUDE!

WHY LEON’S?

  • On-going training and development to ensure your success
  • A fast-paced, dynamic, and fun environment with a great team
  • A generous employee discount program
  • Profit sharing

 

ONE SIMPLE CLICK COULD CHANGE YOUR LIFE. APPLY NOW.

title: Dock Manager - Sudbury
description:
Company Description

For 60 years, Manitoulin Transport has been providing comprehensive transportation and logistics solutions for clients across North America. Our success lies in our innovation and safety, and our dedication to reliable, on-time delivery. So, if you know where you’re headed, we have the training and career development to help you get there .

Job Description

Supervising 20 dock workers and foreman while carrying out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws

Assign job tasks to dock foreman and workers, according to loading and unloading schedules.

Observe loading to determine conformance to loading patterns and to prevent shifting or damage to materials or products during transit.

Studies production schedules and estimates worker hour requirements for completion of job assignments.

Interprets company policies to workers and enforces safety regulations. 

Establishes or adjusts work procedures to meet schedules in conjunction with dispatch.

Analyze and resolve work problems, as well as train workers.

Review the day's events, resolving issues with Central Dispatch,  and reporting to Management daily.

Responsible for cost reductions where business warrants, and managing the dock in the most organized and efficient manner while focusing on financial and service targets.

Qualifications

Responsibilities include planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees.  Addressing complaints and resolving problems and ensuring the freight is not sitting and is either being loaded for delivery or for transfer.

Other duties as assigned.

Minimum 3 years dock experience.

Knowledgeable of equipment and handling procedures with regards to the trucking industry.

Strong leadership and time management skills with the ability to prioritize and organize.

Geographic knowledge of the areas we service.

Good communication skills both oral and written.  Problem-solving capabilities.  

Computer skills for preparing reports.

Basic math skills for cubing, adding, etc



Additional Information

  • Competitive Wages
  • Comprehensive Benefits Program
  • Profit Sharing Opportunities
  • Opportunities for growth and advancement

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Company Description

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

The Warehouse Manager, reporting to the Real Property Services Manager, is a key member of the contract team at a historical remote location in the Canadian Arctic. In this position, you are responsible for maintaining proper warehouse orderliness for all infrastructure workshops and storage areas, ensuring that orders are tracked and not duplicated, records are maintained for all items received, and that materiel is stored in an orderly fashion on labelled shelves to facilitate inventory control. An 8 weeks on, 8 weeks off rotational schedule with flights to and from the worksite in Nunavut leaving from Trenton, Ontario. A unique opportunity to contribute to the operation of an entire community supporting members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

This position requires Government of Canada security clearance at the Reliability Status level.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Day-to-day operation and accountability for the contract site warehouse.
  • Procurement through Department of National Defense (DND) using DND processes and protocols.
  • Responsible for warehouse operations, such as expediting purchases, maintaining communications with vendors, receiving and verifying the accuracy of shipments, stocking shelves, and auditing documentation.
  • Playing a key role in the development, implementation and monitoring of effective processes and procedures in the warehouse.
  • Setup layout and space management; work organization chart; procedures such as SOP.
  • Manage stock control: the self-assured receipt, storage, retrieval and timely delivery of goods; shipment loading and transferring; document recording and data entry into system.
  • Plan, organize and control warehouse’s over-all operations.
  • Constantly plan out all warehouse resources and activities in relation to client contract statement of work and company objectives and set targets.
  • Responsible for weekly sustainment offloading and transport of material to the supply depot.
  • Perform monthly inventory and complete inventory count sheets and reports.
  • Responsible for life cycling of material, physical reorganization of material, completion.
  • Perform client directed tasks to assist with material verifications and maintenance of site storage locations.
  • Coordinate the disposal of and/or backhaul transportation of time expired, worn, redundant and scrap items from the warehouse.
Qualifications

  • Minimum Grade 12 education; however, preference will be given to individuals with a university or technical education background.
  • Completion of Material Handling and Management.
  • Must possess forklift operator license.
  • Current First Aid training certificate is an asset.
  • Ability to obtain Government of Canada security clearance at the Reliability Status level (requires a 5 year background check and Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency).
  • Ability to obtain fit-for-duty medical assessment from a physician.
  • Experience working in remote locations is an asset.
  • Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS Excel, MS Word, and inventory control software.
  • Punctual, reliable and schedule focused.
  • Experience with warehouse management system and experience with implementation processes.
  • Excellent communication, both written and oral.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Ability to problem solve and make decisions.
  • Excellent multi-tasking, time management and organizational skills.
  • Possess strong ability to develop and maintain positive interpersonal relationships, with the flexibility and ability to work independently with minimum supervision and within a team environment.
  • Inuit cultural awareness, knowledge and respect.
  • Flexibility to meet the unique requirements of the site including potential rotational shift changes and working after hours “on-call” duties.


Additional Information

  • An opportunity for work life balance. 8 weeks on and 8 weeks off allows you to use your time to do what you enjoy.
  • Continuous wage payment throughout your time off.
  • Competitive wages, benefits and an RSP matching program.
  • Retention Bonus of up to 10% of wages earned paid on the completion of a 2 year contract.
  • Paid travel time.
  • Unique experience in the northernmost continuously inhabited place in the world.
  • Training and development opportunities to help grow and diversify your career.
  • Transfer opportunities to other Dexterra sites across Canada.

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.
